results.description:
After the success of our first event in February, Formlabs, the designer and manufacturer of powerful and accessible 3D printing systems, is returning to Brooklyn with hands-on courses!  3D printing experts will take you through the entire process from the PreForm software, to setting up the printer, to finishing your printed piece. 

Whether you're already a user or brand new to 3D printing, come join us for a night of teaching and learning, sharing tips and tricks, and showing off the 3D prints you've been working on. Bring your laptops to get on-site feedback and advanced instruction on PreForm.   

Of course, light refreshments and libations will be provided. 

 We look forward to seeing you, and please feel free to invite your friends! 

Art Gallery 

At this event, we will also be hosting a 3D printed art gallery. If interested in participating, please message us with your model and we can see if its a right fit for our gallery. All are welcome to submit pieces.  

Nights Schedule 

6:30 Doors open Light refreshments and cocktails will be served while attendees can peruse the pieces in the art gallery. 

7:15 Character design with ZBrush with Mike Defeo: 

Mike Defeo who brought us characters from such hits as the Ice Age saga, Horton Hears a Who, The Lorax, Despicable Me, Minions, ALIEN 3, and Fight Club, will be demoing how he designs characters in ZBrush. 

 7:45 T-splines with Jean Gorospe:

Jean Gorospe will be demoing how to take polygon files and convert them to vector files for use in milling and tooling situations. 

8:15 Formlabs PreForm software class with an engineer from Formlabs: Get an in-depth tutorial on how to properly use PreForm for great printing results.

8:45 Part finishing with Brett Klisch: Event host Brett Klisch will be taking audience members step-by-step on how to remove your part from the machine and clean it, remove the supports safely, remove support materials, and finish your part.
results.name: Educational Course on 3D modeling, PreForm, and Post-processing  with 3D Hubs

results.description:
Our typical agenda: - We orient new visitors and then chat a bit, as by sharing what's new or good in our lives. - Then we meditate together by chanting mantra followed by the beautiful sounds of the gong - And finally we share thoughts and questions, learning something new sometimes, generally supporting each other best we can.

Note that we meet every Wednesday, 7:00 to 8:30 pm, and every Saturday, 2 to 3:30 pm -- except for the first Saturday of the month, when we begin our meeting at 5 pm followed by an informal potluck social. If you are planning on staying for the potluck, be sure to visit www.perfectpotluck.com to enter your food selection. The website will help you decide what food to contribute to the potluck to make sure we have a healthy, balanced meal.

By the way, the meetup page may show only a few members planning to attend a particular meeting. That's because many people attend regularly and don't bother to RSVP for each meeting.   We never have only a few members at a meeting. A dozen or more usually attend each meeting. The special potluck meetings we hold the first Saturday of each month has an average attendance of two dozen people.

Call Merrill or Mataji anytime you have questions:[masked]-5334.
results.name: American Meditation Society - Weekly Wednesday Meetup in White Plains

results.description:
The Dating & Marriage Connect Group is for single, dating and married women. We will discuss importance of inviting God to be a part of your love story, and will delve into key Bible passages that will encourage, equip, challenge, and prepare women to enter marriage with confidence. Learn how God designed marriage to function, what character qualities to look for in finding a future husband, and how to prepare to have a thriving marriage.


We will learn from the women of Proverbs, and examine Ephesians 5, I Corinthians 7, Titus 2, I Timothy 3, I Peter 3, and many more passages.

Week One: Understanding God’s Design for Marriage


Week Two: What a Man of God Looks Like


Week Three: What a Woman of God Looks Like


Week Four: Embracing Your Singleness & Getting Ready for Marriage

Wednesdays, 7:00-8:30pm April 13 - May 4th (4 weeks)
Location: Battery Park Manhattan, Brookfield Place (230 Vesey Street)
Contact: Renata ([masked])

HopeHill.com
#HopeHillNYC
results.name: Dating & Marriage for Single Women. Connect Group.

results.description:
We're starting to do one-off meetings on papers and special topics again! If you have any suggestions for one, please feel free to email me a paper or topic suggestion (and any references you have) and we can do a meeting about it! If you'd like to present yourself, you're welcome to! There will be more details coming out shortly in an email.

This meeting will be about sub-linear time algorithms! It's pretty cool that you can calculate some graph properties with algorithms that run in less than linear time in the size of the graph! We'll look at some of the principles behind these algorithms to get a feel for how they work, and maybe play with some implementations if we can find them!

We're an extremely casual meetup, so the format will be something more like a group discussion than a lecture.  None of us are necessarily experts on sub-linear algorithms, but we can all benefit from getting together to talk about a topic and compare notes!

Resources:
Kirill suggested this video:


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_kos3_LVpJI

A quick google search brings up this review paper, which looks pretty decent:
http://www.wisdom.weizmann.ac.il/~oded/PTW/sublin.pdf

There was also this little list of papers:
http://people.csail.mit.edu/ronitt/sublinear.html
results.name: Sublinear-time Algorithms

results.description:
Dearest Beloveds,

I am deeply honored and grateful to share this 10 month journey of The Path Of Love with each of you.

The Path of Love opens you to the energy of creation and calls to you to open your heart gateway to your eternal self so that you may begin to anchor all that you are upon the Earth in unconditional love and open embrace of your Divinity.

This is the creation dreaming path where you enter the void and begin to access your highest potential through an open heart. It is here that you begin to see all the possibilities that are open for you and know that each choice you make brings you close to your divine power.

It is a deep path of self discovery where all is illuminated and you are called to embrace and honour yourself deeply. The Path of Love is the road home to all that you are.

Much Love and Gratitude,

Julie

The Path Of Love course was channeled by Ishtar, an embodied Ascended Master channel from Australia. Please visit her website: by clicking here

"Be the change you wish to see in the world". ~~ Ghandi

results.description:
I'm pleased to announce Noah Ross will join us at Knotel next week to talk about building great stuff. Plus there will be FREE BEER.

Noah is a Partner and Chief Creative Officer of Launchpad Advertising in New York City, an award-winning full-service agency. Over the last 12 years Noah has launched products and multidisciplinary campaigns for brands including LG, Conde Nast, NimbleTV, Xbox, CenturyLink, Knoll, Absolut, Gatorade, Southern Comfort, The Tony Awards and DL1961 Jeans. Prior to joining Launchpad, he’s served creative tenures at Fathom, TracyLocke and McCann-Erickson, and worked on a feature film in between. His work has been featured in The New York Times, LA Times, New York Magazine, Huffington Post, Gawker, Communication Arts, and 7 international film festivals, including a world premier at International Film Festival Rotterdam and a screening at Cannes. Launchpad was named on the Inc500/5000 list of fastest growing private companies in the U.S. Every year since 2012.
results.name: How To Build Great Stuff

results.description:
We'll meet at the Main Street School parking lot for a loop run to Tarrytown and back. This is a lovely "run in the dark" with Hudson River views. Total distance is just over 4 miles. 

Details about the run

Route: We’ll leave promptly at 7pm from the Main Street School parking lot. We'll head north on the Old Croton Aqueduct Trail, and turn left (west) at the Lyndhurst greenhouses to connect to the Riverwalk. At the Riverwalk we'll continue north to Van Wart Ave, before turning right (east) to return to Broadway for the run back to Irvington. A route map is available here. 

Special equipment: Headlamp or small flashlight (winter months)

Modifications for a shorter/slower-paced run: At various points runners can divert east toward Broadway and head back to Irvington.

Water/Bag Storage: There are no water fountains along the route, so bring a water bottle if you need one while running. If the weather is warm, I’ll bring water and cups for after the run. There’s no bag storage, so leave belongings at home or in your car.


Location: Main Street School parking lot (101 Main St)

Join our Facebook group to post pictures or message other members.

General advice & guidelines for our regular meetup runs

• RSVP if you are going. If your plans change, simply change your RSVP.

• There is no bag storage, so please bring only what you plan to run with.

• All regular runs are rain or shine, unless the weather is actually dangerous.

• If you arrive late, can’t find the start location, miss us for any reason, run anyway!

Feel free to contact me either via my meetup account or at [masked] if you have any questions.
results.name: Irvington to Tarrytown Loop

results.description:
Presented by Brian Mitchell.

There are many aspects of the Erlang/OTP/BEAM stack that make it a great way to build applications. Sometimes it's hard to understand how these all play together. In particular, most interesting aspects of how Erlang eventually gets compiled and run on BEAM are left to the imagination. This talk will give a glimpse at what actually happens to your code as it runs through the many layers: compilers, intermediate representations, byte codes, and direct threaded register machines.


Bio:
Brian Mitchell works on distributed systems at Jet.com. He enjoys writing code in a number of functional programming languages including Erlang. While he's an outspoken advocate of Erlang and the BEAM it runs on, he also enjoys exploring many kinds of programming languages and their design.

https://twitter.com/cddddr
results.name: Erlang's Journey to the Center of the BEAM

results.description:
Come out and enjoy a movie on us! Download your pass while supplies last. Join us for an advance screening of Barber Shop: The Next Cut

For free ticket information and FREE PASS, head over to our new community site, event page: 

http://visualcreativescollective.com/event/advance-movie-screening-barber-shop-next-cut/ 

ONCE THERE PLEASE FOLLOW THE INSTRUCTIONS FOR YOUR FREE PASSES

★Let us know in the Comment section below if when you receive an email confirmation. (Also, feel free to ask questions if you are encountering obstacles.) 

♦♦♦♦♦ Important, please keep reading ♦♦♦♦♦

Suggested arrival time is about 1 hour early. You will need to get in line with the others. The movie begins at 7 and this is first come, first serve. If you show up too late, you may not get in. Also, come early if you come with someone to make sure that you can sit together.

DO NOT SIGN UP IF YOU ARE NOT GOING TO ATTEND OR YOU THINK SOMETHING WILL COME UP. The promo company receives the names of all who sign up and can see who does not use their ticket. Your no-show can affect future free movie offers and we don’t want to mess that up. You may also be banned from future screenings! 

ADDITIONAL NOTES:

⍟ RSVPing on MeetUp alone does not get you a movie pass. Follow the above instructions for your tickets.  

⍟ Security may require ID. 

⍟MAKE SURE WE HAVE YOUR NAME AND EMAIL FOR UPDATES! 

Screening starts on time. Arrive early. Seating is first-come, first-serve. Theater is overbooked to ensure capacity. Latecomers will not be admitted. 

Must show ID. Only the person whose name is on the pass may use the pass. Tickets will only be given to guests who are present. Arrive with your entire party to be seated promptly.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=g2tacfpfpE0

It’s been more than 10 years since our last appointment at Calvin’s Barbershop.  Calvin (Ice Cube) and his longtime crew, including Eddie (Cedric the Entertainer), are still there, but the shop has undergone some major changes.  Most noticeably, our once male-dominated sanctuary is now co-ed.  The ladies bring their own flavor, drama and gossip to the shop challenging the fellas at every turn.  Despite the good times and camaraderie within the shop, the surrounding community has taken a turn for the worse, forcing Calvin and our crew to come together to not only save the shop, but their neighborhood.

Barbershopmovie.com

BARBERSHOP: THE NEXT CUT is in theaters Friday, April 15. Rated PG-13.
results.name: Advance Movie Screening: "Barber Shop: The Next Cut"

results.description:
We'll be introducing and discussing best practices for using Trailblazer in your code.

A bit about Trailblazer:

"Trailblazer is a thin layer on top of Rails. It gently enforces encapsulation, an intuitive code structure and gives you an object-oriented architecture.

While Trailblazer offers you abstraction layers for all aspects of Ruby On Rails, it does not missionize you. Wherever you want, you may fall back to the "Rails Way" with fat models, monolithic controllers, global helpers, etc. This is not a bad thing, but allows you to step-wise introduce Trailblazer's encapsulation in your app without having to rewrite it.

Trailblazer is all about structure. It helps re-organize existing code into smaller components where different concerns are handled in separated classes."

Food starts at 6:30pm, and the discussion begins at 7pm. 


See you soon!
results.name: Trailblazer -- Encapsulate Your Code!

Do you have regrets about a relationship with a family member? 

This round table discussion will focus on the topic of regret in relationship to family. Over an hour or so, participants will be sharing stories and mapping the anatomy of this emotion. We will be pausing on understanding how regret feels, rather than necessarily how to overcome it. 

The group and discussions are gently facilitated by a design consultancy specializing in social and emotional well-being, mattermindstudio.com. 

*This discussion starts promptly at 7:00. 

* Separate from this Round Table meetup, there is an opportunity to share your story with a greater audience (video and story featuring your story). Please be in touch or attend the workshop for more information.

*We'll be serving light refreshments, but feel free to bring your own lunch! 

*This group nor the conversations are facilitated by licensed mental health professionals.

results.description:
“…to be successful in life you need values, you need integrity, you need a vision, you need energy, and you need dynamism. And spirituality is the one thing that gives it all to you. If you are healthy, you can see better, you can eat better, you can speak better, you can hear better and you can run better. All this depends on just one thing. Similarly that which enriches your spirit is so essential to enrich all other aspects of life.” -Sri Sri Ravi Shankar, Founder, Art of Living Foundation

Whatever we do in life, it is all directed towards being happy. Why do we even do some service to somebody? It is because it gives some happiness to us. So anything we do in our life is directed towards achieving happiness, greater happiness, and even greater happiness. That’s how the mind goes. Yet, are we happy? Yes, some times. But often not!

This free seminar examines what comes in the way of our happiness. There will be a discussion on tools that can lead us to happiness – tools that every human being is privileged to learn and use. Come, relax, refresh and smile.

Alex

results.description:
Come join us for our climbing Meetup!!

As usual, everyone is welcome to join in on the fun as long as you're at least 18 years old, whether you’re a complete beginner just looking to give the sport a try or a seasoned veteran that can show the best of us a few new tricks. Bring your friends too, even if they've never tried climbing before. We'll make sure everybody is set up and having a blast. Age and strength don't even matter, everybody has fun.

1st time climbers at The Rock Club get in for FREE! All you have to do is rent a harness and shoes for $10.25. Returning Meetupers get a discounted daypass rate of $15. And be sure to have a look out at the gym for other special Meetup discounts.

We also host a special Meetup 101 class from 7:30 - 9pm for Meetup members only. When multiple people sign-up for the class you pay only $45 ($15 discount!).

Reserve your spot with the booking button and enter the promo code "Meetup" on the booking page.

IMPORTANT!!  This offer has restrictions. It is only valid for the Weds night Meetup 101 class, you must already be a meetup member and RSVP for the meetup as well (no guests).

</a>

<a href="http://bookeo.com/climbrockclub?type=2126XUFJR1387C98D3A8">

If this is your first time climbing just come on in and join the group. There’s no need to take the class just yet. You’ll be able to join other Meetup members who already have their belay certification. This way you’ll be able to get up and on the wall right away! When you decide that you absolutely love climbing (which you will!), then you can sign up for the class the following week.

As a heads up, when you come into the gym, the front desk staff will get you set up with gear and get you in the system. There will also be name tags for everyone. Wear them with pride so everyone knows who’s a part of Meetup!

DETAILS - Please read carefully!

RSVPing and Questions:
If you're attending the belay course you MUST call TRC to reserve your space.
If you have any questions, please email TRC directly: [url][masked][/url]

Time:
The closer to 7pm you arrive, the better. The 101 class starts at 7:30 sharp.

Directions & Transportation:
Please save time and aggravation by getting directions from our website (BEFORE you call or email us for directions :-). If you're coming on Metro North as a group (2 or more people!) we'll pick you up from the train station. Use the message baord to connect with other riders.  Just give us a call to let us know when you'll arrive. Go to the taxi stand in front of the station building!

We're looking forward to seeing you soon!

Vinyasa and Core Strength Yoga are taught in fusion. Breathing techniques are taught in sequence with posture names, positioning, parts of the body that benefit (adverse muscle groups, organs and nervous system) and the Chakras that will be balanced in association.

This is a wheel chair excessible facility.

Free Parking.

results.description:
A masterful twist on the serial killer tale: a violent quantum leap featuring a memorable and appealing heroine in pursuit of a deadly criminal.  


// Book   
The Shining Girls, Lauren Beukes   
Kirby is the last shining girl, one of the bright young women, burning with potential, whose lives Harper is destined to snuff out after he stumbles on a House in Depression-era Chicago  that opens on to other times. At the urging of the House, Harper inserts himself into the lives of the shining girls, waiting for the perfect moment to strike. He's the ultimate hunter, vanishing into another time after each murder, untraceable--until one of his victims survives. Determined to bring her would-be killer to justice, Kirby joins the Chicago Sun Times to work with the ex-homicide reporter, Dan Velasquez, who covered her case. Soon Kirby finds herself closing in on the impossible truth ... 


// Location
The Back Room, 102 Norfolk Street
A true hidden speakeasy in the Lower East Side. Sidle up to a nondescript "Lower East Side Toy Company" signed gate, walk down the stairs and through the dark alleyway to the back staircase. Enter in the door with the peephole and into a 1920s speakeasy where cocktails are served in tea cups and beer is served in brown paper bags. 
To find us: We will wait outside of Nurse Bettie's (next door and easier to spot) until 7:30pm where we walk down together. If you arrive late, feel free to text me (832)[masked] and I can walk out to fetch you, or walk down yourself and ask the bouncer for Anastasia or Book Club. 
NOTE: The dress code is "upscale casual." Try to keep hoodies and flip flops at home. 
Cocktails: $14 

// Dues 

This book club does not require annual membership dues. However, we kindly ask that attendees bring $2 cash to the event to cover Meetup fees and the occasional book giveaway!
results.how_to_find_us: This is a true speakeasy, a little difficult to find. We will meet in front of Nurse Bettie's (right next door) until 7:30p, where we will walk down together. If you arrive late, feel free to text me (832) 597-2553. Reservation is under Anastasia.
results.name: Book #9 - The Shining Girls, Lauren Beukes

results.description:
Experience a Spiritual Tool
That Can Help Transform Your Life!

No matter what your spiritual background or faith, you are invited to learn a simple technique that can help transform your life. Join us and others in your community to experience spiritual insights gained by singing HU—a love song to God.

Singing HU can:
• Expand your awareness
• Help you release mental and emotional stresses
• Heal a broken heart
• Offer solace during times of grief
• Help you experience divine love


We sing HU together for about 20 minutes followed by five minutes of quiet contemplation. Light refreshment and conversation follow. Please join us—your friends and family are invited, too. We hope to see you there.


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zvecTKM_-wk

For more information about HU check out www.HearHU.org. For information on other events being held throughout the state, visit www.eckankar-nj.org.

results.description:
Whether you're completely new to meditation, fresh out of an MBSR class, or an advanced practitioner wanting to find a local sangha (supportive, like-minded individuals who help deepen your practice), this weekly meditation is open to all.

This week's group will be led by MBSR and meditation teacher, Kerry Rasp, and include a guided sitting meditation in the Vipassana (Mindfulness) tradition, followed by discussion.

Chairs provided, though feel free to bring a yoga mat, blanket or cushions. No charge, but dana (a donation) will be gratefully accepted. (Suggested donation $10, but please give what is right for you.)

Enter the church on the side facing Waldron Ave. The double doors are locked, but the single door all the way to the right is open (you'll see a sign on it). We'll be meditating in the large room on the left. Please try to arrive 5 min early so you can get settled before we start promptly at 7:45pm. If you're running late, it's okay. Just enter quietly and take a seat.

results.description:
Preparing for financial success in life is no different from preparing for your first job. IT ALL STARTS WITH HARD WORK, DEDICATION AND SURROUNDING YOURSELF WITH A WINNING TEAM.

We're excited to introduce you to our local professional real estate investing team.

Do YOU want to learn the fundamentals of real estate investing? Begin your journey towards financial freedom TODAY! 

Look, if you're trying to be successful you're going to experience obstacles and failures. Don't let it stop you and don't be afraid to start. The opportunity to build something new is right in front of you. 

Do you wonder if you'll have enough money for retirement or if you'll be able to leave something behind for your family?

In today's changing economy, having an advanced degree and a "good" job are not a guarantee of financial independence. This is why people from all walks of life are turning to investment opportunities such as real estate as a way to build a better life for themselves and their families.

So many people find themselves working harder and harder and still not getting ahead. Without a strong financial education, it's becoming more difficult to achieve financial freedom.

WHAT'S HOLDING YOU BACK? 

Most common concerns we've heard over the years is "limited cash and less than perfect credit", "I have a full time job with very little time to spare", "not sure how to get started or where to look for the best deals". Fortunately, we have seasoned investors who have already encountered and conquered similar concerns. They understand how difficult it can be to get started. Our goal is help individuals and their families to build a strong financial future. We show them ways to build a real estate business, which when combined with commitment, hard work and focus, can produce a positive cash flow.

Discover Ways to Build a Real Estate Business 

Our group will introduce you to strategies that will help you start on the path to financial freedom while avoiding the common pitfalls. You will discover investment strategies that can work in any economy.

Here are some of the topics that will be covered:

*Creative financing strategies

*How to invest with no money, little money, & other people's money

*Cash flow strategies

WHAT DOES FINANCIAL FREEDOM MEAN TO YOU?

RSVP TODAY!!

"What we call death, is only a change in the form of life, but it is not the end." Egyptian Book of the Dead

For the ancient egyptians, life was an opportunity for the soul to grow, embody wisdom (Gnosis, illumination, The Tao, The Dharma, or spiritual awakening), and reach immortality and find liberation. This is what in Gnosticism we call the path of "Self-Realization." Life and its many different events become opportunities for awakening and realizing all of our human and spiritual potentialities. 

Join us, as we study and reflect upon "The Mysteries of Life and Death." Aside from exploring philosophical concepts left behind by many different traditions, we will also look at different descriptions of the processes that the soul goes through after death. 

Topics of Discussion:

- Life; An opportunity to awaken. 

- Meditation practices to awaken our consciousness here and now.

- Death; Immortality & Liberation.

**Doors open at 7:45 and close at 8:45**


***A guided Meditation will follow the lecture***

results.description:
At the last meeting, we had our Fritzing conversation but I wish we had taken more time to dive into Jesse's latest problem:

The design and building of an Electronic Speed Controller for a 3-Phase "outrunner" brushless "DC" (BLDC) Motor.

It's kind-of strange/confusing that people refer to these motors as "DC".

Traditional "Permanent Magnet DC" (PMDC) motors have brushes that contact "comutators".

A Brushless DC Motor has an "Electronic Comutator" aka. an "ESC" Electronic Speed Controller that performs the funtion of the brush+comutator.

This explains why a Brushless 3-phase motor is referred to as "DC". Because the power supply to the ESC is DC, and the ESC is considered part of the motor itself.

The relationship between the ESC and the motor is complex, requiring the ESC to sense the position of the motor in order to determine when to apply power to each phase of the motor.

Some Motors have dedicated sensors to provide feedback to the ESC, but the outrunner motors used in electic "RC" aircraft don't do that. The ESC is (therefore) required to determine the position of the motor by measuring back-EMF of each motor phase. (coil)
results.name: Contemplate the inner workings of Electronic Speed Controllers

This is a weekly improv class appropriate for all levels (including beginners) taught every Wednesday from 8:30-10:30pm.  The focus will be on scenework, rather than games.

-- Are you a bit shy and looking to get more comfortable with your public speaking? 


-- Are you a working professional hoping to be a bit more spontaneous during your meetings and interactions with co-workers? 

-- Or are you an actor or improv comedian looking to take your craft to the next level or get more reps?

Then this is the class for you! In this class, you will learn the fundamentals of scene work (role playing). You'll be on your feet quite a bit as I'm believer that you learn (and have more fun) through doing rather than hearing an instructor talk. Brief individual notes will be given, if that's what you're looking for, and tailored to your level of experience. At the end of each class, I'm confident you'll feel a sense of accomplishment that will leave you more energized and excited to tackle the challenges of everyday life, whether at your work place or in your personal life. 

Each class is $10, and the fee is used to help cover the cost of the room rental, Meetup fees, and website.  The class will be capped at 14 students to make sure that you have sufficient time to be on your feet.  Guaranteed satisfaction or your money back.  

Hope to see you there,

Steve

www.improvnow.com

www.facebook.com/improvnow

Steve Ling is an alumnus of the improv programs of the Upright Citizens Brigade, Peoples Improv Theater, Magnet Theater, & Annoyance Theater.  He regularly produces and performs improv, musical improv, & hip hop improv across NYC.

results.description: Well folks, the time has come. It pains me to say this, but it’s time to say goodbye to our leader, our legend, our Mamba. We’ve had championships, rings, parades and tacos. We’ve seen 81, scoring titles and more buzzer beaters than we can count. It’s been an epic ride, these last 20 years. But all good things must come to an end. In the final game of his historic career, Kobe Bryant and the Lakers will take on the Utah Jazz in front of our home crowd at Staples. Come on down to Taqueria St. Marks as we toast and celebrate one of the best to ever do it!!!
results.name: KOBE'S FINAL GAME. THE END OF AN ERA.

results.description:
Mt. Beacon Fire ~Tower Hike ~ SUNRISE.     A quick pace all the way to the tower so we make the sunrise and can get to work after.  Not good for a first time hiker . 

4 miles 

Hiking Poles are helpful


Trail info- We will be taking the steps from the Gateway park to the Red trail. The trail is 6 or 7 switchbacks up to the old casino with a very rewarding look out point where you can see sweeping views of the Hudson river and surrounding area.  From there we continue to the Firetower.  


Distance: 4 miles round trip

The First 0.8 miles of this hike is hard, and very steep with 1000ft. elevation gain.
Mount Beacon is the second highest point in the Hudson Highlands. Depending on the map, it may be called Mount Beacon or Beacon Mountain. The mountain consists of two peaks. The northern peak is 1531ft and has a series of radio antennas on its summit. The higher southern peak is 1610ft and has a lookout tower on its summit.
On a clear morning we will see the NYC skyline lights from the summit as well as views of the town of Beacon and the majority of the Highlands (including Storm King, Breakneck Ridge, and little Sugarloaf).

We leave right at 5:45 AM.  Don't be late we will not wait.

+++

HUDSON VALLEY HIKER LEGAL DISCLAIMER  & WAIVER OF LIABILITY

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

The Hudson Valley Hikers Club does not provide liability insurance for the protection of individuals who may participate in any of the events planned by the Organizer or Assistant Organizers.

This release extends and applies to, and also covers and includes, all unknown, unforeseen, unanticipated and unsuspected injuries, damages, loss and liability.

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. By signing up for this group or event you understand that you are attending all events AT YOUR OWN RISK. Organizers and Assistant

Organizers of this group are just that, we organize the events and hike together as friends. There are no leaders on these hikes, you are your own leader - This is YOUR hike
results.name: Mt. Beacon ~ Fire Tower Hike ~ SUNRISE ~

results.description:
People ask me how I can speak seven languages all the time.

It's simple...

Study hard consistently, challenge yourself and use the language daily. That's how you'll get fluent in your target language. I study languages every day from six in the morning. Can you keep up? It'll make you fluent!


Join me at Starbucks whenever you'd like to study hard, practise conversation, and share good energy.

English? Español? Français? Italiano? 中文? 日本語? 한국어?

Whatever you're learning, good, daily study habits will make you fluent. 

Try it out!
results.name: Let's Get Fluent! Language Study at Starbucks

results.description:
PLEASE TEXT rsvp[masked] - Cathy

MID PARK BEHIND REC CENTER @ HANDBALL COURTS (MAP ON THIS LINK) https://www.facebook.com/CatGarloFitness/photos/gm.383293988527791/596413443794335/?type=1&theater


NO ONE UPTOWN OFFERS POUND - this is a great opportunity to try a "NEW" FUN and different Calorie torching work out!!!


645am-715am - Pound Rock Out Work out - total body

you will need to bring, 

Yourself, Sneakers, comfortable clothes.

At least one water bottle (trust me, you’ll need it!) and a towel for all that sweat. If you have one, a heart rate monitor is an awesome fitness tool that instructors and students alike typically use to measure exercise intensity during classes. 

You may want gloves, & a Mat as we are going to get down and dirty, pullups, push ups, planks, knee tucks, Dragon push ups, hand walks, etc... so dress accordingly and get excited to have some fun while shaping up!!!.

WHY POUND? in shape magazine April 21 http://www.shape.com/fitness/workouts/15-next-big-fitness-trends

POUND is a full-body cardio jam session, combining light resistance with constant simulated drumming. The workout fuses cardio, Pilates, isometric movements, plyometrics and Isometric poses into a 45-minute series. Burn between 400 and 900+ calories per hour, strengthen and sculpt infrequently used muscles, and drum your way to a leaner, slimmer physique – all while rocking out to your favorite music!

Through continual upper body motion using our lightly weighted drumsticks, called Ripstix™, you'll turn into a calorie-torching drummer, POUNDing off pounds as each song flies by. Rock, rap, dubstep, pop and old school music fuse to create the POUNDtrack series, which is hand-selected by music enthusiasts, drummers and POUND founders Kirsten Potenza and Cristina Peerenboom.

GET RIPPED WITH RIPSTIX™

What would a drumming workout be without drumsticks? We’ve invented unique, lightly weighted exercise drumsticks that have been specially designed to get you ripped — hence the name: Ripstix™

Twice the weight of a standard drumstick (¼ lb each) and slightly shorter in length, Ripstix are designed to maximize your workout by alter the physics of your arm movement to burn more calories

IT WORKS.

POUND combines easy to follow (and not complex or embarrassing) cardio moves with strength training and drumming. This combo works the entire body, raises the heart rate to a fat-burning zone, and forces each move to be as precise as a basic beat.

Each 2-4 minute song is carefully calibrated with interval peaks and extended fat burning sequences, providing you with the best workout in the shortest span of time. After you’re done rocking out to the 45-minute POUNDtrack, you’ll have done 15,000 reps, performed over 30 extended interval peaks, and zipped through over 70 techniques without even realizing it

I am offering 1 week free, then a 15.00 contribution to workout material is appreciated per week. 

please watch my video to get an idea of how much fun we can have getting that beach body!  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SEfy9XKiqQc

please visit my website: catgarlo.com 

 facebook: CatGarloFitness and see some reviews. Photos and invites on here as well.

https://www.facebook.com/CatGarloFitness

results.description:
Positive Connections for Success is a more relaxed and personal networking group for business professionals looking to build relationships and grow their business through referrals.

We focus on:

• Networking: Building relationships and earning each others trust to become referral partners

• Education: Understanding your business and helping you articulate your business

• Leadership: Leaders of the round table philosophy, every member is a leader of this group

We follow a structured meeting agenda starting with networking to develop relationships, giving us time to talk and get to know each other while having a warm breakfast, followed by:

• One Minute Elevator Pitch

• Business Presentations with Q&A and feedback (we have a large screen & clicker/pointer available for powerpoint presentations)

• Brainstorming Session, Successes & Referrals to Help Each Others Businesses grow

• Lots of Fun in the Process

"We Refer Business Partners, Not Business Cards!"

This is a group with category/specialty specific members (only one member per category/speciality).
Please view our sponsors page or contact us to verify your industry, category and specialty, before attending a meeting so as to not be in conflict with a group member.

We meet every Thursday morning from 7:00 AM to 8:30 AM and welcome guests to come and experience the group and then apply to join.

Non-members/guests pay a $10 fee to attend, which includes a warm served breakfast of their choosing and we ask to please be prepared with a one minute elevator pitch presenting:

• who you are

• type of business

• who would be a good referral for you


Current positions that we are interviewing, to build relationships with and pass referrals to include:

• Attorney

• Mortgage Broker

• Realtor

• Electrician

• Landscaper

• Limo or car service

• Painter

• Plumber

• And more...

Please contact us for information or if you have any questions.

We look forward to seeing you at our next meetup!

2nd, 3rd and 4th Thursdays of each month (except when there is a holiday) from 8-9:30AM we conduct our presentations, networking and business development meetings for entrepreneurs, consultants, salespeople and business owners in the NY Tri-state area. One catch – YOU bring your own coffee :-) (I will bring the bagels.)

Schedule for 2016

Breakfast @AXA: 8-9:30AM

Happy Hour @ Fatcat Billiards Ainsworth Park 6-8PM

April 14, 21 (Bfast & Happy Hr), 28

May 12, 19 (Bfast & Happy Hr), 26

June 9, 16 (Bfast & Happy Hr), 23

July 14, 21 (Bfast & Happy Hr), 28

September 8, 15 (Bfast & Happy Hr), 22

October 13, 20 (Bfast & Happy Hr), 27

November 10, 17 (Bfast & Happy Hr), 24

December 8, 15 (Bfast & Happy Hr), 22

We are much more than your average meetup group. We act as your own private business advisory council and potential funding pool. Members and attendees walk out each week with sound business advice, decades worth of experience, leads and introductions.

What is an entrepreneurs breakfast /business networking and development meeting? A meeting where you present your demo, meet various people from various industries and walk out with introductions, leads and referrals and business cards. Curious how do we do this? Come on down and find out...

AXA Advisors is located at: 1290 Ave of the Americas (bet 51 - 52nd St.)
4th floor (Always check with security)

We charge $25.00 for all meetings ($20 via paypal if you RSVP early) unless you become a member at $500/year. (Your first meeting is free if you just want to check it out). Please bring business cards and your own coffee. ($20 payment here through paypal: http://bit.ly/1fDv0KA)

If you are interested in joining, please RSVP here. Please contact Raphi Salem at [masked] or call[masked] if you have any questions.

results.description:
A key employee just resigned, took a thumb-drive containing gigabytes of your company’s confidential information, and is now working for your competitor.  Your clients and candidates are being solicited and key employees are receiving job offers enticing them to leave. What do you do?  What could you have done to prepare for this?

In these situations, many businesses find turn to the restrictive covenants in employment and other agreements for protection.  But what agreements provide the protection you need? 

This seminar will:

Discuss the different types of “restrictive covenants” and when to use each.

    a.   “Non-Compete,”

    b.   “Non-Solicit, Non-Accept and Non-Service,”

    c.   “Non-Poach,”

    d.  “Confidentiality provisions” including those treating the use of social and business media such as Facebook and Linkedin, and “Notice” provisions. 

Discuss common misconceptions about restrictive covenants including that many business owners mistakenly believe that:

a.  New York disfavors restrictive covenants and courts won’t enforce them so they cannot be useful. (Incorrect.)

b.  Old, boilerplate agreements containing restrictive covenants provide adequate protection. (They do not.)

c.  It is a good idea when learning that an employee was planning to leave and start a new business to preemptively terminate that employee. (It is not.)

d.  We are protected because our employee handbook contains restrictive covenants. (Your Employee Handbook probably says it is not a contract.)

e.  It is advisable to “wait and see” what happens before taking action (You do not want to sit on your rights.), and

f.     Owners are treated exactly like employees. (They are not.)

Sponsored by:
results.how_to_find_us: 11th Floor, Look for the NYSA registration table with name tags
results.name: Using Restrictive Covenants to Protect Your Business

or

~~~~~~

Over the last 7 years, I've created and facilitated hundreds of networking events for the NYC Entrepreneurial Community. I've also been a prolific networker myself attending all kinds of events across the country.

On Thursday, I'm going to reveal the 7 Things Top Networkers Do To Build Huge Communities and Win Tons of Business. 

Once you know what these are, doors will open in place you now can't imagine. 

I'm going to show you the most effective, most powerful ways to build a Huge Community and Win Tons of Business by using real examples...not theory, not made up stuff but real examples from some of the biggest networkers I know. 

I'll also share real examples of what some of your Connecting to Greatness co-members have recently done at our events with some extraordinary results!

results.description:
LEADER: Roy Wooters ([masked] or[masked])

RATING:  B 7.5 B

Meet at 9:30 AM at Fisherman’s parking on East Village Road just north of Tuxedo R.R. Station. Road walk .6 miles on R-D Trail to park. Trails: R-D to Yellow Triangle to Parker Cabin Mountain for lunch. Return on R-D trail. Severe weather cancels. TC Harriman-Bear Mountain Trails map 118. 

*   *   *   *   *   *

Our full hike schedule can be viewed on our website at hudsonhikers.org, and some hikes are also posted on our Facebook page.

After attending two hikes/events, please consider joining the North Jersey Ramapo Chapter of the Adirondack Mountain Club to support our outdoor recreation and conservation activities.  Membership comes with a variety of benefits including a 10% discount at Ramsey Outdoor; our annual holiday party and social; special events such as our traditional day-outing to the Mohonk Mountain House; a subscription to ADK’s bi-monthly magazine, Adirondac; and the opportunity to contribute to the preservation and extension of hiking lands and viewsheds in our region.

New hikers are strongly encouraged to select hikes appropriate to their capabilities. North Jersey Ramapo Chapter hikes are rated for pace (A, B or C), mileage, and terrain (A, B or C), with "C" designating easier hikes and "A" more challenging ones. We recommend that new hikers should first try a "C" or short "B" hike before undertaking a more difficult one; otherwise, you may not fully enjoy the hiking experience. If you have any doubts, please contact the hike leader in advance. 

Pace Ratings: 
     A = Fast - 2.5 mph or faster 
     B = Moderate - about 2 mph 
     C = Easy - 1.5 mph or less 

Distance: Noted in miles 

Terrain Ratings:
     A = Strenuous, long/steep climbs and descents, 
             possible rock scrambling
     B = Moderate climbs and descents
     C = Generally flat with little elevation change 

For example, a hike rated “B-7-A” is a moderately paced hike of approximately 7 miles with steep climbs and/or descents and possible rock scrambling. 

If you join us for a hike, please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness, including ensuring that the hike is appropriate for your level of fitness, that you wear the proper clothing, and bring the proper gear, food and water (see the ADK's recommended Hiking Essentials and guidelines, below).

Leaders have the right, responsibility and sole discretion to refuse any hiker he/she deems to be not properly attired, prepared, or otherwise fit to safely complete the hike. 

HIKERS' GUIDELINES:

  Risks:  As with all physical activities, hiking involves hazards. Persons participate at their own risk and will be asked to sign a statement acknowledging that fact before starting the hike. Prior to the hike please advise the leader of any medical condition or physical impairment that could affect you during the hike.

  Footwear and Clothing:  Wear clothing suited to the weather and carry extra garments for unexpected weather conditions. Dress in thin layers so that you can adjust the number of layers as required to maintain comfort. In winter carry a wool cap and wool or polypropylene gloves or mitts and a windproof shell. Be prepared for rain. Bring a rain jacket and rain pants, preferably of the type that permits venting body moisture. Wear comfortable, sturdy boots/shoes.  Do not wear cotton garments in winter.

  Drink and Food:  Adequate hydration is important year round. Drink frequently during the hike. Carry food to enjoy during the midday lunch stop.

  Other responsibilities:  Hikers with children under 16 and new hikers are required to contact the hike leader in advance to determine if the hike is suitable for them.  Minors under 16 are welcome on day hikes when accompanied by a parent or guardian.  No person under 18 shall participate in overnight outings unless accompanied by a parent or adult sponsor over 21.  The hike leader may refuse to allow a person to hike who is judged to be poorly equipped or unable to do the published hike.  Participants should get to the hike at least 10 minutes prior to the starting time.

  Maps:  The TC number indicates a NY-NJ Trail Conference map for the area of the hike. For example: TC-118 refers to the Southern Harriman Park map.

  Abbreviations:  NCA-No Calls After . . . , Pref.- Leader’s contact preference.

  Expense Sharing:  When car-pooling, passengers are expected to offer the driver funds sufficient to cover the cost of fuel, tolls and parking fees. A $3.00 minimum per person is recommended. Most hike trailhead meeting locations can be found on NY-NJ Trail Conference maps.

  Dog-Friendly Hikes:  Pets are not permitted on hikes unless the hike description clearly states that it is "dog friendly."  If it is, all hikers with dogs must abide by park leash regulations.

NO SHOW/LATE CANCELLATION POLICY:
Please be considerate of event hosts/organizers and others who may want to attend an event by not being a "NO SHOW" (failing to show up when you've RSVP'd "yes") or a "LATE CANCEL" (changing RSVP to a "no" within 24 hours of an event).  If you have a history of No Shows and/or Late Cancels, we may have to bump you to the waiting list for meetups with limited space, in favor of those with a positive attendance history.

results.description:
Musikalische Mäuse is a German music and movement program for babies, toddlers, and preschoolers created by Gabriele Tranchina, director of Sol La Ti Music, Inc.

The song material used in class derives from the German folk tradition, spiced up with a contemporary flair, allowing families to reconnect with their own childhood memories and passing them on to the next generation in a fun-filled way. Old and young will enjoy learning how to use the songs creatively and how to include them in their daily routines. We invite non-German speakers to join in as well, and make sure that everyone can follow easily. The classes are age appropriately designed. They are infused with finger plays, dance segments and instrument exploration and provide a rich environment for music development, creativity and cognitive development. Learning a language through music is very effective. Rhythm and melody help the brain to memorize with ease. The latest research shows that music has a unique way in activating speech pathways. Come and find out what it can do for you and your child.

Age group: Birth-4 years

Spring Free Trial Class: Thursday, April 7th at 10:30AM - RSVP here: [masked]

How to get there:
Bus access: M104 or M4 to 114 Street
Subway: 1 Train to 116 Street or 110 Street
(Corner Bway and 114 Street)

Tuition: New Families $355.00

Returning Families: $340.00

Additional Siblings: $295.00 (siblings birth to 8 months are free of charge if accompanied by their older sibling)

Register here:

Semester runs for 10 weeks - The fee includes a songbook with the song material used in class

Contact: (212)[masked] | Cell: (646)[masked] or [masked]

About Us

Sol La Ti Music has been offering Music Together® classes since 1997 in Morningside Heights and Harlem and received the Golden Daisy Award for best enrichment program by Macaroni Kids in 2014. This German off shoot is a new addition created for the German speaking community and also for those who would like to learn a new language with their children.

Director: Gabi, a German native, is an international jazz vocalist performing in the US and Europe. She has released two CD’s “The Old Country” and “A Song Of Love’s Color,” on the “Jazzheads” record label. In 1997 she founded Sol La Ti Music, and overlooks a staff of 3 teachers and supervises 3 locations. Ms. Tranchina holds a BFA in Education from JW Goethe University, Frankfurt. She came to New York to independently continue her studies in dance and voice. Gabi is a voice instructor certified level 3 in “Somatic Voicework TM” and a Certified Level 1 Music Together instructor. She also plays guitar and some piano. In 2012 some of her German families showed a strong desire for Gabi to offer a music class in German. She started German Music Together but the German families preferred the focus exclusively on German song material. Hence “Musikalische Mäuse” was born.
results.name: Musikalische Mäuse

results.description:
The Tamron Mobile Learning Center Official Tour stops at Unique Photo®!
- FREE photography mini seminars (see below)
- Bring your cameras for hands-on shooting
- Test drive the latest Tamron lens technology
- Get your photo questions answered all day
- Giveaways after each seminar
- Specials on Tamron lenses


---------------------------------

Seminar #1: Travel and Nature Techniques (12:15pm - 1:00pm)
Whether you are in a secluded natural setting or in an exotic city, these simple techniques will help you get that one-of-a-kind photograph. In this session, we will cover everything from capturing a stunning sunrise to exposing that perfect nightscape, including what to pack when you are traveling. We will cover the conventional way to shoot amazing images and then look at some great experimental methods. And we will even have time for a live shoot to hone your photo-chops! 
Bring your camera for hands-on shooting from 1:15pm - 2:15pm!

Seminar #2: The Art of Macro (2:30pm - 3:15pm)
With an entire new world only inches away, it is no wonder that more and more people are getting the bug for macro photography. During this session, we will start by defining macro basics and then discover how subtle movements can mean better results. Learn how to identify unique subjects, reduce background distractions, and make sense out of an abstracted scene. We will also cover all of the equipment you need to create macro images with impact. And finally, there will be a chance to put those new skills to use with a live macro shoot. 
Bring your camera for hands-on shooting from 3:30pm - 4:30pm!

Seminar #3: Light Like a Pro (4:45pm - 5:30pm)
Understanding light is the key to great photography. When it comes to photographing people, knowing how to look for an manipulate light is a skill that often takes years to master. But once you start to see it, you can't un-see it! In this session, we will teach you a few shortcuts that you can replicate virtually anywhere, with anyone. And we will even have a live shooting station, so you'll walk away with a real hands-on experience. 
Bring your camera for hands-on shooting from 5:45pm - 6:45pm.
results.name: *FREE RSVP* Tamron Mobile Learning Center Official Tour Stop

results.description:
a representative from New York City

Citymart and Civic Hall invite entrepreneurs to join us for a brown bag lunch and conversation on how to sell to government. Local governments spend 1.7 trillion dollars a year and many cities are making concerted efforts to open up opportunities to new vendors with new solutions. The lunch session will be an opportunity to learn more about how to grow your business with government. We will touch on how to pitch to government, how to analyze a government solicitation document, and conclude with a question and answer session with a representative from New York City to discuss specific pain points in the procurement process. This discussion will give the City of New York and the local community the opportunity to set a path forward to a more inclusive procurement process and better results for residents.

About Citymart Meetup Series
Citymart transforms the way cities solve problems by connecting them through open challenges to new ideas from entrepreneurs and citizens. The objective of the Citymart meetup series is to build a community of city problem solvers, share best practices to access opportunities to scale solutions to our global city network, and bring new faces to the Civic Hall community.

results.description:
NYC is at the center of food innovation... urban farms, aquaponics, edible insects, unique juices, veggie desserts, rooftop vineyards and more!

Did you know that NYC is experiencing a food crisis right now?

EVERY DAY...

* 1 in 4 children in our city go to bed hungry.

* 1 in 5 city residents struggle with food insecurity. 

* 1.4 million NY'ers experience hunger and rely on "emergency food."

How does this happen in a food "rich" city like New York?

So what can YOU do about it?

Attend the Food Rich Summit.

We postponed Food Tech NY to support this important initiative to end hunger in NYC.

SPONSORS

* Food Tech NY is an Angel Week 2016 event.

* Brooklyn FoodWorks is the premier local platform to prototype, launch and grow innovative food businesses.

* Brooklyn Law School emphasizes teaching excellence, cutting-edge scholarship, and an innovative academic program.

* Brooklyn Innovation Center provides mentoring, advisors, funding, tech-focused education and programming.

Go to The Food Rich Summit website to see how you can help.
results.name: Food Tech NY... Supports the Food Rich Summit

Intermediate level ride; no beginners please.

Most fun trails are unmarked.  Ride is not super fast. May ride to the top depending upon group.

A description from mtbNJ "with lots of loose rock, and rock garden too and lots of climbing, lesser flowy trails hence the rocks. This trails will make you hate or love. There's some nice single track too."

Note:  Can get there from Hamburg Tpk in Wayne to University Drive  at a light (Turn left) or

From 287 to Route 208 S, Take Ewing Ave Exit and travel S to T (stop sign), Turn L onto High Mt Road.  Stay on High Mt Road to fork, keep right to stay on High Mt Road.   At next traffic light, make a right.  At stop sign, this is College Road, turn right.  Parking lot is up a ways on the right.

results.description:
PLEASE READ THE ENTIRE EVENT DESCRIPTION.

This event is organized by Fragomen Worldwide, Monarch Bay Securities and Golden Gate Global.

Our meetup group is collaborating by promoting this event.

This event is free to attend.

In order to attend, please register here:

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/what-foreign-students-need-to-know-about-immigration-before-they-graduate-tickets-24435266540 

For more info, visit:

 www.facebook.com/LearnAboutEB5


Fragomen Worldwide, Monarch Bay Securities and Golden Gate Global are pleased to invite you to a end an event to discuss what visa options might be possible for foreign students graduating from a U.S. university. This talk will cover what foreign students need to know about changing their visa status from F-1 to a work visa category and potentially how to gain permanent residency (or a "green card") in the United States. 

The speakers will focus on how students may also use the EB-5 immigrant investor program as a vehicle towards obtaining a green card.


Please come with your questions and concerns.

 Agenda 

5:00 pm - 5:30 pm -     Check In, Refreshments, Network with the Speakers 

5:30 pm  - 6:30 pm -   Presentations

6:30 pm  - 7:30 pm  -   Q&A

Fragomen Worldwide is the world's largest law ﬁrm practicing exclusively business immigration. The ﬁrm employs over 2500 professionals and over 500 att orneys and solicitors and currently has over 43 oﬃces around the world.


Monarch Bay Securities, LLC,  is a FINRA and SEC registered broker dealer founded in 2006.  Monarch  provides a broad spectrum of sophisticated ﬁnancial advice and services, including EB-5 ﬁnancing, using a seasoned team of investment professionals with deep industry contacts and over $1B in collective investment banking services.


Golden Gate Global is committed to helping its clients achieve their immigration goals and establishing new pathways to opportunity.

About the Speakers:

Ruby Xiaotong Li is an associate in the New York oﬃce of Fragomen Worldwide. She practices with a focus on corporate immigration law, and represents a wide range of clients, including individuals, start-ups, and Fortune 500 companies. Ruby’s practice includes all aspects of corporate U.S. immigration, including non-immigrant visas, permanent residence, citizenship, and immigration support for corporate restructuring. She also assists clients with family-based immigration ma tters, consular processing, re-entry permits and naturalization. Ruby also works with many high net worth individuals in their immigration related investments in the U.S. EB-5 investor category.

Keith Moore is CEO and Founder of Monarch Bay Securities, LLC, a FINRA and SEC registered broker dealer founded in 2006. He has served his entire career raising capital for and supporting capital formation for fast growing companies and projects. During his career Mr. Moore has served in various executive capacities for micro-cap to Russell 1000 companies, and has led the growth of Monarch Bay into new markets, including EB-5 investments. Monarch Bay provides a broad spectrum of sophisticated ﬁnancial advice and services with a seasoned team of investment professionals with deep industry contacts and over $1B in collective investment banking services.

Jason Brown is the SVP of Business Development for the Asia-Paciﬁc region. He is an international executive with a proven track record of success in developing EB-5 investor programs throughout Asia, in addition to building a number of branded direct-to-consumer retail businesses. Jason has extensive experience in business development, mergers and acquisitions, as well as managing operations at a senior level for over 30 years in multiple countries including China, India, Vietnam, Korea, Taiwan, Hong Kong, Australasia, and Mexico.
results.name: Visa Options for Int'l Students with a Focus on the EB-5 Investor Visa

About the Speakers:

Ruby Xiaotong Li is an associate in the New York oﬃce of Fragomen Worldwide. She practices with a focus on corporate immigration law, and represents a wide range of clients, including individuals, start-ups, and Fortune 500 companies. Ruby’s practice includes all aspects of corporate U.S. immigration, including non-immigrant visas, permanent residence, citizenship, and immigration support for corporate restructuring. She also assists clients with family-based immigration ma tters, consular processing, re-entry permits and naturalization. Ruby also works with many high net worth individuals in their immigration related investments in the U.S. EB-5 investor category.

Keith Moore is CEO and Founder of Monarch Bay Securities, LLC, a FINRA and SEC registered broker dealer founded in 2006. He has served his entire career raising capital for and supporting capital formation for fast growing companies and projects. During his career Mr. Moore has served in various executive capacities for micro-cap to Russell 1000 companies, and has led the growth of Monarch Bay into new markets, including EB-5 investments. Monarch Bay provides a broad spectrum of sophisticated ﬁnancial advice and services with a seasoned team of investment professionals with deep industry contacts and over $1B in collective investment banking services.

Jason Brown is the SVP of Business Development for the Asia-Paciﬁc region. He is an international executive with a proven track record of success in developing EB-5 investor programs throughout Asia, in addition to building a number of branded direct-to-consumer retail businesses. Jason has extensive experience in business development, mergers and acquisitions, as well as managing operations at a senior level for over 30 years in multiple countries including China, India, Vietnam, Korea, Taiwan, Hong Kong, Australasia, and Mexico.

results.description:
Updated March 7th, 2016

Given the warmth that has descended upon NYC, I am making Tuesdays/Thursdays active again, but at 5pm.

This is one of three sites/listserves that promotes weekly games that have been going on for many many years. Stall counts are used on occasion, cleats are optional, boundaries are flexible, and all skill levels are welcome!

There are two ways to stay in touch outside of Meetup.com:

- Follow us on Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/nycultimate
- Like us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/nycultimate

SPRING/SUMMER (Mar - Aug)

As the city warms up we play four times a week. Our main location is Riverside Park, with Morningside and Booker T Washington as backups.

There are four days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Sundays at 12pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Tuesdays at 5pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End - Where we can!)
- Thursdays at 5pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End - Where we can!)

Damien
[masked]

RIVERSIDE DETAILS

The Riverside location is all the way West just off the water between 102nd and 108th Streets. You can only enter the park at 103rd and 108th. The best way to get there is to take the 1 local to 103rd Street. Walk West until you see an entrance that takes you down to the fields through the park. After walking down the steps from the street, you will see a path that goes left and another that goes right. Walk down the left path until you see a stone wall and stairs that go down to the fields. From South to North there will be one small soccer field surrounded by a track (red 'A' on map), another field with two softball fields (closer to 103rd/104th st) and another that is a giant soccer field (closer to 106th st). After walking down the steps, you will see the small Soccer field on your left. Start from this Southern-most field and walk North on the path to find our game. If you see no one, the meeting spot is the South side of the large soccer field. This spot is identified on the map below, a small square with little dots around it. On days when we can't find space at Riverside, we will move the game to Morningside Park (West 110th St and Manhattan Ave).

MORNINGSIDE DETAILS

The Morningside location is at the corner of 110th Street and Manhattan Avenue. The best way to get there is to take the B or C local to 110th Street. You can also take the 1 train to 110th street at Broadway and then walk East. We will play at the South end of the baseball field parallel to 110th street so that we're not in the way of the baseball games. Riverside will be our backup if for some reason we need to change locations.

BOOKER T. WASHINGTON DETAILS

This location is between 107th & 108th Streets just West of Columbus Avenue. It's on the backside of the high school. The best way to get there is to take the B or C local to 110th Street. 

+++

OTHER SEASONS...

WINTER (Nov - Feb)

During the colder months we generally play two times a week depending on weather. Our main location is Riverside Park with Morningside as a backup.

There are two days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Riverside Park (108th and West End - Big Soccer Field)
- Sundays at 1pm, Riverside Park (108th and West End - Big Soccer Field)
*Tuesdays/Thursdays at 6pm games don't last long due to decreasing sunlight.

FALL (Sep - Oct)

There are four days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Morningside Park (110th and Manhattan Ave)
- Sundays at 4pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Tuesdays at 5:30pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Thursdays at 5:30pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)

results.description:
Strategic Foundation for the Tail Expectation in Limit Order Book Markets

Lawrence R. Glosten

Seminar Program

5:45pm Registration
6:00pm Seminar
7:30pm Reception

Abstract

We analyze the strategic interactions of liquidity suppliers quoting on a limit order book.  In an environment with noise traders and informed traders trading on news we show that there is an equilibrium that feature quoters using mixed strategies; each offering the same quantity of shares at random prices (and, of course, random bid prices).  These random prices with the associated quantities form the market quotes and the depth of book, or price schedule.  There are equilibria with a smaller number of quoters quoting a larger number of shares and equilibria with a larger number of quoters quoting a smaller number of shares.  Considering a sequence of equilibria with the number of quoters getting large, we establish that the stochastic equilibrium price schedule converges to the zero profit deterministic competitive price schedule.  An offer (or bid) is characterized as the expectation of the future value conditional on the offer being picked off by a larger buy (or sell) order.

(Joint work with Shmuel Baruch, University of Utah)

Biography

Lawrence R. Glosten is the S. Sloan Colt Professor of Banking and International Finance at Columbia Business School. He is also co-director (with Merritt Fox and Ed Greene) of the Program in the Law and Economics of Capital Markets at Columbia Law School and Columbia Business School and is an adjunct faculty member at the Law School. He has been at Columbia since 1989, before which he taught at the Kellogg Graduate School of Management at Northwestern University, and has held visiting appointments at the University of Chicago and the University of Minnesota. He has published articles on the microstructure and industrial organization of securities markets; the relationship between venture capitalists and entrepreneurs; evaluating the performance of portfolio managers; asset pricing and more recently exploration of the law and economics of capital market regulation. His work on electronic exchanges in the Journal of Finance won a Smith Breeden Distinguished Paper Prize. He has served as an editor of the Review of Financial Studies, associate editor of the Journal of Finance and serves on several other editorial boards. He has been a consultant for the New York Stock Exchange, Justice Department, and SEC and has served on the NASDAQ Economic Advisory Board. He received his AB from Occidental College (1973) and his Ph.D. in managerial economics from Northwestern University (1980).


Disclaimer

This a joint IAQF/Thalesians seminar, and not an instructional program of New York University.
results.name: (NY) - Lawrence Glosten - Limit Order Book Tail Expectations

Why: Fun n stuff
How: read below...

Oh hi there person reading this.  My name's Ari.  You should come play dodgeball with us.  That's a fun game.  Remember that from grade school?  Yeah, apparently when you're an adult you're still allowed to do that.  Who knew?  Oh, and now we get to go to a bar afterward instead of back to math class.  So there's that.  Adulthood has its perks.

See, here's some photos of shenanigans:

Doesn't that look like those people are having good times?  That could be you having good times!  You're a people!  And good times are the best kinds of times.

---

FAQ

SO WHO ARE YOU?
So the deal is that we're the group in NYC that gets together to play dodgeball every week...because we are overgrown children.  Sometimes old school rubber playground balls, sometimes little soft jello ones, sometimes some foam ones.  We're not here to F you.  That's why it's FREE for new folk.    But we're more a community than anything (but how legit does our website look?!) and just a good group of people running around with a childhood sport...and then, you know, a bar after if that's your thing.  

I WANT IN!  BUT WHAT IF I'M BAD/SCARED?
We don't just throw you to wolves - we'll introduce you around, explain everything, and no experience or athleticism necessary!  No one's gonna bully you or not want to play/hang out with you for being "bad" - no one cares about that...that's what a dick would do.  And we're not dicks.


WHAT IF I'M LATE?
It's just dodgeball, relax.  Come and go as you please.  The earlier you get there, the more you play of course, but no worries.

WHAT ABOUT MY STUFF? WHAT DO I WEAR?
There are bathrooms to change in if you need to.  Everyone leaves their stuff by the side of the court.  Plenty come straight from work.  Whatever you'd want to run around in is cool for clothes.  You wanna come in your work suit?  Rock on.

THIS IS AWESOME.  IS THERE A LEAGUE?!  I WANT MORE!

There is a full league that goes on too, if you're interested.  Same deal - good or bad all welcome!  More formal with teams and schedules and trophies and costume themes and karaoke and drink deals and all... More info here: www.sandlotsportsnyc.com/register , but any questions just lemme know!

Any questions, don't hesitate!  We'll get back to you! 

facebook.com/groups/NYCDodgeball
www.sandlotsportsnyc.com


A firm embrace,
Ari

<a href="http://www.sandlotsportsnyc.com"></a>

results.description:
Title:  Scaling SQL Server For the Big Time

Abstract:

Come join Thomas Grohser, our very own local Data Platform MVP as he shares his experiences and the lessons he’s learned from building and operating the infrastructure of some of the most demanding workloads ever run on SQL Server.

He will cover topics including but not limited to:

·  Handling very high transaction volumes

·  Managing large databases and tables with a large number of rows

·  Inserting large amounts of new data

·  Updating from many places at once

·  Managing many SQL Server instances.

The goal of the session is to show that SQL Server can scale and that when used correctly has no problem doing so.

Bio:

Thomas Grohser for the past 21+ years has spent most of his time exploring the deeper inner workings of SQL Server and its features while working for entertainment, pharmaceutical and financial services industries. His primary focus is to architect, plan, build and operate reliable, highly available, secure and scalable infrastructures for SQL Server. Over the years he managed thousands of SQL Server instances processing trillions of rows taking up petabytes of storage. Thomas is a Microsoft Data Platform MVP (former known as SQL Server MVP).

The meeting will be sponsored by Panorama Software, and they will be providing refreshments and giveaways / raffle items.
results.name: Scaling SQL Server For the Big Time

results.description:
Please RSVP <a>[masked]</a>

<a>http://www.sustainabilitypractice.net/events/big-data-and-sustainable-development
</a>

Moderator: Vasant Dhar, Professor, NYU Center for Data Science and NYU Stern; Editor-in-Chief, Big Data Journal

Panelists: Justine Dowden, Data Analyst Center for Sustainable Development, Columbia University; Nicole Barberis, Senior Data Scientist, Bloomberg LLP; Kirk Borne, Principal Data Scientist, Booz Allen Hamilton, PhD Astrophysicist; Louis Coppola, Co-Founder, Executive Vice President, Governance & Accountability Institute 

Topic: 'Big Data and Sustainable Development'

Big data presents big challenges—and big opportunities.  Referring to the seemingly infinite quantity of information now being recorded by recently developed technologies across a multitude of sectors—health care, transportation, finance, marketing, social media, agriculture and education to name a few—this is a time of unprecedented access to large volumes of information about our modern day lives. 

The great quantity and quality of information that we have at our disposal has the potential to allow us to glean insights about the state of the world in which we live and the demands for the future. Public and private sectors and civil society are tapping into these data to design, monitor and evaluate policies. Increasingly, environmental, economic and social data are being leveraged for decision making and companies which provide services to aggregate and analyze these data are at the forefront of a data revolution for sustainable development. 

As the world decides upon the indicators to measure progress towards the Sustainable Development Goals, there is an urgent need to mobilize data to hold governments and decision-makers accountable. With dire constraints to finite natural resources, rising populations and levels of inequality, how can we tap into big data to track progress and modify the status quo? What kinds of data and analytical tools will be relevant to the 2030 Sustainable Development Agenda? What trends and practices may be useful and what are the greatest foreseeable obstacles which lie ahead? 

About the Sponsors:

The Sustainability Practice Network (SPN) is a New York based inter-disciplinary community of professionals who seek to learn and share knowledge to advance sustainable development across sectors and disciplines. We mobilize our members to practice sustainability in their lives and work. Our mission is to raise awareness of the importance of individual and corporate sustainability and thereby create a more stable and equitable world.  

NYU Stern Center for Sustainable Business (CSB) mission is to assist current and future business leaders develop the knowledge, skills, and experience needed to address environmental and social challenges, so their business can reduce risk; create competitive advantage; develop innovative services, products, and processes; while building value for society and protecting the planet.
results.name: SPN/NYU  Panel Discussion: Big Data and Sustainable Development

Newark Makers Meetup 4/14 6:00 pm at the Newark Museum (Update for speakers #2)

If you want to create a viable business from your Maker passion, this is the meeting for you. In leading up to the Newark Mini Maker Faire, we will hold our next meetup on April 14th at 6 PM at the Newark Museum located on 49 Washington St, Newark, NJ. We will be introducing a new live/work project planned for Newark called Makerhoods which will offer you affordable living and working space. We will also have speakers discussing online marketing and micro loans for makers so you can truly get your maker business off the ground. Finally, we will tour the soon-to-be opened Makerspace at the Newark Museum.

So come by meet other Makers and check out your options and opportunities for Growing your Maker Business.

Confirmed Speakers:

Juan Castello - Accion Small Business Credit
On the micro loan front, we are happy to host Mr. Juan Castello, Loan Consultant for Accion, one of the leading non-profit lending institutions in the US. In his role, he supports business owners with financial education and access to capital. He will share with us case studies of small business owners and their key to a successful loan application.

About Accion (http://us.accion.org/)
Accion makes loans as low as a few thousand dollars and as much several hundred thousand dollars. They have programs for women owned businesses, veteran owned businesses, established businesses an of course start-ups.  As you grow your Maker business you will eventually bump up against a need for capital and Juan is the perfect contact for such a time.

Kevin Chu - Greater Newark Enterprises Corporation
Kevin Chu  is a Loan Program Manager at Greater Newark Enterprises Corporation (GNEC). He assists entrepreneurs by providing Technical Assistance and Sourcing Capital on both traditional and alternative lending. Prior to joining GNEC he was with the City of New York as the Industrial Business Zone Coordinator for Brooklyn East.

About Greater Newark Enterprises Corporation (http://gnecorp.org/)
The GNEC makes direct loans to Newark enterprises seeking growth or startup capital and also organizes loans from various participating parties when the amounts exceeds their lending limit. The GNEC is definitely the place to visit as your first stop to obtaining credit for you Maker business. 

SEAN C. HAIRSTON, MEDINA=CITI
As the Chief Executive Officer of MEDINA=CITI, Sean has secured client relationships with many top clients. However, his greatest joy stems from helping entrepreneurs achieving their dreams by providing them with guidance and creative support as they navigate the online marketplace.

About Medina=Citi (http://www.medinaciti.com/)
Medina=Citi is a Newark based visual and multi-media design haus serving the Greater NY Area. The firm specializes in Branding Campaigns, Social Media Management and Graphic and Video Production. Their portfolio includes work for Gatorade, Enjoi Sweets, Kickstart Drinks and The Newark Museum. 

Liam Barnes - Director of Local Marketing at ShopKeep
Liam has held several managerial positions in local and event marketing in London for big multi-nationals like Diego, Nike and Burger King. But following his passion, he simultaneously consulted for startups and locally based charity groups.  

About ShopKeep (http://www.shopkeep.com/)
ShopKeep provides an intuitive, secure, iPad point-of-sale system with POS software that empowers merchants to run smarter businesses by optimizing staffing, regulating inventory and accessing sales reports and customer information on one seamless, cloud-based platform.
results.name: Growing Your Maker Business - Online Marketing and Micro Loans
