results.description:
Montclair State's Creative Research Center, the Feliciano Center for Entrepreneurship and Residence Life present the Fifth Annual Symposium on the Imagination "Weapons of Math Destruction: What Is an Algorithm?"


Which students should be accepted into which colleges?
What political messages should campaigns send to people on Facebook?
How long should prisoners go to jail?
What advertisements will appeal to you?
What kind of person would you like to date?

These questions used to be determined by people. But in the age of “big data,” they are increasingly being decided by algorithms. In Cathy O’Neil’s talk at Montclair State -- a special preview of her next book, coming out in the fall -- she will explore what algorithms are (and aren’t!), how they are built, their positive and negative effects, and the ways we can examine them for fairness and ethical behavior.

A lively Q&A will follow.

Cathy O'Neil is a data scientist, writer, and activist. She received a math Ph.D. from Harvard University and was a math professor for a time at Barnard College. In 2007 she went to work as a “quant” in finance for a few years before switching over to the tech world. After starting a blog at mathbabe.org, she joined Occupy Wall Street and started writing books about data science. Her new book, "Weapons of Math Destruction: How Big Data Increases Inequality and Threatens Democracy," will be released on Sept. 6, 2016 by Crown Books. On Twitter: @mathbabedotorg

Agenda:
6:00-6:45 p.m. Networking with pizza
6:45-7:00 p.m. Welcome
7:00-8:30 p.m. Cathy O'Neil presentation with audience Q&A

Event is presented by Creative Research Center, the Feliciano Center for Entrepreneurship and Residence Life.


Directions and parking info: Park in the Red Hawk Deck on campus, exit the deck on Level 5 and proceed straight up the walkway (soccer field will be on your left). At the new Feliciano School of Business building, turn right and go up the outdoor staircase. University Hall will be straight ahead once you reach the top of the steps. Campus map with directions. (Please note the map in that link is old--the tennis courts shown on the map is where the Feliciano School of Business building now stands.)


Join the conversation on Twitter and Instagram: #MSUmeetup and @FelicianoCenter<a href="https://twitter.com/wcecnj"></a>
results.name: Weapons of Math Destruction: What Is an Algorithm?

results.description:
***NOTE*** This group is currently full. We are not accepting any players at this time but if you send me a direct message, I will make a point to reach out to you if a spot does open up.


INTRODUCTION:Until just days ago, most members of our party were blissfully unaware of the Keys of Power and their creator, the Aramago. Even those that had any inkling of these topics thought the stories they’d heard to be mere legends. Then one of the Keys of Power was almost literally dropped in their lap. They were suddenly running for their lives guarding Melrick, the courier ferrying that item to a safe place.


Now, Melrick is dead and the party is cast adrift in an alien realm of existence. What’s worse, they’ve been separated from more than half of their number with seemingly no hope to reunite with them. So Theron, Clovis, and Drom cast about for ways to return to their home plane, reunite with their comrades, and most importantly, convey the precious cargo they carry to its rightful place.


However, all is not lost. Potential new allies have stepped forward. Already the elven ranger Thamior has shown his worth by warning the party of an impending ambush and nearly dying in helping to fight it off. And he’s introduced them to two more he knows can be trusted once the four of them reach the tiny village they hope will be a safe haven. They have just begun to relax for a much-needed warm meal when a gypsy strolls into the tavern and engages them directly with a desperate plea for help.


BACKGROUND:"The Keeper of the Keys" is a home-brewed, Dungeons and Dragons campaign. It is a shell that encompasses the numerous, separate adventures the players will enjoy during an epic quest to recover all the Keys of Power.


This game is one of two, biweekly games I am running in the Central Jersey D&D MeetUp group under the banner of “Adventures in Azocar”. It meets on the second and fourth Thursdays of each month. We may also have additional meetings if there’s a fifth Thursday in any given month but mostly, this will probably be kept open for make-up games.


I am looking for a group of players willing to commit to the schedule I propose; players whose attendance will not be an issue. These players also need to be ready to be involved in a long-running game. I know this because each time I've run "The Keeper of the Keys", it's encompassed almost the entirety of the PC's lifespan as adventurers.
results.name: The Keeper of the Keys - An Azocar Adventure

General Assembly (GA) is a global educational company on a mission to empower a global community to pursue work they love. Focusing on the most relevant and in-demand skills across data, design, business and technology, GA is confronting a skills gap through best-in-class instruction and providing access to opportunities. 

GA works with students online and in person across 15 campuses in 4 continents. GA also works with companies as partners in course development and graduate placement as well as helps companies stay competitive in today's digital landscape. Additionally, GA’s focus on affordable and accessible education combined with our education-to-employment approach is helping to create a diverse talent pipeline.


Branch provides free deep linking technology to mobile app developers and marketers. We're on a mission to help you grow their business through deep linking, and allow users to discover content inside mobile apps. In 14 months Branch grew to a company with 50 employees and raised 18 million in funding. In the last year, Branch has gone from powering deep linking for 6 million users to more than 1 billion users.

Grow.co is a community of growth marketing professionals and brands, comprised of more than 7,000 acquisition and retention-oriented professionals. We serve the community through industry summits, a weekly newsletter, a jobs board, and an online forum.

Mobile Growth meetups are powered by Branch and Grow.co
results.name: Mobile Growth NY with StreetEasy, Timehop, The Weather Company & Tumblr @ GA

results.description:
Course Details

Dates: Apr[masked] - Apr[masked]

Timings:  Weekday 6:30pm - 9:30pm

                 Weekend 11:00am – 5:00pm 

Price: Regular - $395 / Student - $295 / Repeater - $100

Online Registration Link: http://tinyurl.com/hg86n2l

About the program

In today’s demanding, distracting world your mind can be stuck in the past or in the future.  But happiness is here in the present moment.  It cannot be experienced when you’re regretting yesterday or worried about tomorrow.  During The Happiness Program you’ll reconnect with your unlimited power and freedom -- not as a concept, but as a direct experience.

Sudarshan Kriya® The centerpiece of The Happiness Program is Sudarshan Kriya, a powerful breathing technique that uses specific, natural rhythms to not only release stress at the deepest level, but also balance and integrate mind, body and heart.

Your course will also include:

• Stretching and low-impact yoga for health, circulation, and physical well-being.

• Guided meditation and breathing techniques that increase energy and deeply relax the body and mind.

• Skills for handling negative emotions and situations.

• Practical wisdom for improving focus at work and harmony in relationships.

• Guided interactive processes

Benefits

"The secret lies in our own breath. Through breathing exercises, certain breathing techniques and some practice of meditation, we can rekindle positive vibrations within and around us." -- Sri Sri Ravi Shankar, Founder of the Art of Living Foundation

• Reduced stress

• Greater sense of joy, happiness and enthusiasm

• Experience more confidence

• Development of interpersonal skills
results.name: The Happiness Program

results.description:
Over the last few years, there has been significant progress both in changing laws and also conversations taking place around the world regarding LGBT issues. In the US, achieving marriage equality was monumental for the LGBT community. However, people in the LGBT community are still denied many of the basic rights that most people enjoy both in the US and around the world. Join us at the Wix Lounge for a panel discussion on the current state of LGBT rights both in the US and abroad, how we can use technology to scale the conversation, and how we can create inclusive spaces for all people.

Featuring:

Ryan Kaminski- Program Manager for Human Rights and Special Initiative at the United Nations Foundation

Jonathan D. Lovitz- Vice President of External Affairs, National Gay & Lesbian Chamber of Commerce

James Felton Keith- Board and Patron member to OUT in STEM and OUT & Equal

* Light refreshments and appetizers will be served.

Join us for a conversation on what’s left to do in the fight for equality, and how people can get involved and take part in creating more inclusive spaces around the world.
results.name: LGBT Rights in the US and Around The World – What’s next?

The Consulate General of India, New York and the Art of Living Foundation are partnering to bring ‘Meditation Happy Hour’ to the community every other Thursday. A unique opportunity for you to experience stillness in the city that is always ON. Leveraging the ancient techniques of yoga, breath and meditation, the 60 minute session will allow you to go beyond daily mental stresses and help you recharge yourself and tap into greater happiness, purpose, creativity & intuition.

This 60-minute free meditation class is open for people with any or no experience with meditation, yoga or breathing.

Game description: 

Teams are 4 V 4, no goalies, no gender requirements (but we'd like at least 1 female player per team). Games will be played on a 1st goal rotation basis or 15 minutes time limit. The team that scores first stays on  the field. But if your team remains on the field after scoring 3 goals, we'll split the team up so that everyone has a fair chance to have a great game.

RULES OF THE GAME:

First and most important rule of the game is to have fun and enjoy the time on the field! 

VERY IMPORTANT: 

- NO FOULS

- NO SIDE TACKLING

- NO PUSHING

- NO TELLING OFF

* ZERO TOLERANCE*


By minimizing physical contact, we minimize injuries and violence.


         “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”

If you don't sign up for the game, do not show up.

Rough play and offensive language will absolutely not be tolerated!!

We encourage competitive, but safe play. 

We reserve the right to ask anyone to leave who has exhibited any behavior that could be construed as violent, offensive, or dangerous. 

Those that don't comply with these rules, will kindly be asked to leave the field so others can enjoy the game. 


Any other questions regarding the rules of the game or anything else, should be directed to the organizer directly or to the assistant organizer/s!!!

Please check our meetup message board, 10 PM the night before to see what team you are on. This will save us a lot of time on the field.

Location and Directions:

West End Presbyterian Church

165 West 105th Street, New York, NY

Near the lines: 1, 2, 3, B, and C trains.

AS YOU COME IN, TAKE THE STAIRS ON YOUR LEFT AND WALK TO THE 4TH FLOOR.

Call me if you can’t find us - (917)[masked] Manny S.


What to bring with you: 
A positive attitude, pair of sneakers or INDOOR shoes (ONLY), shin guards (recommended) and lots of water.

Fee: 
You will be asked to pay $9.50 dollars when you RSVP. This $9.50 dollars is used to pay for: permits, meetup fees, Amazon fees, Goals, soccer balls etc.

Refund Policy: 


* The Meetup is cancelled

* You can cancel at least 2 day(s) before the Meetup


Very IMPORTANT Due to the location where we will be playing:

We expect everyone to respect the facilities and act accordingly.

Anyone who is asked to leave will not be refunded and WILL be permanently banned from the group

After the game we can go for a quick drink at:

                                            TAP a KEG

                                         2731 Broadway

                                     New York, NY 10025

                            Betwee[masked]th and Broadway  

By RSVP'ing you agree to our Liability waiver:

PARTICIPATING IN MANHATTAN-INTERNATIONAL-COED-SOCCER ACTIVITIES AGREEMENT: 


I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore, I, individually, hereby release and discharge, Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and Assistant Organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer programs or activities. Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and its Assistant Organizers reserve the right to take and utilize photographs, video, or any type of recording of participating person while engaged in our or associated activities. results.description:
Event, space and refreshments sponsored by: Bloomberg

Event agenda:

6:30 - 7:00 PM: Networking & Food

7:00 - 7:20 PM: "Sentiment Analysis - From Bag of Words to Bag of Insights" by Vika Abrecht 

7:20 - 7:40 PM: "News Story Classification by Feature Extraction and Ranking" by Anna Cianciara

7:40 - 8:00 PM: "How to Train Your Search Engine" by Haoyun Feng

8:00 - 8:20 PM: "Practical Considerations for ML Evaluation at Scale" by Leslie Barrett

8:20 - 9:00 PM: Q&A and Socializing

"Sentiment Analysis - From Bag of Words to Bag of Insights"
In this talk Vika Abrecht will talk about evolution of sentiment analysis projects at Bloomberg. She will show how sentiment analysis concepts and techniques can be applied to various sources and a range of targets to extract valuable financial insights. Vika will discuss the application of methods from machine learning, statistical analysis, linguistics, and finance to provide solutions that help shed light onto the current status and future directions of financial markets. She will talk about upcoming initiatives, outstanding challenges and lessons learned.

Vika Abrecht is a Machine Learning Software Engineer at Bloomberg. She leads the Text Analysis team and works on projects related to sentiment analysis, trending topics, and social media analysis. She received her undergraduate degree in Computer Science from University at Albany and her Masters in Machine Learning from Columbia University. 


"News Story Classification by Feature Extraction and Ranking"

In this talk we present a novel alternative to statistical classification of news stories: a method to enhance classification rules in our existing proprietary framework by extracting features from unstructured text and ranking key terms and phrases according to their predictive value.

Anna holds degrees in Journalism and Library Science from the University of Wisconsin, Madison, specializing in digital media and information retrieval. She has been working on information organization and natural language processing projects for Bloomberg since 2008.

How to Train Your Search Engine

The Bloomberg terminal aggregates, stores, and classifies more than one million news stories from over 100,000 sources daily and brings together 350+ exchanges, 4,000+ Foreign Exchange feeds and 80,000+ newswires from across the world. Haoyun will talk about how we apply machine learning algorithms to build a search engine that helps our clients discover and navigate information inside the Bloomberg terminal.

Haoyun Feng works in the R&D Relevance and Discovery team in Bloomberg LP. She builds the search engine for data on the Bloomberg terminal, which news stories from wires around the world, real-time exchange data, equity analysis, people profiles, and beyond. Before joining Bloomberg, Haoyun received her Ph.D. in Biophysics from the University of Notre Dame and a M.S. in Machine Learning from Columbia University.

"Practical Considerations for ML Evaluation at Scale"

Machine Learning is a popular technique for solving problems like automated document classification, named entity recognition, sentiment analysis and many other predictive tasks. Evaluating different approaches on different data sets, however is key to getting the optimal benefits from this technology. As ML has evolved, so have the ways that we look at performance and convey performance metrics to stakeholders. This talk will cover some of the most useful evaluation metrics for doing evaluation at scale, in a dynamic enterprise environment, where crucial product decisions must be made on the basis of this data. 

Leslie Barrett is a member of the Bloomberg Verticals Machine Learning Team specializing in Information Retrieval, Information Extraction and Classification Evaluation. She holds a Ph.D. from New York University in Computational Linguistics.
results.name: Machine Learning at Bloomberg

results.description:
The Bi Book Club meets once a month to discuss bi-themed books and the issues they raise. Dinner after nearby at Village Den on Greenwich Ave behind the Center. 

The Lunatic, the Lover, and the Poet, an award-winning fiction novel by Myrlin A. Hermes, is the book for our Thurs April 14 meeting -now on sale at BGSQD.

The Lunatic, the Lover, and the Poet is Shakespeare turned topsy turvy: a bisexual love-triangle inspired by Shakespeare′s own sonnets, featuring a sexy young Hamlet. Very readable--no olde English. We're discussing the second half of this book in April.

Come and join the discussion, even if you haven't read the book, because we read paragraphs from the book aloud and discuss them.


Note: The Shakespeare Sonnets, and Shakespeare, were bisexual.

Next book: A Winter in Rome by Francis Gideon, Less Than Three Press. Get your copy from BGSQD coming in by Wed Apr 6 or Thurs Apr 7. 

Deciding Books: We will be voting on what books we want to read next, so check our lists of Bisexual Book Award finalists for some ideas.

Venue: Bureau of General Services Queer Division Bookstore at the LGBT Center, 2nd fl. Rm. 210, phone (646) 457-0859.

Getting Books: We urge you to purchase your print copy at BGSQD and support the only LGBT bookstore in New York City. Especially since they are hosting us in their space! If they are out of stock, put in your special order.

Bi Book Club meets 2nd Thursdays 6:30-8pm. Dinner after nearby-we usually go to Village Den on Greenwich Ave behind the Center.

Fees: Donation to help pay rent

Questions? Email fuscialadybug (at) netzero (dot) com or call[masked]
results.how_to_find_us: Rm. 210-Bureau of General Services: Queer Division Bookstore. 2nd floor.

At this meeting we will discuss why there are more millionaires created through real estate than all other industries combined. Right now we're in a once in a lifetime Real Estate buyers market which is helping to fuel our expansion. The combination of record low mortgage rates and underpriced housing values is why our group is making a killing in this market. Even the "world's greatest Investor" Warren Buffet is advising people to buy real estate.

Being that seating is limited please answer the RSVP questions and provide your full name, phone number and email address. 

You will have the opportunity to:

• Network with a local group of successful Real Estate Investors.

• Learn how rental properties are one of the best tax saving strategies out there. 

• Discuss the biggest money making opportunities in today's market: Short Sales, Lease Options, Fix and Flips, Foreclosures, Seller Financed Notes, and Multi-Family Dwellings.

• Learn how to be your own boss. 

• Learn how to build massive wealth strategies such as Fix and Flips and passive wealth with Rental Properties.

• And so much more

We will show you a few deals we've completed recently & explain how you can be included in the deals we have going forward. We will also show you how can become part of our network and be coached and mentored by seasoned real estate mentors so you can complete deals of your own. Each meeting is different as we discuss different deals we've closed.

Some of our members invest part time for residual income while others have been able to FIRE THEIR BOSS to invest full time. If you are interested in learning how to make consistent $10,000 or more per month please register for this event. We have a wide network of Real Estate Investors local to the NY Metro Area that will show you how.

Being that seating is limited please answer the RSVP questions and provide your full name, phone number and email address.

This is an opportunity to practice Japanese conversation, and discuss and study the grammar, particles, Kanji, and culture. The topic varies among all these, according to what people are interested in talking about and the natural flow of conversation.

Members of all levels are welcome, from absolute beginners on up, and there is never a prerequisite. Native speakers are also encouraged to attend, both to lend their expertise and to receive the benefit of a look at the structure of Japanese from an outside linguistic perspective.

The meeting is free, with no membership dues, hourly costs, or other expenses.

results.description:
Welcome to the Analyst Collective

In the past few months, several folks at RJMetrics have built the seeds of a new workflow for analytics. We believe analysts should work more like software engineers—they should write reusable code, collaborate using git, run automated tests, open source their work, and more. We're calling the project Analyst Collective, and we're building open tooling to facilitate this workflow. We'll share our current thinking and the tools we've built in this session.

More information here.

https://medium.com/@jthandy/building-a-mature-analytics-workflow-the-analyst-collective-viewpoint-7653473ef05b#.jx04dt9h4

results.description:
Okay guys, I figured I'd try this one again, this time after work.  The lake is very pretty at night, and this will get your heart pumping just enough without feeling like you overdid it.  I've never tried to organize a night hike before, so we'll see what kind of response I get.  If there's demand, I may do more.  Be sure to bring a headlamp, or a flashlight and a couple liters of water.  Afterwards, we'll grab a bite to eat somewhere.  It's the first parking lot off of 287 after you get off the exit onto Skyline Drive, so keep your eyes open for it.  I'll give those of you who sign up my cell number just in case. Driving Directions

Take Interstate Route 287 to Exit 57 (Skyline Drive/Ringwood) and proceed north on Skyline Drive (following the signs to "Ringwood"). Just ahead on the left is the Ramapo Mountain State Forest parking area.

Description

From the southern end of the parking area, follow the blue blazes of the MacEvoy Trail, which passes stone ruins, turns right onto a woods road and climbs a steep pitch. The trail continues to climb on a wide, rocky path, paralleling a cascading brook (particularly attractive after heavy rains). About half a mile from the start, the white-blazed Todd Trail begins to the right, but you should continue ahead on the blue-blazed trail, which crosses a tributary stream.

Near the crest of the rise, the yellow-blazed Hoeferlin Trail joins from the right. Continue ahead, now following both blue and yellow blazes. After a short descent, the trail reaches a paved estate road. Turn left and follow the road downhill to the dam. Here, the blue blazes turn right, but you should continue ahead across the dam of Ramapo Lake, following the yellow blazes.

On the other side of the dam, the red-blazed Lookout Trail begins on the left, and in about 500 feet, the yellow-blazed Hoeferlin Trail leaves to the left. Continue ahead along the wide gravel road, now unmarked, which runs close to the lakeshore, with views across the lake. To the north, atop a hill with several pines, you can see the ruins of Foxcroft, a mansion built in 1910 which fell into disrepair in the 1950s.

The road proceeds through dense laurel thickets, crosses a causeway over an arm of the lake, and passes a swamp to the left and several interesting rock outcrops. It then moves away from the lakeshore but continues to parallel it, with views over the lake through the trees.

Just past the southern end of the lake, about a mile from the dam, the road reaches a T intersection, where you should turn right. Then, in another 300 feet, bear right at a Y intersection. Here, the Cannonball Trail, marked by white-“C”-on-red blazes, joins from the left. You’re now heading north through dense laurel thickets, paralleling the western shore of Ramapo Lake. At first, the road runs some distance from the water, but after a while, the lake can be seen through the trees. In half a mile, you’ll pass a building on the hillside to the left (formerly used as a ranger station) and, a short distance beyond, a rock ledge to the right of the trail offers a pleasant view of the lake.

Soon, another gravel road joins from the left. Follow the road ahead, crossing a stone causeway that isolates a quiet pond on the left from the main body of the lake. Next, you’ll reach another Y intersection. Here, the Cannonball Trail turns left onto an intersecting gravel road, but you should bear right and continue along a winding section of the lakeshore road, now once again unmarked. A short distance ahead, bear left as another road leads right. After passing a small, abandoned stone building to the right, you’ll come to another intersection. Here, you should bear right, joining the blue-blazed MacEvoy Trail.

Follow the blue-blazed gravel road that runs close to the shore along the northern end of the lake, passing a private residence on a ledge to the left. When you return to the northern end of the dam, bear left, uphill, on the road, then follow the blue blazes as they turn right, reentering the woods. Continue along the blue-blazed trail, retracing your steps back to the parking area where the hike began.
results.name: After Work Headlamp Hike: Ramapo Lake and Thatcher McGee's

results.description:
This next meetup will be joint gathering with BitcoinNYC http://www.meetup.com/BitcoinNYC/events/229368541/  It will be an introduction to the Hyperledger project, including an overview of its organization, contributors, goals, architecture, implementation, and other introductory material.  The goal of this meet up will be to be an "on ramp" to understanding Hyperledger while providing an opportunity for networking.

>>> PURCHASE TICKETS HERE <<<

PLEASE BYPASS the RSVP button at right and register directly above. If you are a dues-paying Member of Out Professionals, this assures you no-cost or low-cost admission to this event. (Nonmembers are always welcome, but nonmember rates apply if you are just part of our Meetup group.) For a full year of Member savings and other career benefits, join Out Professionals here.

AN AWARD-WINNING SOMMELIER INTRODUCES OUT PROFESSIONALS TO THE WIDE RANGE OF ROSÉ, NEW YORKERS’ FAVORITE WARM-WEATHER WINE.

On Thursday, April 14, Out Professionals invites Members and friends to Le Du’s Wines, the West Village wine shop rated Number One in New York City by Zagat.

In a tasting class inaugurating the Out Professionals Wine Club, the shop’s founder, James Beard Award-winning sommelier Jean-Luc Le Du, guides you through an eye-opening selection of rosé wines, a favorite warm-weather choice of New Yorkers.

Among the evening’s wines:

• Pétillant Naturel “La Ritournelle,” Breton

• Matthiasson Rosé, Napa Valley 2015

• Provence Rosé, Château d’Esclans “Rock Angel” 2014

• Sancerre Rosé, Lauverjat 2015

• Provence Rosé, Esprit de Gassier 2015

• Domaine de Peyrassol Rosé 2015

A generous sample of each wine is paired with cheese and charcuterie from Murray’s Cheese Shop, a Village favorite for 75 years. OP Members and guests enjoy a 15 percent discount on wines purchased during the evening. French gourmet confectionaries by Cure Gourmand.

The evening is designed to offer ample time for relaxed networking with other Out Professionals members and guests.

WHERE

Le Du’s Wines, 600 Washington Street, between Morton and Leroy Streets in the West Village. Subway: A/C/E, B/D/F/M to West 4th Street; 1 to Houston Street; PATH to Christopher Street.

WHAT’S UP

Doors open at 6:30 p.m. To launch the evening, you are greeted with a welcoming glass of a sparkling rosé. From 7 to 8:45 p.m., tastings and commentary on five rosé wines, each paired with cheese and charcuterie. Enjoy a 15 percent discount on wines purchased this evening. Gourmet confectioneries by Cure Gourmande.

ADMISSION

Nonmember, $70. Dues-paying OP Member, $55. Space is limited for this inaugural event. To avoid disappointment, register in advance. Pre-registration closes at noon on Tuesday, April 13. Pocket a copy of your online receipt; thanks! All sales final. Sorry, no refunds or exchanges.

IT PAYS TO BE AN OP MEMBER!

A 12-month Individual Out Professionals Membership (new or renewal) PLUS guaranteed admission for one to OP’s inaugural tasting class, just $95. And remember, that buys you a year’s worth of low-cost or no-cost networking and socializing! Order here.

results.description:
After learning programming fundamentals and the basics of web development at Dev Bootcamp you may be wondering how to transition the skills you've honed into a career as an iOS developer. Dying to know how to make those glowing rectangles on your iPhone move around? Curious about how to get started with programming languages like Swift? Join us for a demo, talk and code along with Dev Bootcamp graduate Thomas Abend. He will present examples from his portfolio, introduce Swift and CGGeometry, and share general tips on how to get started in iOS development.

Thomas Abend is a 2014 Dev Bootcamp alumnus (Bees Michael!) who works as an iOS/everything developer at Hopscotch, an app that seeks to make programming available to everyone with a smartphone. Before becoming an engineer at Hopscotch, Thomas taught 8th grade English in Greenville, Mississippi and Newark, New Jersey. He studied Philosophy at Princeton University and was first exposed to coding through PLOrk, Princeton’s laptop orchestra. When he isn’t figuring out new ways to make Bears move around the screen, he enjoys playing music, cooking and fencing.

results.description:
This is a free group for anyone who enjoys playing board games and would like to make new friends while doing so. No previous knowledge of board games is necessary. We're happy to help newcomers along with how to play, as well as how to plan strategies to win the games.  

Our event is every Thursday night at Dave & Buster's in Westbury Long Island from 6:30pm to 10:30pm.  You can leave prior to 10:30pm if you want, also please note that Dave & Buster's closes at Midnight for those who want to stay later. 

Most people arrive at 6:30pm.  We use the first 30 minutes to talk, order food/drinks, and pick out games while we wait for any people that are a little late.  Promptly at 7pm we split into groups and play our games that typically take 2 hours to play.  So, if you arrive after 7pm there is a good chance that you will not be able to get into a game and can watch us play if you'd like.  At the end of the night we play a couple of additional shorter games that you can get into.

This group meets in the Large Dining Room at the table directly in front of the wall with 9 Big Screen TV's (We are located 1 room over from the pool tables).  There is no cover charge to enter Dave & Buster's and plenty of parking is available. Also, there is no fee to join this meetup group. All that management at Dave & Buster's asks is that each person purchase $5 off their menu (it can be 1 appetizer, or 1 dessert, or a few sodas, basically whatever you choose).  

Plenty of board games will be present at this event, but feel free to bring some of your favorites. Some of the games that we play are Kingsburg, Stone Age, Lords of Waterdeep, Istanbul, Ticket to Ride, Carcassonne, Castles of Mad King Ludwig, Love Letter Batman, Splendor, Pirate's Cove, Five Tribes, Castles of Burgundy, and more.  

Here is a list of the board games I own on the BGG website: 

https://boardgamegeek.com/collection/user/MarkNY8?own=1&subtype=boardgame&ff=1

Here is a list of Co-Host Kenny's games on BGG: 

https://boardgamegeek.com/collection/user/kenk1982?own=1&subtype=boardgame&ff=1

Looking forward to meeting you. 

Mark

I'm loving the momentum of this group and witnessing how folks are improving their language skills and making friends. To me, it makes all of this worth doing!

So let's get ready for another great meetup! 

As always, first introduce yourself in the language you are studying. Then introduce yourself in your native language. 

Following that, we will dedicate 30 minutes towards helping those learning English, then 30 minutes of Chinese. 

Then we mingle again until its time to go. 

We are usually done by 8:30 but those that want to stick around or continue hanging out after the meetup (bubble tea, karaoke, etc) are more than welcome to do so!

Thanks again for your support thus far and let's have many more great meetups! 非常感谢大家的支持！

Nino’s Tuscany Steakhouse
117 W 58th (6th and 7th Avenue)
Thursday, April 14th
5:45pm optional drinks, 6:45pm dinner
Famous 100-year old piano player- Irving Fields
$76- 3-course dinner, gl wine, coffee, tax & tip 

After you RSVP here, please go to the website to prepay, www.thesinglegourmet.net/event/ninos-tuscany/ ALL of our events are prepaid and we average 25-40 people. We do not take cash at the door as the restaurants need an accurate headcount and seating is assigned via tables and demographics. With such a large group, it is just the way restaurants will accept us. We are a membership only organization, but allow meetup members to attend some of our events to meet new faces. To see more of our events and to join, please go to www.thesinglegourmet.net Thank you for understanding.

When we ate at Nino’s in March, Nino turned to me and said, “let’s do this again as soon as possible” and offered up his other restaurant in midtown! This location was the original location referred to me by a long standing member of our group and friend of Irving Fields. I promised her in due time we will dine here and Nino made it happen! Zagat rated for “More than typical neighborhood Italian, this exudes old-world charm from the comfortable settings to the delicious, traditional cooking; maybe pricey, but smiling servers always enhance the experience." The piano player, Irving Fields is world famous and at 100 years old, he alone is worth coming to see.

results.description:
Welcome to those just joining our group...the club that no one wanted to be a member of, we are glad you found us but sorry for the reason we are all here.


Please join us for a weekly Chatham Healing Hearts & Widowed Any Age Any Stage meetup for dinner at Charlie Browns in Chatham., Everyone gets a separate check so there is no concern of having to wait and do calculating every week. They also have a card for points that you can use and get coupons off every so often.   

This meetup is a spin off of a once a month meetup at Charlie Browns in Chatham "Healing Hearts", it is open to all members of Healing Hearts not just those Widowed. 

All those grieving and wanting to get out with people are Welcome!

We are all Healing together and it helps to be with those that "get it". 

This is an ongoing social group and hopefully a resource for making friends that will part of your new normal. 

The need for meeting up more often than once a month was needed and so it was decided to meet weekly because once a month getting together with people that "get it"is just not enough. 

We look forward to meeting you and hope you can join us as soon as possible and be part of this meetup as it grows to be a comforting and fun place for people in this club that no one wants to be a member of.  We also find that it is much easier on the brain to remember EVERY Thursday!  I will try to be there every Week and we have some other volunteers to be greeters..called Event Hosts. Just let me know that your interested in greeting and I'll be happy to make you an event host. Sincerely, Stacey Gregg
results.name: Social time-Weekly Thursday Dinner at Charlie Browns in Chatham

At some point, everyone wants to get away...to travel, see' new things, meet new people, get to know a new side of YOU. 

With GET AWAY as the theme, #EvolutionOpenMic  will touch on that, with the help of the night's #AscendedArtists  who know thing or two about traveling: The Bi-lingual hip hop duo, Negros Americanos  (Mcenigma Lyle and Jordan Fields )

*List opens for sign ups at 6:30PM--- 20 SLOTS ONLY!!!

* one piece limit for poets, singers, and emcees. 5 minutes for other performers.

Kween Moore of Urban Kween Brand will present the #CanvasOfResource

 for us to fill up with our musings through paint.

* $5 cover plus donations

. 


ABOUT THE SHOW: 

EVOLUTION is about pushing through the comfort zone and into the unknown, for individuals must go beyond remedial to truly say they are grown. This combination open mic/ discussion forum is a safe space for all races, genders, sexual preferences, spiritual backgrounds, and art forms. Attendees will be presented a theme each week to engage as an artist and/or spectator. Part training ground, part chill spot, EVOLUTION only grows as a platform for expression so long as the people grow by using it. Risk must be taken here, if only to show others, and ourselves, what is still needed to 

#EVOLVENJ

.

In April, we'll be discussing Purity. If you've ever read The Corrections or Freedom, you'll know that Jonathan Franzen is quite a master of prose. Let's gather together to discuss his latest novel. 

"‘Purity,’ Jonathan Franzen’s Most Intimate Novel Yet" -The New York Times

This novel has multiple main characters, they cross paths, we delve into their pasts, and we encounter plot twists. This month, we'll be discussing this novel in a relatively new venue that has a 'meet, work, play' motto; it's a bar-meets-cafe-meets-rooftop-meets-game area that's fitting for this ambitious novel. 

-----

results.description:
Taoist Herbs and Secrets For Spring Attunement

Special guest, Master Herbalist Nam Singh will demystify Chinese herbs and talk about how to bring the benefits of some of the most nourishing tonic herbs into healing teas and dishes.

• Understanding Taoism though the 3 intelligences of  your gut 

• Learn how to shift awareness from Winter hibernation to Spring activation 

• Discover simple practices  for recalibrating yourself  during the seasonal changes of Spring 

 • Get insight into the most powerful tonic herbs for this time of the year  that replenish the deepest energy resources in the body, increase vitality and enhance the connection with your inner power 

Spring time, as things on earth begin to grow, people begin to feel vitality and increase their activity. Increase foods to benefit enriching the blood, liver, kidney and moistening the respiratory tract. From a Taoist perspective: "We experience a birth within ourselves in spring."


Nam Singh, L.Ac., O.M.D., N.C. is a practitioner of all eight limbs of Chinese Medicine: Meditation, Exercise, Diet, Herbology, Astrology, Feng Shui, Massage, Acupuncture and Moxabustion. He is a graduate of the Tai Pei Institute of Traditional Pharmacology and Acupuncture, a graduate of Wei Chuan’s Culinary Institute Tai Pei, R.O.C. Taiwan, as well as a chef specializing in Chinese medicinal cuisine

results.description:
We will watch videos of Brilliant People sharing Brilliant Ideas. We will discuss how to use these ideas to enhance our lives. This Thursday we will watch Ellen Langer on MINDFULNESS, a Harvard professor of psychology, determines that the mindless following of routine and other automatic behaviors lead to much error, pain and a predetermined course of life. She will show some positive strategies to enhance our lives.


We will also watch The GOSPEL OF DOUBT (TED Talk) by Casey Gerald. What do you do when your firmly held beliefs turn out not to be true? When Casey's religion failed him, he searched for something new to believe in — in business, in government, in philanthropy — but found only false saviors. In this moving talk, Gerald urges us all to question our beliefs and embrace uncertainty (If you know of some brilliant videos, please let us know).

TIME and PLACE: All Souls Unitarian Church 80th Street and Lexington Ave. Follow signs to get to the room. We will start at 7:00 pm sharp, so please come at least by 6:45. Please bring pen and paper to write with. (Thursday evenings 14th, 21st, and 28th)

About the Band
Few ensembles have survived half a century keeping unchanged its rhythmic identity, overcoming the thrust of the music industry and resisting the vicissitudes of consumer culture as it has done El Gran Combo de Puerto Rico. Unlike other salsa orchestras, particularly those arising in New York since the late 1960s, our so-called "Mulatos del Sabor" have always protected their musical timbre innovations and complex experiments, safeguarding the proper, simple and rhythmic sound that it has been characterized since its founding, May 26, 1962.

results.description:
Git is an open source and free Source Code Management System (SCM) (a.k.a, Revision Control System or 'the stupid content tracker'). It is used to store your code (or any documents really) and manage the versions of that code through the development lifecycle. More specifically, it’s a Distributed Revision Control System, which means when you have a copy of the code, you actually have a copy of the entire repository.

Speed: Git is very fast! Forks, Branches and Merging: work on copies of code and merge when your new work is stabilized. History: track the history of code over its lifespan. Work Online or Offline: Git keeps the entire repository locally on your machine so you can work online and even when you're offline (commits and all). Collaboration Popularity and Community Support: Git is easy, it’s also supported by innumerable tools and services and has become something of a de facto standard. Git is a flexible and powerful, used in many different ways. Topics include but not limited to:

installing Git Git basics Git swagger practicing good Git hygiene playing nicely with others Github basics contributing to open source About the Speaker:

Robert Bellamy is a Senior Software Engineer at NBCUniversal who is very passionate about delivering well architected open source solutions. His experience across a broad range of industries has seen him deliver user centric, fast performing solutions for a diverse client base. He specializes in the CMS Drupal and is a core contributor to the project and other Open Source communities. He is a co-organizer of the Gotham Sass meetup and lead organizer for the DevOps Camp Camp (formerly DevOps summit) at The United Nations.

Prior to joining NBCUniversal Robert worked at NorthPoint Digital/EY and was a freelance web developer working primarily in the arts industry, helping artists and organizations leverage open source tools. He holds a Bachelor of Music in Double Bass Performance from The Manhattan School of Music.

Huge shout out to our meetup host Pivotal Labs for providing their amazing space!
results.name: SassHack/SassShop: Intro to Git

results.description:
Featured speaker:


Allen Firstenberg (https://developers.google.com/experts/people/allen-firstenberg)

Brillo and Weave: A First Look At Google I/O 2015, Google announced it would be launching projects based around the Internet of Things. This January at the Ubiquity Developers Summit people got the first chance to learn about Weave, a communications protocol, and Brillo, an embedded operating system. At this presentation, we'll learn about how each of these projects work, why Google has launched them, and why you (as a manufacturer, developer, and consumer) should care. We'll even have a first look at some hardware and code using Brillo and Weave.

.Lightning Talk: Google Vision API Google has recently released the Google Vision API, allowing you to tap into Google's neural network to analyze your photos. The API provides a quick, network based, way to identify brand logos, landmarks, objects, facial features, facial reactions, and possibly NSFW images. If you've used Google Photos, you're already using similar technology, but now you can easily integrate it into your own project with just a few lines. We'll see how.
results.name: IoT:  Brillo and Weave A First Look

results.description:
You're invited to join us for this weekly opportunity to sharpen your drawing skills! This session is open to sketchers of all levels.

What makes our sessions different? 

• We start on time in a large, clean, well-lit space. 

• Sketchers can concentrate because our room is quiet while the model is posing.

• We have coffee and cookies at the long break. 

• We finish on time so you can be headed home at 9:00 p.m sharp! 

• (Latecomers can be seated at a break.)


• This is a two hour drawing session to work from a live (nude) model.  

• We start with short 2 minute poses and work up to a 20 minute pose by the end of the session. We take a 5 minute break every 20 minutes. 


• There are seats for everyone tables and several light weight easels. 


• Access to a sink is available for watercolor artist.

• Bring your own materials (no oil or acrylic paint and no sprays please.)

As always if you have any questions please feel free to email me. I look forward to seeing you there. 

Simon
results.how_to_find_us: Ask for the drawing class on the second floor.

results.description:
Join us at Genspace for another lecture presented as part of the Know Science series. Know Science is an international education and advocacy organization working to promote knowledge of science and scientific research to a non-specialized audience.

Most people associate the word "bacteria" with disease, but we have ten times more bacteria than human cells in our body. Why do we have these bacteria?

It is known as commensalism when one organism benefits from another without affecting it. In this case, the human organism is benefitting from bacteria. These commensal bacteria help us develop our immune system, digest and absorb food, and even prevent the colonization of otherpathogenic bacteria, or bacteria that cause disease.

However, imbalances in the populations of commensal bacteria are associated with several diseases, particularly inflammatory bowel disease, or IBD. Dr. Deepshika Ramanan's work as a graduate student has focused on identifying these imbalances, and possible therapeutic options to prevent them.

Deepshika Ramanan is a graduate student at New York University.  She received her B.Sc. in Cell and Molecular Biology from Winona State University in 2008. During the summer of 2007, she was awarded a fellowship to perform undergraduate research at the Mayo Clinic in the laboratory of Dr. Richard Bram where she was introduced to immunology. To prepare for a career in science, she worked as a research technician in the laboratory of Dr. Edwin Chapman from[masked], and then enrolled in the NYU School of Medicine Sackler Immunology and Inflammation Ph.D. program.
results.name: Microbiome: How Commensal Bacteria Can Be Our Friends

results.description:
Get ready to get happier simply by talking about happiness! We'll be in the cafe. Look for our red Meetup sign. Please feel free to arrive late or leave early. It's great if you can RSVP in advance, but in case you can't, come anyway.

As a reminder, this group has two goals. The first is to explore the relationship between happiness and goodness. The second, much more fun, goal is for us to become much happier just by getting together and talking about happiness. The theory behind this second goal comes from a classic psychology study showing that by simply talking regularly about happiness we can become much happier.

While we'll often have set topics, like gratitude, acts of kindness, meditation and other happiness techniques, the following list of 14 topics will serve as a backdrop for our discussions.

1. Keep busy and be more active
2. Spend more time socializing
3. Be productive at meaningful work
4. Get better organized and plan things out
5. Stop worrying
6. Lower your expectations and aspirations
7. Develop positive, optimistic thinking
8. Become present oriented
9. Develop an outgoing, social personality
10. Work on a healthy personality
11. Be yourself
12. Eliminate negative feelings and problems
13. Close relationships are the number one source of happiness
14. Put happiness as your most important priority.

Here's some background on the research our group is based on.

In 1980 three New Zealand researchers found that after eight 2-hour conversation sessions about happiness over four weeks, their subjects reported a 22 percent increase in their happiness. Continuing their twice-weekly sessions, by the sixteenth week they reported being 42 percent happier.

Our list of topics comes from Fort Myers, Florida psychologist Michael Fordyce's "14 Fundamentals of Happiness." In 1977, Fordyce pioneered the science of happiness-increase with the world's first experiment designed to boost individual happiness.

That's the group, and those are our goals. It's also very, very important that we have fun. With that in mind, let's get ready to get good and happy!

Resources:

For those interested in learning about the major findings from social science research about happiness, and becoming happier, here are links to several excellent peer-reviewed articles that can be downloaded as pdf files for free. (Note: Although these classic articles are somewhat dated, decades of research on happiness reveal that findings on happiness tend to be extremely stable over time.)

Pursuing Happiness: The Architecture of Sustainable Change
By S Lyubomirsky, KM Sheldon and D Schkade, 2005.  21 pages

In Pursuit of Happiness: Empirical Answers to Philosophical Questions
By P Kesebir and E Diener, 2008. 9 pages.

Subjective Well-Being: Three Decades of Progress
By E Diener, EM Suh, RE Lucas and HL Smith, 1999. 27 pages
results.name: Each Thurs. from 7-9pm  Happiness and Goodness at Barnes & Noble in White Plains

results.description:
Real-World React

There are tons of examples of small-scale situations where React is simple, elegant and magical. However the real world has real problems, and no framework or paradigm is immune to the spaghetti syndrome. We want to talk about getting past the simplistic and still being happy with React.

Asynchronous server rendering in an isomorphic/universal React+Redux app
Jeremy Gayed
Tech Lead & Senior Developer, New York Times

Heavyweight React: Design, architecture & performance in non-trivial applications
Adil Wali
Founder, Fox Commerce

High-level decisions for a front-end platform
Giorgio Leveroni, Teachers Pay Teachers


Cross-Platform Code Sharing: "Write Once" can work
Colin Vernon
ex-Director of Software at littleBits

The East River Park track is east of the FDR at East 6th Street. It is a little over a mile from the closest subway stops (6 to Astor Place or L to First Ave).

Thursday workouts change from week to week and will be announced in advance.

Important Information about East River Park Track: The Whippets have been running here for many years and have experienced thefts of our belongings. We will take extra precautions to keep our bags safe, but please avoid bringing valuables -- and it would be safest to run with your wallet on you.

Please be aware that there are limited overhead lights, so it gets a little dark, and during winter months the bathrooms are locked and the water fountains are off. If you have a bike, make sure you have a lock because you'll have to keep your bike outside the track area.

We recommend not bringing valuables to the track. You can drop stuff off at Ace Bar (531 East 5th Street between A and B) -- ask for Justin or Charlo and tell them you run with the team. 


See you there -- and please contact a Whippet captain if you have any questions!
results.how_to_find_us: We meet in a small group just inside the turnstile, or we gather in the track infield near the long jump pit

results.description:
This group is for developing book-length manuscripts or working on standalone pieces (Short Stories, Flash Fiction, Novels, Novellas, Poems, Creative Non-Fiction/Memoir, Etc.)

This is a new critique group with a new format. We will focus on short stories, flash fiction, novels/novellas, poetry, creative non-fiction/memoir, with some participants having the end goal of putting together book-length manuscripts. This is a speculative fiction group so the work should be in the magical realist, surrealist, horror, sci-fi, fantasy, etc. genres. American Gothic and poetic memoir would fall into these categories. This group is broad and is a good space to submit works that may not fall clearly into a set format.

For the first group, please submit a 3-5-page sample and a mission statement/end goal. I am putting together a shared Google drive to distribute the work to everyone who will be attending the meeting.

We will follow stories, chapters from novels, poems, pieces/vignettes, flash works that center around a shared world or set of characters so that we can support each other's progress throughout the process of creating either the finished manuscript or working on separate pieces. If you are already in a novel group, you are welcome to bring another novel or a different work to this meeting, but please don't submit a novel that is already being critiqued by a novel group.

The format will be slightly different than the critique groups that utilize the Clarion method. Everyone will have the chance to participate and give critiques. When submitting a piece for the first time, the author will let us know what their vision is for the finished manuscript: approximate length, overarching themes, goals during the writing process, what their driving force is for writing this manuscript. When submitting the work for critique, the author will write three questions/areas that they would like readers to focus on or special challenges they have had in writing. During the meeting itself, the critique process will follow the same rules of respect and constructive criticism as the other meetings. The only difference will be that everyone will talk in their own time: we will not go around the circle in the set fashion of the CM but will listen to critiques coming from whoever would like to speak. The author will be silent for the duration of the critique and then have the chance to ask the group any questions based on the comments they heard.

Page count per submission and per meeting will be the same as for the other critique groups:

7,500-word limit/submission

28,000-word limit/meeting
results.name: Blurring the Lines: New Multi-Format Critique Group

results.description:
3D Thursday 4/14: 3D Printing Open Workshop 

We'll be 3D printing on the Ultimaker 3D printers tonight. If you are new to 3D printing and want want to meet other 3D printing enthusiasts, tonight is the night join in on the fun. Beginners are welcome to learn about 3D printing and see it in action. Bring your ideas and designs!

---

3D Thursdays!

So... there has been a lot of fuss about this desktop 3D printing revolution thing for a while now. Still very exciting! 

We have a new-old idea that leaps beyond the news hype and celebrates the wonder of the activity itself. Let's get together every Thursday evening to explore this broad field, in all of its many facets and manifestations. And get to know each other better -- from bold pioneers, to new adopters, from teachers to students, manufacturing experts, to code and electronics hackers. This is your space to grow and share.

Topics we might explore on a typical Thursday evening include:

- 3D design software and techniques. From getting started, to pushing boundaries.

- Explore more of the 3D ecosystem, from making use of 3D printing service bureaus to starting and managing your 3D Hub.

- How to prototype and develop your own physical products, tools, and artwork.

- 3D printing materials: strategies for fabricating in more than just 1-2 plastics.

- Casting and mold-making: from precious metals to candy bars.

- Finishing techniques. Sanding, painting, sealing, melting, deforming, decorating, hydro-printing.... Why just make things that look like plastic?

Let's spend time together sorting out better ways to use these tools, and better ways to design.

results.name: 3D Thursdays!

results.description:
This month's meetup will be hosted by Audible in their Newark office. There will be two talks related to design on Android.

Talk 1:

Speaker: Liam Spradlin is a UIUX designer working primarily on Android. He’s the lead designer at touchlab, and a Google Expert in UIUX. At touchlab, Liam helps partners craft Android experiences with great design as a foundational principle, whether the product is Android-first or expanding from other platforms.

Title: Mutative design and what it's like to use a mutative interface

Description: Mutative design is a theoretical design methodology that would allow interfaces and experiences to be born, live, and evolve according to a user’s realities.

With mutative design, things like physical ability, lighting, and vision are accounted for automatically, allowing interfaces to be engaging and accessible to every user, without compromise.

In this session I’ll give a brief overview of the rationale and process behind mutative design and take a look at the first mutative sample app - Selene. We’ll walk through Selene’s first mutations and explore the design considerations mutation introduces.

Talk 2:

Speaker: Ernest Grzybowski

Title: Introduction to Material design

Description: Material design has come a long way since it was introduced at Google I/O in 2014. I'll do an overview of Material for those that are less familiar and teach you about the components and strategies you can take into your day to day development cycle. You'll leave this session with a strong sense of what Material design is, and how to integrate it into your Android application.

Audible Inc.

Pizza and beer will be provided!

1 Washington Place, Newark, NJ, 15th Floor (map)

How to get here:
1. Mass transit

Take Path trains or NJ Transit to Newark Penn Station > Take the Newark Light rail to Washington Park or look for the Audible shuttle outside the main entrance (every 10-20 minutes)

or

Take NJ Transit to Newark Broad Street > walk to 1 Washington Park.

2. Drive

There are two lots to choose from, each has a ~5 dollar parking rate for the duration of the event.

Green Lot (Corner of Orange Street and Essex Street)
84 Orange Street
Newark NJ, 07102

Orange Lot (Corner of Orange Street and University)

results.description:
A Macro View of Macros

Abstract

Lisp is a beautiful language. It's flexibility, expressiveness, and pragmatism inspires creativity, productivity, and cleanliness. Yet when trying to explain what makes lisp beautiful, it's easy to fall into the feature trap. Lisp is homoiconic. Lisp has hygenic macros (sometimes). The REPL will change your life. Some new lisp has awesome features that will blow your socks off (perhaps immutability, isomorphism, etc). 

Yet talking about features often misses the reasons that these features are important to the process of software development, and on a higher level, to personal and professional development. This talk attempts to reframe the discussion of the beauty and benefits of Lisp from a focus on features to a focus on process oriented values, in both the individual and organizational context. 


Bio

Dylan Butman is Co-founder and CTO of populace.io, an sms-based personal assistant designed for hourly workers. His work centers around creating technology that serves to mediate and facilitate increased conversation and personal interaction within commercial contexts. In the past he has worked in business intelligence and data visualization, as well as a variety of installation based creative work. When not M-x'ing, you can find him playing at acroyoga, riding bikes, listening to vinyl, and doing other things he swears he just likes doing but aren't really hipster.
results.name: Dylan Butman on A Macro View of Macros

results.description:
The world is full of expressions of God's message to us. In the Bible we see a holy, jealous and vengeful God with a soft spot for His chosen. In the New Testament we see a God that is committed to forgiving and loving His creation and are introduced to a very gracious God ready to accept the humble yet tired of "showy religion" and hypocrisy. Join Grace in this exciting yet intimate study of God's character through the study of Scripture.

Week 1: Why did God make us? For what purpose?

Week 2: God had a Chosen Nation, Israel. How do we know this? How did he introduce Himself to them? How did He develop the relationship? What happened during the good times? What happened during the bad times? (Old Testament)

Week 3: What was God's intention for sending Jesus? What does it mean to be a child of God?

If you've ever simply thought of some of these questions or have questions of your own about Life and the Big Picture, join us to explore these questions and thoughts. All people of all faiths, beliefs and backgrounds are welcome ready for respectful dialogue and sharing.

The group will be held in the first floor cafe seating area. If you are coming please have a Bible or Bible app on your phone. Text[masked] if you don't see us.

HopeHill.com
#HopeHillNYC
results.name: Connect Group: God's Character

results.description:
Sunday here at Sean Silverman School of Poker we had our first meeting of  Individuals Committed to the Eradication of Poker Ignorance. Four hearty individuals from diverse backgrounds braved the elements and journeyed an hour of more to Bushwick to be schooled in the fundamentals of poker.

For the first portion of the class, we dealt out a series of poker hands, as though we were having a game of 1 - 2 No Limit Hold - em (NLHE). As instructor, I went through the decision-process for each two-card hand in turn: Fold, limp, or raise?

I attempted to emphasize two principles to the assembled students: 1) Poker is a sacred pastime, and a dedicated student may master the game, quit work, and sleep until noon.

Also, 2) To win at poker, you must fold pre-flop, over and over and over.

*****

The power of the Continuation Bet was emphasized and illustrated by a series of actual examples.

A break for drinks (GT's) and snacks, another half hour of demonstration hands, then the day's highlight: A real - money sit-and-go tournament for a $10 first prize (donated by Sean a Silverman School of Poker).

The first half-hour saw no casualties, but as the blinds escalated the attrition began. Helen and Nydia went out first, and within minutes of that Steve felted the instructor (yours truly) to take down first-prize.

We will do the class again at 7:15pm, Thursday April 14th (by popular demand).
results.name: Poker Training

Real Self Defense is Offensive in nature. 

KravMaguy offers a true, authentic Israeli Defense Forces (IDF) training experience emphasizing hand-to-hand combat, tactical and warrior training for both men and women. The Head instructor was featured in the History Channel – The Human Weapon- a documentary about Krav Maga in Israel. His last assignment was as Tactical Security Team Leader working off the coast of East Africa. 

In this basics class you will learn to defend yourself and survive knife wielding assassins, sexual assaults or any would be attacker looking to take your life using the basic principles of kravmaguy level one system. In the end only your are responsible for your own protection. You cannot rely on others when split seconds count.

Topics covered in Level One 8 week course:
Jab cross 
Fighting Stance
Weak body spots
Hook uppercut
Basic footwork
Punching jab cross
Elbows regular
Knees
Groin strikes- knees, shin to groin, groin jab (lead leg)
Knife hands
Escape- RNC
Escape guillotine
Escape schoolyard headlock (requires matted area)
Physical requirements to pass level one:
20 pushups
35 sit ups
30 squats
Level 2 training prep


check out this youtube video to see kravmaguy knife defense in action, these techniques are used by murderers and terrorists to kill countless innocents and knowing these basic defenses can save your life and the ones you love

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BbzLjAUlyzU

the eye rake to elbow to the spine: a kravmaguy classic:

results.description:
Hey, culture fans! 

In the first half of this unusual event, pianist Per Tengstrand will discuss the significance of Beethoven’s Symphony No. 3 in E Flat Major, Op. 55 (the “Eroica”), a major milestone in music history. After intermission, we will be treated to piano pieces by other great composers, including Mozart's Sonata in C Major, K.330 and Schumann's Kinderszenen, Op. 15.

This performance is part of the "Music on Park Avenue" series.

Our group has been offered $25 seats for $16!


IMPORTANT: Due to excessive no-shows at previous Scandinavia House events, the discount price is only available on advance purchases, NOT at the door.


HOW TO GET THE DISCOUNT (OFFER EXPIRES APRIL 14 AT 1 PM):  

1) RSVP on this page before the deadline.

2) You will automatically be transferred to Paypal to pay for your ticket(s). Sorry, in this instance funds cannot be accepted by any other method (cash, check, etc.). Please do not request this.

3) When prompted, enter your FULL NAME (first and last). This is required for the list that gets sent to the box office. If you are not on the list, you will either be charged full price or not admitted to the hall. Please note that the box office does not care about Paypal receipts or Meetup confirmations. YOU MUST BE ON THE LIST.

4) At the box office desk, identify yourself as a member of the Culture and Film Club (on Meetup) and give your Meetup ID (the name you use on the site) and full name. 

6) No refunds or exchanges unless the performance is cancelled or rescheduled. However, if you are unable to attend, you can send someone in your place. At the box office, simply have him or her give the same Meetup ID and name you would have.


We may or may not be seated together at this event. 


POST-CONCERT MEETING 

Join us for a reception after the performance where we will have a chance to socialize and talk to Mr. Tengstrand. Afterward, we may go for dinner or drinks nearby if there is interest.


See you there! 

Milton
results.how_to_find_us: Venue is located between 37th and 38th Street.
results.name: Talk/Recital: "Heaven & Earth Will Tremble - Beethoven's Eroica" ($25 tix @ $16)

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $12 dollars per player per game; pay through Paypal.

One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates at the goal for 6 minutes, timed with an electronic scoreboard. NO breaks. Regulation size goals with nets. professional  futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes, games are competitive, but friendly. Sorry, no beginners. 

Zero tolerance to fouls . “Futsal is a technical game, not physical”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. 

Refunds: only for 24 hour cancelation. must send a meetup message with the paypal Transaction ID: 17 numbers. 

The Name of the school Beacon HS 

For questions: Use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
Hosted in the tranquil environment of the Energea Pentloft in the heart of Astoria, we gather 30 minutes before meditation commences providing enough time to get comfortable and acquainted. Each meditation session begins with a gentle introduction to the 7 chakra centers and their individual attributes and importance to our overall health and well being. The meditation is guided by the soothing tones of the Pyradym, one of only 27 in the world this sound healing instrument when heard through a 16 speaker Meyer sound system is an impressive experience to say the least. During the meditation we are lead through each Chakra point as the Pyradym's unique frequencies remove energetic blockages from its path and align each Chakra point accordingly. Once the pathway is cleared the Kundalini energy residing in us all, is now free to rise with a much greater ease. Entering the meditation with a strong and clear intention is of key importance in order to obtain the most benefit from this particular form of sound meditation. Come raise your vibration with us...

Please bring a Yoga Mat and a water to stay hydrated. The duration of each session is 60 minutes. $20 donation Recommend Registration & More Info:
www.EnergeaNYC.com/SoundHealing
results.name: Harmonic Alignment: Sound Healing w/ the Pyradym

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun Intimacy and communcation games and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC?

We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 7:40p. COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For questions contact [masked] |[masked]


Can't make this one? Visit us at www.turnonny.us

A group of professional designers, programmers and bloggers meets in Fair Lawn monthly. Come to a meeting and help shape the discussion. There's room for all interests and levels of web, design or technology involvement. Discussions take on shape according to who shows up any particular month. We meet at Panera Bread to take advantage of the free Wifi and the great onion soup! Bring your iphone or laptop and feel free to bring a friend!

Looking forward to seeing you at a meeting soon!

Kimi Wei thewei.com
Contact me via Meetup organizer link.

Meeting Attendance Fees No fee for web and technology professionals. Individuals NOT web or technology professionals pay an attendance fee of $10. FAQ about this policy. Employment agents and direct employers:
Company agents looking to hire and headhunters may attend a meeting for up to 30 minutes without paying a fee. This should give you time to assess member's interest in networking with you and to hand out cards. If you would like to make a presentation or sponsor the group for a meeting or series of meetings please contact me. New or existing company looking for freelancers or wanting site critiques
For a $50 fee you may attend a meeting and interact casually with group members for about an hour, but you may not solicit targeted advice about your project or website at that meeting. If you want the group to provide a site critique, or you need help with solutions for your site/project please contact me to set up a brainstorming session. Cost will be discussed at that time.

Fun Play

kick-ins.. no throw ins.

To promote generosity, honor and respect, PS2G plays clean soccer!! This means No Cursing, Insulting, Complaining, Arguing or Fighting! We welcome you if this is your usual style and you want to change your attitude to fit our culture
All proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

Bring indoor shoes or sneakers, Dark,colors and white shirt

results.description:
This group meets weekly to learn and practice meditation tools that stimulate clairvoyance. Emphasis is on exploring, practicing and enjoying clairvoyant psychic ability safely, with practical benefit, in a supportive environment. 

There is a loose curriculum built around the imparting of techniques and validation of subjective experience. A typical session may include  guided meditation and some clairvoyant readings and/or aura healings. 

Class technically begins at 8:00 pm, though people can arrive from 7:30 onward. 

There is a $10 suggested donation that is very flexible. It is intended that each person find their own valuation of BCL. Some people have taken multiple classes for free, some give $10. Some give $20 or more. Paypal is available as an option if cash is not convenient.
results.name: Brooklyn Clairvoyance Lab

results.description:
Speak and Lead is one of three Toastmasters clubs in the Rutherford area. We cater to the after-work and evening crowd. Our goal is to help You obtain success! People join Toastmasters for an array of reasons, and therefore have different goals - but the common goal is self-improvement.

Whether you're joining so as to improve your communication/ presentation skills; or to become a better leader, Speak and Lead Toastmasters is here to help! Even if you simply are looking for an activity to engage in and just want to network, you can't go wrong here.

We're a friendly, supportive group that enjoys laughing and having a good time. We do things by the book and encourage all of our members to do their best. No matter what happens, we don't give up.

Won't you join us on your journey to success? The door is open - and we'll be talking.

results.description:
To set everyone up for the Foreclosure Real Estate Summit on April 30th I have decided to do a webinar focused on the basics of foreclosure investing. 

For those who do not know, Foreclosures is one of the most popular type of real estate opportunities to buy.  Why?  Its because when people are behind on their mortgage payments they become what is called a motivated seller.  When people are motivated to sell, houses go for dirt cheap.  Typically 50 to 60 cents to the dollar.  :)  Want to learn more? 

Join us for the webinar and learn: 
1. What is a Motivated Seller? 
2. The foreclosure timeline & when on the timeline is best to go after deals? 
3. Equity Deals, Short Sales 
4. Sheriff Sales & REOS 

To your continue success, 

Nick Tang 
P.S. We may only be able to cover 3 of the above topics. So please let me know which of the 3 you want to hear about in the comment section of the site.  The one with the most votes will be discussed.  Thank you 

Log-in Details:  
Webinar log-in details well be emailed to you before 5pm on the day of the event. The webinar will start at 8:00pm.  Please Log-in early. 

Recording:  
This webinar will be recorded.  It will be made available for a month to everyone that has already bought tickets for the Foreclosure Summit coming up on April 30th.
results.name: Webinar: Foreclosure Real Estate Investing Basics

group.name: New Jersey Wholesale & Rehab Houses Meetup

Please read carefully: This event is being hosted by Dave Cervini's  newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people you see registered on your Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending from all groups please contact the event host at [masked]

THIS EVENT IS NOT EXCLUSIVELY FOR MEMBERS OF ANY PARTICULAR PARTY, IT IS OPEN FOR ALL TO ENJOY. This is going to be an interesting evening!  Join us as we get to watch the  the presidential candidates face off in the Democratic Candidate debates.  Arrive at 7pm for socializing and cocktails, grab a bite to eat then sit back and catch all the action on dozens of large monitors.

This event is meant to be a fun and interesting way to see the candidates. If you attend all we ask is that if you feel strongly about any candidate you keep your comments educated and dignified.  If you feel like you may get too passionate and cause arguing we would appreciate if you watched at home!

Do I have to be a Democrat to attend? NO. NO. NO! This event is open to all to get an idea of what the candidates are all about.  We will have parties for the republican Debates as well

Can I come alone? Yes, 98% of those attending will be coming on their own.

What should I wear? Most people are coming from work so they will have on their work clothes, business casual

Is there food available? Yes they have an awesome menu, separate checks no problem.
results.name: Presidential Debates Viewing Party

Do I have to be a Democrat to attend? NO. NO. NO! This event is open to all to get an idea of what the candidates are all about.  We will have parties for the republican Debates as well

Can I come alone? Yes, 98% of those attending will be coming on their own.

What should I wear?  Most people are coming from work so they will have on their work clothes, business casual

Is there food available?  Yes they have an awesome menu, separate checks no problem.
