results.description:
Like our Facebook Page!:

   facebook.com/ManhattanInternationalCoedSoccer

Game description: 

Teams are 4 V 4, no goalies, no gender requirements (but we'd like at least 1 female player per team). Games will be played on a 1st goal rotation basis or 15 minutes time limit. The team that scores first stays on  the field. But if your team remains on the field after scoring 3 goals, we'll split the team up so that everyone has a fair chance to have a great game.

RULES OF THE GAME:

First and most important rule of the game is to have fun and enjoy the time on the field! 

VERY IMPORTANT: 

- NO FOULS

- NO SIDE TACKLING

- NO PUSHING

- NO TELLING OFF

* ZERO TOLERANCE*


By minimizing physical contact, we minimize injuries and violence.


         “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”

If you don't sign up for the game, do not show up.

Rough play and offensive language will absolutely not be tolerated!!

We encourage competitive, but safe play. 

We reserve the right to ask anyone to leave who has exhibited any behavior that could be construed as violent, offensive, or dangerous. 

Those that don't comply with these rules, will kindly be asked to leave the field so others can enjoy the game. 


Any other questions regarding the rules of the game or anything else, should be directed to the organizer directly or to the assistant organizer/s!!!

Please check our meetup message board, 10 PM the night before to see what team you are on. This will save us a lot of time on the field.

Location and Directions:

West End Presbyterian Church

165 West 105th Street, New York, NY

Near the lines: 1, 2, 3, B, and C trains.

AS YOU COME IN, TAKE THE STAIRS ON YOUR LEFT AND WALK TO THE 4TH FLOOR.

Call me if you can’t find us - (917)[masked] Manny S.


What to bring with you: 
A positive attitude, pair of sneakers or INDOOR shoes (ONLY), shin guards (recommended) and lots of water.

Fee: 
You will be asked to pay $9.50 dollars when you RSVP. This $9.50 dollars is used to pay for: permits, meetup fees, Amazon fees, Goals, soccer balls etc.

Refund Policy: 


* The Meetup is cancelled

* You can cancel at least 2 day(s) before the Meetup


Very IMPORTANT Due to the location where we will be playing:

We expect everyone to respect the facilities and act accordingly.

Anyone who is asked to leave will not be refunded and WILL be permanently banned from the group

After the game we can go for a quick drink at:

                                            TAP a KEG

                                         2731 Broadway

                                     New York, NY 10025

                            Betwee[masked]th and Broadway  

By RSVP'ing you agree to our Liability waiver:

PARTICIPATING IN MANHATTAN-INTERNATIONAL-COED-SOCCER ACTIVITIES AGREEMENT: 


I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore, I, individually, hereby release and discharge, Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and Assistant Organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer programs or activities. Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and its Assistant Organizers reserve the right to take and utilize photographs, video, or any type of recording of participating person while engaged in our or associated activities. I consent to Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer use the photograph, video, or recording of me, for advertising, promotional, or related purposes, and waive all rights to compensation and other rights which may arise as a result.

results.description:
To set everyone up for the Foreclosure Real Estate Summit on April 30th I have decided to do a webinar focused on the basics of foreclosure investing.  

For those who do not know, Foreclosures is one of the most popular type of real estate opportunities to buy.  Why?  Its because when people are behind on their mortgage payments they become what is called a motivated seller.  When people are motivated to sell, houses go for dirt cheap.  Typically 50 to 60 cents to the dollar.  :)  Want to learn more? 

Join us for the webinar and learn:  
1. What is a Motivated Seller? 
2. The foreclosure timeline & when on the timeline is best to go after deals? 
3. Equity Deals, Short Sales 
4. Sheriff Sales & REOS 

To your continue success, 

Nick Tang P.S. We may only be able to cover 3 of the above topics. So please let me know which of the 3 you want to hear about in the comment section of the site.  The one with the most votes will be discussed.  Thank you  

Log-in Details:  
Webinar log-in details well be emailed to you before 5pm on the day of the event. The webinar will start at 8:00pm.  Please Log-in early.  

Recording:  
This webinar will be recorded.  It will be made available for a month to everyone that has already bought tickets for the Foreclosure Summit coming up on April 30th.
results.name: Webinar: Foreclosure Real Estate Investing Basics

results.description:
https://weheartnycwritersopenmic.eventbrite.com

EVERY 2nd Thursday of the month!

InspiredWordNYC (creator/producer of the Queens Lit Fest) Presents We Heart NYC Writers Night + Open Mic at The Parkside Lounge, one of the coolest performance spots in Manhattan's East Village.

This is a celebration of emerging and established New York City writers of all types - poets, novelists, journalists, short story writers. Shows feature carefully selected writers of note, especially those who have recently released books as well as a 12-slot open mic (6-minute time limit, for writers of all types and spoken word poets).

Signed books will be available for purchase - a great chance to show local literary love.

Please share this event on social networks with the hashtags #SupportLocalWritersNYC #BuyBooksNYC #BuyLiteraryPubsNYC #SupportEmergingWritersNYC. It's good karma.

A percentage of the proceeds - and 100% of the #SupportLocalWritersNYC DONATIONS - go to the featured writers.

***21+ age limit (please make sure to bring valid ID)***

*****


When: EVERY 2nd Thursday of the month

Where: The Parkside Lounge
317 East Houston Street (between Stanton and Clinton Streets)
Manhattan, NY 10002

By subway, take the F to 2nd Avenue, walk up the 1st Avenue stairway, then walk east.

Doors open @ 7:45pm. Buy a guaranteed open mic slot via this page. 

*****

Cover Charge: $6 online for non-open mic'ers @  https://weheartnycwritersopenmic.eventbrite.com, $8 online to guarantee an open mic slot, $7 at the door.

***2 Drink Minimum (but drinks are super cheap and $2 non-alcoholic options are available)***

EARLY BIRD SPECIAL - Buy your ticket at least a week in advance and get in for only $5 and bring one audience friend for FREE. LIMITED QUANTITY AVAILABLE.

*****

Make sure to bring a printed out version of your ticket/tickets or be prepared to show your ticket/tickets (with confirmation number) on your phone. Also, bring a valid ID, as this is a strict 21+ venue.

Please Note: No TRANSFERS or REFUNDS will be granted, though you are welcome to find REPLACEMENTS for your tickets.

<a href="http://inspiredwordnyc.com/"></a>
results.how_to_find_us: Purchase advance tickets @ https://weheartnycwritersopenmic.eventbrite.com.

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs (the roster shows 11 spots only because it includes the organizer who will play if needed). One game is 55-60 minutes. Please come a little early so that we all can start on time and play 1 solid hour. Goal keeper rotation every 5-6 minutes. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt (if you don't have red, a solid dark will do), indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence.

more info at [masked]

Thank you,

Jaime Arias

[masked]
results.name: Futsal on Thursdays Midtown/8:15pm

results.description:
• ABSOLUTELY NO CLEATS ALLOWED! NO EXCEPTIONS!!

• Permit Disclosure: No permit but field is usually unoccupied at this time.

• BRING AN ALL WHITE SHIRT (Your teammates can see you better when you wear white under the fluorescent vests.)

• We play rain or shine!

(Leader- Chris W.)

(Co-leader- Art K.)

(We are looking for new Co-Leaders, are you interested? Talk to Chris W)

• PLEASE ARRIVE ON TIME - 8:00PM!! Game starts at 8:15pm sharp .

• NO BALL SMASHING! THIS IS A SPECIAL NIGHT BALL!

• Full rules explained at the game.

Code of Conduct:

Positivity - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than yelling and complaining during the game.

Safety - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

2 = Teamwork. It takes 2 to complete every pass.

Generosity!!!! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

If the game is cancelled, request a refund by filling out this form.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change. 

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

(Leader- Chris W.)

(Co-leader- Art K.)

(We are looking for new Co-Leaders, are you interested? Talk to Chris W)

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $12 dollars per player per game; pay through Paypal.

One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates at the goal for 6 minutes, timed with an electronic scoreboard. NO breaks. Regulation size goals with nets. professional  futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes, games are competitive, but friendly. Sorry, no beginners. 

Zero tolerance to fouls . “Futsal is a technical game, not physical”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. 

Refunds: only for 24 hour cancelation. must send a meetup message with the paypal Transaction ID: 17 numbers. 

The Name of the school Beacon HS 

For questions: Use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

Join fellow concerned citizens to watch the #NYPrimary debate on big screens with sound. 

Organized by Jeff Kurzon, a Sanders Democrat running for House of Representatives (New York's 7th Congressional District). Like Senator Sanders, Jeff is trying to get big money out of Congress. Learn more at <a>www.JeffKurzon.com</a>

Hillary supporters, Republicans and non-voters welcome too. The more debate, the better for democracy.


The event will be a good chance to meet fellow concerned citizens and get involved for the April 19 primary.

The event is free, but please support the venue by buying a drink or some food. Paulaner has great beer and food. The debate starts at 9. Get there early to find your spot!

results.description: We have been watching many debates in Brooklyn. Now, we will be watching a debate IN Brooklyn. Theater in Asylum, with the NYC chapter of the Democratic Socialists of America, is creating theatrical adaptations of the Democratic Primary Debates. With a small army of actors, designers, dramaturgs, and support staff, we will watch and analyze the debates, devise a piece, and present it live in NYC. Join us for the first step: watching the debate live on TV.

This is the FINAL debate before New Yorkers vote on April 19. Don't miss this exciting night!

Debate airs at 9pm but get there early to get a good spot! Airing on CNN.

results.description:
The presentation covers Silver Spring Network's Big Data Platform, and its use of Apache Apex, a next generation native Hadoop big data platform for stream as well as batch processing

Topics include 

- SilverLink Data Platform Overview 

- Ingesting real time data streams from connected sensors into Hadoop 

- Throughput management in Apache Apex applications 

- Processing batch data 

- Hackathon 

Presenter 1: Raja Ali - A Silicon Valley veteran who has spent his career in building, operating and tuning data-centric applications. At Silver Spring Networks, he is the multi-talented architect, evangelist and hands-on developer of the Silverlink Data Platform. Raja is an Apache Apex committer Raja is an avid runner and has run many ultra-marathons. 

Presenter 2: Greg Brosman - Is the Product Manager for the SilverLink Data Platform, where he drives its adoption across Silver Spring’s utility and software partners. Previously he worked on rolling out Silver Spring’s first Network-as-a-Service solution in Copenhagen and a variety of Smart City projects. Greg is a passionate board game player. 

Presenter 3: Darin Nee - Apache Apex committer. A big data software engineer with Silver Spring Network, working on SilverLink Data Platform. 

-------------------------------------------------------------- 

Silver Spring Networks is the world’s largest IOT company with more than 23 million endpoints deployed. We help global utilities and cities connect, optimize, and manage smart energy and smart city infrastructure. 

Our big data platform utilizes technology from the Apache Hadoop ecosystem to collect, process and analyze large volumes of streaming data. Apache Apex is a central part of our technology stack. We rely on it to scale our processing pipelines to manage billions of data points every day in a scalable, reliable manner. 

-------------------------------------------------------------

Please register for IOT Big Data Ingestion and Processing in Hadoop/Apex by Silver Springs Network: 

https://attendee.gotowebinar.com/register/8053824090531525379

After registering, you will receive a confirmation email containing information about joining the webinar.

</a>

https://www.innerengineering.com/online/webinars?signinsrc=Meetup-NewYork

</a>

<a href="https://www.innerengineering.com/">Inner Engineering is a resource that can help with your self-help and self-improvement journey whether you are a veteran or a beginner. Sadhguru, a yogi and mystic, and one of the foremost authorities on yoga, offers his characteristically pragmatic wisdom for a life of joy and fulfillment. Starting with four basic dimensions of the self –Body, Mind, Emotions, and Energy – Sadhguru introduces us to simple techniques to realign and transform them into a life of sparkling aliveness.

Inner Engineering is a method of enhancing yourself and emerging into the ideal way you want to be. It is a 7-session online course that provides tools and solutions to empower yourself to create your life the way you want it. It gives you the opportunity to intellectually explore the ABC’s of life using methods from the distilled essence of yogic sciences. The course provides a simple, easy to use, proven methods to empower yourself for self-empowerment.

This 1 hour introduction to Inner Engineering explains the fundamental approach of the program in a live setting that offers you the opportunity to ask a trained Isha teacher questions about the program and practices available.

“Inner Engineering is neither a religion, nor a philosophy or dogma; It is a technology for wellbeing. One does not have to believe or disbelieve, you just have to learn to use it. Technology will produce results irrespective of who you are.” – Sadhguru

THE PITCH is NYC’s only soccer-specific indoor facility, located in the heart of Brooklyn’s Williamsburg neighborhood at North 14th and Berry St.

Unlike most of these courts/gyms, our field has a walled (padded) perimeter, so the ball never goes out. Also, our flooring is a real field: the best professional-grade turf product on the market -- the same turf used by many professional teams in the Netherlands and recently by some MLS teams like Sporting Kansas.

results.description:
Running is a good workout. Running up a hill is an awesome workout. Be awesome!


Every week is an adventure in hill work. Every week is different. Some workouts include... 

30 minute continuous run. Sprint up the 0.4 mile incline, touch the graffiti wall at the top, turn around and jog back to the bottom and then repeat.

http://vimeo.com/81450322

Timed interval sprints. 45 seconds as hard as you can up. 1 minute and 45 seconds recovery jog back to the start. You will be winded!

http://vimeo.com/81966561

Obstacle course training. Workout stations with short sprints between them. Sprint to the first, do a bunch of situps. Sprint to the next, do some lunges. Sprint a bit further and do some squats. Sprint to the top and do some pushups. Jog back to the start and repeat.

NOTE: there is NO secure place to store bags, valuables, etc. Please use caution and do not bring anything you cannot afford to lose. If you do leave your belongings at the bottom of the bridge (where we start running) be aware that there is a lot of foot traffic and it would not be surprising if something "walked away."
results.how_to_find_us: Meet at the bottom of the Manhattan side of the Williamsburg Bridge.
results.name: Hill Running Workout

results.description:
St. Paul's German Church & CityKinder are offering a Mommy & Me Group for parents with Babys and Toddler from 6 months to 3 years at the community room at the "Pfarrhaus" in White Plains.

Meet other German speaking parents and their kids for songs, crafts, tumbling and games. The groups are led by Dorothea Liedl, a mom of 3 who has been leading "Eltern-Kind-Gruppen" for several years in Munich and in New York.

Tuition:
$150 for 10 sessions
$20 Walk-In

Register here

Sessions: 15.04 /22.04 /29.04 / 06.05 / 13.05 / 20.05 / 27.05 / 03.06 / 10.06/ 17.06

Bio: Dorothea Lied is originally from Munich and move to Hartsdale two years ago with her husband and the younger two of her three sons (20, 16, and 13) who attend the German International School in White Plains.

In her career as a pediatric nurse she has worked mainly with premature and newborn babies for over 30 years. She enjoyed taking care of them in the hospital but found her true calling when she started to offer home visits guiding new parents through the first weeks.

Dorothea has been running playgroups for kids between 6 months and 3 years and their parents and grandparents for several years now and incorporates lots of traditional and new German songs and games in her programs.
results.name: Paulchenbande - White Plains

results.description:
Hello Fam!

This week we have the pleasure of having Yuni Sameshima of Chicory come and share his journey.

Yuni is co-founder and CEO of Chicory, a shoppable recipe platform by placing a "get ingredients" button on existing recipe sites allowing readers to get all of the ingredients they need delivered from an online grocer. It allows brands to reach consumers through contextual, native products. Today, their clients and partners include Time Inc, Peapod, Chobani, Ritz and many more. In 2015 they saw growth from 10K monthly visitors to over 14M. He has a BA in Molecular Biology and Economics from Colgate University.

We'll get a chance to hear about his journey, with Q&A and community shout outs afterwards! Also join us for good coffee, good bagels, and excellent conversation.

Until then, stay cool and classy... See you then!

results.description:
On Wednesday May 4th the Africa Open Data Community(AODC) will host a one-day event in Cape Town, South Africa, at the edge of the regional Open Government Partnership Summit hosted by the Government of South Africa. As committed community members and experts in this field we hope you will join us in helping develop and shape this one-day event as a continued effort from AODC to expand awareness of the benefits of open data for Africa and increase participation and new partnerships across multiple sectors and disciplines. Please see the current working draft of the agenda here: http://bit.ly/SA_AODC_1Pager The target themes for this event are how open data can help achieve the SDGs and ensuring the private sector knows the value and leadership potential in open data for Africa. As ever we welcome any comments, criticisms, or concerns and look forward to adding new names and faces to the community as presenters and participants.

As discussed at the last monthly call this advisory call will occur each Friday 3:30pm SAST until the conference. These are open calls, feel free to invite others to participate. Notes will be taken and shared at http://bit.ly/AODC_CapeTownMay4_Feedback
results.name: Planning Open Data for Sustainable Development in Cape Town: May 4

results.description:
Angela has an MA in Education from Hunter College in New York and is passionate about helping young people and their parents navigate through the teenage years. Currently, she is interested in Technology and Social Media’s effect on our relationships, especially how it impacts Friendship and Family Life.

Before the dawn of Social Media, she started A VOICE IN THE CROWD, a radio show for teenagers in addition to various Leadership programs for Young Women. After participating in the PARENT LEADERSHIP INITIATIVE, which focuses on fostering the role of the parents’ as the primary influence on their children, she founded BE A GREAT MOM a program that conducted Workshops in the New York area specifically for younger mothers on educating children and home management. As a couple, she and her husband participated in the FAMILY ENRICHMENT PROGRAM recently on Long Island, a chapter of IFFD (International Federation for Family Development).

Angela and her husband David, who is working in the Media Industry, have 6 children and live in Huntington, Long Island.

results.description:
For almost 20 years, Mana has been serving generous portions of food and friendship. All of their drinking water and organic foods are prepared with filtered water. Miso soup is always on the menu, as well as at least one soup of the day such as lentil or split pea. The fish of the day is prepared in various mouthwatering styles along with generous portions of brown rice, seaweed, root and green vegetables. Varieties include miso stew, teriyaki, sweet and sour, and broiled, each with its own sauce. For the purist, steamed fish with a touch of ginger, greens and rice.


Some menu items are macrobiotic inspired—like the Simple Palate, a plate of seasonal greens, beans, rice and tofu—while others are hearty, like the Vegetable Gomai, a creamy miso stew of chunky root vegetables, seitan and tofu.


They offer fish of the day and salmon.  There are a couple of shrimp dishes as well.  These include, Fish Taco Roasted, Salmon Burger, Teryaki sweet and savory glazed fish, Bulgogi Broiled, Korean style BBQ Salmon.  


Tempeh Sensation


Salmon Teryaki


See the menu at


http://manarestaurantnyc.com/menus.html

A $2.00 fee is requested to help defray the organizer dues payments, which have recently gone up again - cash before the event will be appreciated.  Thank you.

results.description:
REGISTER HERE


A free three-day intensive for photographers who find their flow pounding the pavement, camera in hand, eyes wide and searching for light. Photographers of all skill level and style welcome, street photography is not only a fantastic art form on its own, but a great way as a photographer creating within any genre to keep yourself fresh, stretching your creative muscles, practicing and getting to know your equipment so well you’re able to make work unobstructed. Participants are encouraged to join us for the full weekend, but more than welcome to come and go, joining any session they find interesting. 

Friday, April 15th

2:00 - 3:45 Lecture & Discussion at Adorama
We begin the weekend by discussing legendary photographers working in the field, and the elements that set great images apart. As a group, we will discuss how best to incorporate them into to your own work in both theory and practice. 

4:00 - 9:00 Low Light Shooting Walk.
For photographers interested in creating work after hours, learning how best to create images in challenging light. We will wander as a group into the west village, taking advantage of the neighborhoods dense neon to make images after dark.

*No matter what the weather is, Daniel Schaefer will still be hosting the walks - rain, shine, snow or sleet! Bad weather makes for great photos.


Daniel Schaefer is a photographer and writer based wherever his lens and pen are most useful. Currently making work in NYC he is known for his cinematically charged images ranging from delicately lit portraiture, to visceral shots of the lively NYC streets. His writings on photo theory have been met by much community acclaim, with industry standard sites like Petapixel, the Phoblographer, Japan Camera Hunter and Fstoppers publishing his articles. His work can be found at OutlierImagery.com or
results.name: Free 3-Day Intensive for Photographers - Workshop & Photo Walk - Part I

Meet on field 8!!!

The game is scheduled to start at 3:00. Your RSVP is good if you come on time. If you come after teams are divided then you run the risk of not playing. Those who have RSVP’ed get first preference to play (This does not apply to anyone on the waiting list). Also, please  Un-RSVP if you will not be attending. That gives other people a chance to play.

Rules and guidelines:

These games are geared towards advanced to intermediate players.

Teams are divided by two team captains (captains pick players in turns in an attempt to keep teams balanced and competitive)

Physical play is allowed as long as it isn't overly aggressive or dirty.

Slide tackles are allowed only to block a shot on goal or to intercept a pass  NO slide tackling on a player with the ball.

Ball hogging is absolutely not tolerated 

Keep in mind as we don't have permit, we need to be flexible.

results.description:
Lets’ end the week and enjoy the changing of the seasons with a peaceful walk at one of Bergen Countys' best parks for walks and biking. Spring is in the air with a forecast for the 60s so lets' see what signs of spring we can discover!

This will be about a 2 hour walk covering about 5-6 miles at a steady moderate pace on a paved level path that follows along the Saddle River where we were once lucky enough, to spot a red fox!  There is plenty of wildlife  around if you take the time to look and listen.

We will first pass by the dog runs to enjoy our furry 4 legged friends  and then pick up the trail nearer the exit to the park cross over a  bridge and  turn left at the "T"  to see the waterfall in the bend, stop at next bridge for photo opt,  then turn back and  head to the pond at the Glenrock section of the park and then retrace our steps back to the parking lot. Though it is a dog friendly park, DOGS ARE NOT allowed on our walks unless designated in the event details. 

MEET AT THE BENCH BY THE FLAG POLE IN FRONT OF THE CAMP SUNSHINE SNOWFLAKE BLDG. by the pond when you first pull in. Restrooms are available.

All you need are supportive sneakers, walking/hiking shoes or boots, sun protection and don't forget your water, binoculars for birding and cameras of course for you shutterbugs!  Its' always good to dress in layers for the changing weather. 

These paths are shared with cyclists, dog walkers, etc. so remember to always stay to the right of the path to allow everyone to pass safely.

DIRECTIONS: FROM ROCKLAND TAKE 17 SOUTH AND  TAKE THE PARAMUS RD EXIT AND HEAD TOWARD RIDGEWOOD.  TURN RT ON E. RIDGEWOOD AVE AND THE PARK ENTRANCE WILL BE ON YOUR RIGHT IN A SHORT DISTANCE.

  Optional dinner and refreshments at Charlie Browns located at 95 Linwood Ave., Township of Washington, NJ  just a short drive from the park. (left out of park onto Ridgewood Ave., left on Paramus rd., right onto Linwood ave. (stay left at fork) to stay on Linwood ave.  Charlie Browns will be on you left. (or other nearby venue)

Inclement weather cancels, always check the day of an event for possible changes.

results.description:
Please refrain from bringing large bags, as all items larger than 11-inches by 15-inches by 5-inches must be checked.   

Once inside, feel free to go through the exhibitions at your own pace, either on your own or with your fellow MEETUP members. 


We'll be seeing 2 exhibitions - - - 

   Edgar Degas: A Strange New Beauty

  Above: Edgar Degas, Heads of a Man and a Woman (Homme     et femme, en buste). c. 1877-80. Monotype on paper, plate:         2-&-13/16 inches ​by 3-&-3/16 inches (7.2 cm. by 8.1 cm.).             British Museum, London.

Edgar Degas is best known as a painter and chronicler of the ballet, yet his work as a printmaker reveals the true extent of his restless experimentation. In the mid-1870s, Degas was introduced to the monotype process—drawing in ink on a metal plate that was then run through a press, typically resulting in a single print. Captivated by the monotype’s potential, he immersed in the technique with enormous enthusiasm, taking the medium to radical ends. He expanded the possibilities of drawing, created surfaces with a heightened sense of tactility, and invented new means for new subjects, from dancers in motion to the radiance of electric light, from women in intimate settings to meteorological effects in nature. The monotype also sparked a host of experiments for Degas, who often used the medium as a starting point from which an image could be reworked and revised. This process of repetition and transformation, mirroring and reversal, allowed Degas to extend his approach to the study of form. The profound impact of his work with monotype can be seen in his variations in different mediums of key motifs, revealing a new kind of artwork that was less about progress or completion than endless innovation.


The exhibition includes approximately 120 rarely-seen monotypes—along with some 50 related paintings, drawings, pastels, sketchbooks, and prints—that show Degas at his most modern, capturing the spirit of urban life; depicting the body in new and daring ways; liberating mark-making from tradition; and boldly engaging the possibilities of abstraction.

AND 

From the Collection: 1960–1969


  Above: Yayoi Kusama (Japanese, born 1929).                             Accumulation No. 1. 1962. Sewn stuffed fabric, paint,                     and chair fringe, 37 inches by 39 inches by 43 inches                     (94 cm. by 99.1 cm. by 109.2 cm). The Museum                                 of Modern Art, New York.


With From the Collection: 1960–1969, MoMA re-installs its fourth-floor collection galleries with works from all six of its curatorial departments. The presentation is organized through the lens of the 1960s, when inter-disciplinary artistic experimentation flourished and traditional mediums were radically transformed. Artistic change paralleled socio-political upheaval around the globe, and these seismic shifts reach to the present. The galleries feature works across media, including paintings, sculptures, drawings, prints, photographs, architecture, design objects, videos, films, and archival materials.

The installation includes a range of works from the 1960s, including a Jaguar E-Type Roadster (1961), a selection from Bela Kolárová’s photographic body of work Radiogram of Circle (1962–63), Nam June Paik’s Zen for TV (1963), James Rosenquist’s F-111 (1964–65), Jo Baer’s Primary Light Group: Red, Green, Blue [masked]), Robert Smithson’s drawing A Heap of Language (1966), Bonnie Maclean’s poster for the Yardbirds and the Doors (1967), Eva Hesse’s Repetition Nineteen (1968), a group of works related to Superstudio’s The Continuous Monument: New York Extrusion Project, New York, New York (1969), and Nalini Malani’s film Dream Houses (1969), among many others.

Each gallery is dedicated to works from a single year, and the galleries proceed in chronological order. This approach provides a framework for displaying a wide-ranging selection of objects from the Museum’s collection, offering visitors a rare opportunity to see an automobile in proximity to an oil painting, an etching juxtaposed with an architectural model, or a film alongside a sculpture. The organizational principles vary throughout: some galleries explore the potential of unexpected connections across mediums and genres while others gather works that are similar in materials or function.

results.description:
Hi there,

We find ourselves challenged to maintain an environment that would encourage our kids to learn the German language and culture. Like many in the area, we live far from family that could provide more frequent interactions in German. Since our partners are English speaking, we'd like to create opportunities for our kids to experience German not only through interacting with us parents but also with others. Hence, we would love to build supporting networks with other parents and their babies & children that would like to interact and have fun(!) in German on a regular basis.


Since the summer is winding down we have to find a good place for the fall and those cold winter days : ) Any suggestions for good places for us to play or things to do are very welcome.

See you soon!

Maria & Renate

results.description:
Edmund Husserl believed that phenomenology is the science of the essence of consciousness, the philosophical science of consciousness qua intentionality. We will review "the reflective study of the essence of consciousness as experienced from the first-person point of view”. Then we will return "to the things themselves" rigorous science of all conceivable transcendental phenomena, esp. meaning. Will touch a method of the critique of knowledge (the phenomenological method), and define phenomenology is the universal doctrine of essences, in which takes place the science of the essence of knowledge.

Our research has to be held in the pure seeing, but not for this reason has to be limited to the real immanent: it is research in the sphere of pure evidence and hence research of essences. We also say that its field is the apriori within the absolutely given in itself.

After this seminar from 7pm-10pm will be another discussion (followed by the reception) devoted to the Eerie Silence of our Universe. Enrico Fermi was Italian physicist, who created the world's first nuclear reactor and was awarded the 1938 Nobel Prize in Physics. In response to a lunch time discussion about extraterrestrials, he asked the question “Where is Everybody?” (i.e. where are extraterrestrials).  This became known as the Fermi Paradox (1950). The basic points of the arguments are:

• If there is nothing special about Earth or humanity, then whatever is true here should be true elsewhere in the galaxy.

• There are billions of stars in the galaxy that are similar to the Sun and some of these stars will have Earth-like planets. Some of them might develop intelligent life.

• Following this reasoning, Frank Drake predicted the existence of tens of thousands of advanced extraterrestrial civilizations (ETC) and Carl Sagan likewise predicted perhaps a million ETC. 

• At least some of these ETC’s must be millions or even billions of years more advanced than us. Some of these civilizations might develop interstellar travel, thus they should have already reached Earth and we should have detected their existence by now.

So, “Where is Everybody?” 

Something must be wrong with this chain of reasoning so, we will review about 30 solutions to the Fermi Paradox and even create our own solution.

There will be free wine, cheese, and plenty of intellectual pleasure. Contact for any questions [masked]
results.name: Phenomenology of Edmund Husserl Host: Prof. Bowen

results.description:
This restaurant is CASH ONLY. And that's good for us.
They don't have a liquor license... bring your own wine or beer, there is a cork fee...

The restaurant has a very small parking lot, and its nearly impossible to see when you want to leave as cars park on the street....to know if it is safe to enter the roadway, so... I suggest that you park in the community behind the restaurant and walk over. This place is not fancy at all, it a low budget décor / furnishings, you will not be impressed. The fish is fresh and that's what matters ! It is locally caught by Artie ( he has his own boat ) and local fisherman come in to sell to him every day. I've been here many times and it's always great.

results.description:
The first museum exhibition devoted to the Indian influences in Clemente’s work and how they relate to the artistic practices and traditions of various regions in India features approximately 20 works, including paintings from the last 30 years, and four new, larger than life-size sculptures created especially for the exhibition. In contrast to leading conceptual art practices of the 1970s, Clemente refocused attention on representation, narrative, and the figure, and explored traditional, artisanal materials and modes of working. Since his first trip to India in the 1970s, Francesco Clemente immersed himself in the country’s rich cultures as well as the everyday life and artistic practices of local people. Transforming ancient symbols, myths, and ideas, he has created a personal visual language of dreamlike landscapes, animals, and human figures drawn from recollections of his travels. Themes of sexuality, mythology, and spirituality, along with imaginary narratives of violence, intrigue, fragmentation, love, separation, and jealousy are seen throughout his oeuvre.

Every Friday the K2 Lounge offers a special pan-Asian tapas menu to accompany the evening's DJ and programs. Happy Hour runs from 6:00–7:00 p.m. with a 2-for-1 special on all beer, wine, and well drinks.
results.name: India

results.description:
What day is today? Why, it's bring the pain Friday! It is once again time for us to ... Dodge. The. Ball.

If you don't know, now you know ...

If you've never played the game of dodgeball as a kid you must have grown up on Mars. But as a quick primer, it's a game in which players on two teams throw large balls at each other while avoiding being hit themselves. That's it. And no athletic skill is necessary!

If you haven't played the game in 20 years, here are the general rules we will be using with a few modifications: Dodgeball Rules

A $3.00 organization fee will be collected at this event, your host is in the running for hardest working person on meetup.

The important stuff ...

• This is a co-ed game so ladies don't be shy to sign up. And it doesn't matter if you have no athletic ability, you just have to be willing to have a little fun.

• Dress for physical activity! You'll be dodging and running so wear your sneaks, shorts and a t-shirt.

• Rain or similar un-favorable weather cancels the meetup. Not!

• Check the meetup site before leaving for last minute updates as well as my mobile phone number.

• Please DO NOT RSVP if you do not seriously plan to attend as space is limited. No flakes allowed! If you RSVP and I notice that you have a number of no shows or have a history of last minute cancellations, you will be removed.

• Sorry, no guests allowed for this one.
results.name: Urban Athletics: Dodgeball for Grownups (Co-ed)

Come see these amazing artworks, learn all the insane stories about the gods and life as an ancient Greek in 200 BCE, and be led around by one of our renegade tour guides, who will customize the experience based on YOU!


Want to hear more about Zeus? You got it. Can't get enough of mosaics? We've got you covered.

May 6th

results.description:
If you're interested in getting on a stage in a low pressure environment to try some improv, this event is for you! I have reserved space at the basement stage of the Triple Crown Ale House. We will likely to do some warmups, 2-person scenes, and then do some short sets with other more veteran improvisers. Participate as much or as little as you would like. Or simply come and watch! 

All who attend will get to do 2-person scenes and a bigger jam set at the end!  This is the most low pressure fun performance opportunity out there - perfect for all!  If you're think you're ready, you're ready!  All scenes will be inspired by a suggestion of a random word from the audience.  


I've also invited improvisers from the NYC improv community to attend as well.  So you may get to play with some veteran improvisers as well.
results.how_to_find_us: Go downstairs to the basement at 6pm (go to the back of the bar and go down the stairs)

results.description:
Holistic Hangout

(typically every 3rd Friday of the month)

Relax, Unwind, Refresh

When climbing the mountain of enlightenment, growth, self-development, healing, and spirituality it can be good to stop and catch your breath.

Share, Connect and Exchange!

Meet fellow seekers off the mat, outside the circle, beyond the classroom.

Rest your 3rd eye

Revive your Chakras

Fill your heart with good company, food and drink.


COME OUT & PLAY WITH US at the WHOLE FOODS CAFE!


Stop by for a little, Stop by for a lot,

Stop by on your way or Stop by and stay,

Stop by for some stimulating conversation and a bite to eat with unique and interesting people who share an interest in the diversity of holistic and alternative news, views and practices. We are experimenting with this new, quieter space with more freedom to mingle, move, chat and exchange.

This is a very casual event.  No agenda, just simple conversation, meet and mingle.

Share adventures, experiences, health tips, intentions and more

Learn about interesting classes

Meet healers, practitioners and coaches

 If you are just beginning to explore or been exploring for a while, we welcome you.  It is amazing how so many people who are attracted find that they have natural abilities of healing, coaching, energyworking or even more amazing skills.

Make Great Connections in an inviting social setting

We Look Forward To Welcoming Back Old Friends & Meeting New Ones Too!

You can Register here on Meetup or on EventBrite

Many Blessings,


Joel Elfman & Michael Balice


***We are often joined by members from several other Meetup groups this event is posted to.

results.description:
For beginners and experienced meditators.

Metta, or Lovingkindness Meditation (LKM), is the practice of wishing oneself and others happiness, health, and ease. Based on traditional Buddhist teachings, it has become an increasingly popular practice, as it generates both concentration and a deep understanding of the nature of our connection to ourselves and others.

This is a drop-in event, and pre-registration is not necessary. We're offering it on a donation basis, and request each participant to contribute between $10 - $20 to support this and other initiatives led by The Interdependence Project.

Please visit http://theidproject.org/events/2015/06/05/metta-meditation-group for details.

Please note that our space is not wheelchair accessible and can only be reached by climbing two steep flights of stairs!

results.description:
Hi everyone, 

This will be our 3rd time at Vapiano, after the great success of our February & March meetups! 

Vapiano is close to Union Square for easy transportation, has individual payment system to avoid shared checks, a large space to accommodate large group and a very low music level for conversations. Plus, they have plenty of food should you come hungry.

NOTE: You will receive a plastic card upon entering, which you use to place all your orders at the bar or counter. At the end of the night you pay off your card as you exit the place.

Is there a Cover Charge?

No! Our monthly meetup is free of charge as always.

If you like to help offset the cost for maintaining our group, you can make a $1 donation to our piggy bank, it is well appreciated but there is absolutely no obligation to do so.

Do I have to speak German?

No. While many are German natives who will speak German, our conversations are usually mixed depending on your skills and preferences.

How long is the event?

Vapiano closes at Midnight. During past events many of our members stayed until closing, some went out clubbing afterwards, but there is no official end time. If you like to stay, you stay. If you need to head out early or just wanna stop by and say hi, that is totally fine. On the flipside, of course, there is no guarantee that we will stay till closing. Depends on how the night is going :)

How do I get there by train?

4/5/6/N/R/Q/L -  Union Square: 1-3 blocks

F/M - 14th St: 3 blocks

A/C/E/B/D - West 4th St: 10 blocks or tranfser to F/M to 14th St

Please look at your RSVP and change it if your plans have changed so we can keep the venue updated on our expected attendance.

I am looking forward to see plenty of you guys again, as well as many new members & guests!!

Thomas

[masked]

[masked]

results.description:
Metta, or Lovingkindness Meditation (LKM), is the practice of wishing oneself and others happiness, health, and ease. Studies indicate that practicing LKM positively impacts our emotions, our physical health, and our sense of connection. Our weekly Metta Meditation Group meets for practice and discussion every week with IDP's Executive Director, Kimberly Brown. 

This offering is open to both beginners and experienced meditators. Cushions and chairs will be provided. We request a $10-$20 donation to support our organization, though no one will be turned away for lack of funds.

Note we are located on the 2nd floor of a walk-up building. There is no elevator.


The Interdependence Project
302 Bowery 3rd Floor, Middle Buzzer
Between Houston and 1st Street

results.description:
For our Spring/Summer sessions, we shall revert back to 3 Teams.

• Teams will be 7 a-side, 6 outfield players, NO sub, and a goal keeper.

• We play for 8 minutes or 2 goals.

• Winner stays! 

• If the initial game between the first 2 teams ends in a tie, a coin toss will be used to determine which team stays on.

• In the event of a tie, the new or incoming team stays on.

• Be Social, use your time on the sideline to get to know your teammates better :))


• We play with Red Uptown Soccer practice bibs to differentiate the teams.  

Please signup ASAP and may the force be with you :)

Disclaimer: By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

results.description:
SECOND SHOW ADDED 6:00-7:00pm, buy tickets now!

Chennai-born New Yorker Prasanna takes you on a solo guitar journey of contemporary India that celebrates the mystic and the high-tech, along with old world charm and new world spirit, through the music of new India’s beloved musician and film scorer—A.R. Rahman.

A personal friend and musical collaborator of A.R. Rahman’s for almost 25 years, Prasanna will share his his guitar stories in composed and improvised musical vignettes, celebrating eclecticism in songs from Roja to Jeans, Dil Se to Lagaan, and Slumdog Millionaire to Million Dollar Arm.

“Prasanna is a living hope for quality music” – A.R. Rahman

“Prasanna plays guitar like nobody else on the planet” – allaboutjazz.com

Co-presented with Harrice Miller Entertainment, community partner Sunny Thakkkar

For more information and to buy tickets:
http://rubinmuseum.org/events/event/prasanna-plays-ar-rahman-04-15-2016

TICKETS FOR THIS CONCERT ARE SOLD OUT! THERE IS A STANDBY PROCEDURE, DEFINITELY WORTH A TRY TO SEE THIS FABULOUS ARTIST!

http://rubinmuseum.org/visit/tickets#standby

results.description:
活动收取门票$5每人。到场并参与游戏的请准备$5现金，刷卡$6。请在入场时交付并登记姓名 （定期有特殊优惠)。只观战不参与游戏的，不需要交费。晚到或提前退场但参与游戏的，门票价钱一样$5。

---------------------------------------------------------

如果你玩过杀人游戏或狼人杀，却还没听过阿瓦隆，那我不得不说您有点out啦！

与狼人杀相似，阿瓦隆也是一款角色扮演加逻辑推理游戏，玩家扮演不同身份，在辩驳之中分辨好人坏人。与狼人杀不同的是，玩家人数为5 - 10人，每一位玩家都能够参与到游戏最后，不存在被杀被票死就只能干看别人玩的情景。

这个游戏考验玩家的逻辑分析能力以及彼此的信任度，是一款绝对不会让你失望的游戏！如果您没有玩过这款游戏也不用担心，游戏规则很简单5分钟就可以学会，即便您对此游戏一无所知来参加我们活动也没关系。

玩家人数达到5人即举办活动，游戏时间4月15日6:30pm - 9:30pm。如果人数多，会开2-3桌或组织升级等其他游戏。地点在距离Penn Station步行五分钟的XYZ IMPRESSION Studio。地址：470 7th Ave, Suite 410, New York, NY 10018. 由于游戏受玩家人数影响，请大家尽量早到5 - 10分钟，不要迟到，6:30pm准时开始介绍游戏规则。

报名请RSVP并将姓名，Email，电话私信(message)给Lisa Yu.

results.description:
It doesn't matter if you've played pool before or not. This is a fun and different way to make new friends and maybe find that someone special. 

Mix & mingle before playing pool with ice breakers while we create teams. Women & Men will be paired into teams of two or three. Each team will stay together throughout the event.  

This event will sell out quickly (especially for MEN) so get your tickets ASAP:

WOMEN get tickets here - https://goo.gl/AxbjqB

MEN get tickets here - https://goo.gl/XBvQJb

Prepay Only Event. No tix sold at door. Must buy in advance.  


Next the fun begins. We will have one male team and one female team stationed at each pool table. This male and female team will play one game of pool or for a maximum of 15 minutes. Which ever team wins the game wins a prize. 


At the end of the game or 15 minutes, the ladies will stay at the same pool table. The male team will rotate to the next  table and the process begins again. We will continue for two hours or until you have met everyone.

You will have the option to complete a scorecard at the end of the night. You can write down the names of anyone you were interested in. We will send them an email letting them know that you were interested and provide your email address.

What's included:

• Free Pool Games     

• Scorecard Matching  

• Ice Breakers 

• Prizes for winning team

Tickets are $30-$35 depending upon how early you purchase:


WOMEN get tickets here - https://goo.gl/AxbjqB

MEN get tickets here - https://goo.gl/XBvQJb

Prepay Only Event. No tix sold at door. Must buy in advance.  


This is a multi-Meetup, non-ethnic specific event. This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees. Up to 40 singles will be attending. Ages will mostly be 20s-40s. Food and drink will be available for purchase.
results.name: Singles Pool (Billiards) Night - Prepay Only Event

group.name: The New York City Social Group (12,000+ members!)

results.description:
Prepayment is required  HERE


------------------------------------------------ 
WHAT: POOL (BILLIARDS) for Singles 

WHERE: Society Billiards & bar 
WHO: Single men and women ages 20's, 30's, & 40's

How it works

Women will be paired up into teams of two or three and Men will be paired up into teams of two or three. Don't worry if you are coming alone or do not have someone to sign up with. People will arrive early so you will have time to mingle  and we will help create the teams. Each team will stay together throughout the event.


Next the fun begins. We will have one male team and one female team stationed at each pool table. This male and female team will play one game of pool OR play for a maximum of 15 minutes. Which ever team wins the game will win a prize. 

At the end of the game or 15 minutes, the ladies will stay at the same pool table. The male team will rotate to the next pool table and the process begins again. We will continue for either two hours or until you have met everyone.

Question: I was interested in someone but am still uncomfortable asking them for contact information.


Answer: You will have a scorecard to fill out after each round. You can write down the names of anyone you were interested in from the event. We will send them an email letting them know that you were interested and provide your email address.

Prepayment is required HERE


**************Food and Drinks are available for purchase********


30-$35 depending on how early you register.
results.name: POOL (Billiards)- AGES 20's, 30's, 40's (prepay required)

group.name: Alternative to the Bar Fun Things To Do In NYC Today!

results.description:
Hola amigos y amigas:


Join our Culture, Grammar & Conversation Workshops to improve your speaking and listening skills in Spanish in a fun and natural way. During the workshops an experienced instructor will help you develop the vocabulary and grammar structures necessary to be able to converse on various subjects of interest. We have two levels:

BEGINNERS & LOWER INTERMEDIATES

The workshops are very interactive, fun and stimulating. They are conducted by an experienced Spanish instructor who will correct mistakes, explain grammar and usage -whenever necessary- and highlight essential vocabulary for effective communication in Spanish.

COST: Just $15 per person, includes: workshop, printouts (if needed), pencil, fun!

IMPORTANT: Clicking "YES" without payment does not reserve a spot - ONLY ADVANCE PAYMENT DOES - This goes for ALL our events

--------------------------------------------------------------------------

LEVEL: LOWER INTERMEDIATES (B1*)

TIME: From 6:30pm to 8:00pm

TEACHER: Jorge Gallegos

****CLICK HERE TO PAY & REGISTER****

-----------------------------------------------------------------

LEVEL:  MIDDLE BEGINNERS and UP *

TIME: From 6:30pm to 8:00pm

TEACHER: María Angélica García

****CLICK HERE TO PAY & REGISTER****

---------------------------------------------------------------------------

(*) NOT SURE ABOUT YOUR LEVEL OF SPANISH? Visit HERE for some guidance.

Need to confirm your payment went through? Read ---> HERE

Previous Spanish Conversation Workshops for small groups were a big success! Read comments ---> HERE

**************************************

DETAILS
We'll have two groups running at the same time: Middle Beginners and Lower Intermediates.

Duration: 1 hour and 30 minutes per workshop

Jorge Gallegos and María Angélica García from Easy Espanol (www.easyespanol.org) will be your language coaches. Jorge is a skilled Spanish language instructor with over fourteen years of experience teaching Spanish as a second language. María Angélica is a dynamic instructor from Venzuela with a good sense of humor, very patient and a deep knowledge about contemporary cultural issues from the Spanish speaking world.

Please be aware that late tolerance is 15 minutes (you can't join a workshop if you are over 15 minutes late after 6:30pm).

ABOUT RSVP: Keep in mind that for all our paid events, RSVP does not guarantee a spot, only advance payment does

WHERE TO FIND US

The workshops will be held at 555 8th Avenue, Suite 110 (between 37th & 38th)

See where we are in a map---> HERE

CANCELLATIONS: You can cancel and get a full refund anytime up to 48 hours before your workshop start time. Read more HERE

¡Nos vemos!

Jorge
results.name: SPANISH CULTURE & CONVERSATION WORKSHOPS (BEGINNERS & LOWER INTERMEDIATE)

results.description:
It doesn't matter if you've played pool before or not. This is a fun and different way to make new friends and maybe find that someone special. 

Mix & mingle before playing pool with ice breakers while we create teams. Women & Men will be paired into teams of two or three. Each team will stay together throughout the event.  

This event will sell out quickly (especially for MEN) so get your tickets ASAP:

WOMEN get tickets here - https://goo.gl/AxbjqB

MEN get tickets here - https://goo.gl/XBvQJb

Prepay Only Event. No tix sold at door. Must buy in advance.   

Next the fun begins. We will have one male team and one female team stationed at each pool table. This male and female team will play one game of pool or for a maximum of 15 minutes. Which ever team wins the game wins a prize.  

At the end of the game or 15 minutes, the ladies will stay at the same pool table. The male team will rotate to the next  table and the process begins again. We will continue for two hours or until you have met everyone. 

You will have the option to complete a scorecard at the end of the night. You can write down the names of anyone you were interested in. We will send them an email letting them know that you were interested and provide your email address.

What's included:

• Free Pool Games    

• Scorecard Matching  

• Ice Breakers 

• Prizes for winning team

Tickets are $30-$35 depending upon how early you purchase: 

WOMEN get tickets here - https://goo.gl/AxbjqB

MEN get tickets here - https://goo.gl/XBvQJb

Prepay Only Event. No tix sold at door. Must buy in advance.   

This is a multi-Meetup, non-ethnic specific event. This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees. Up to 40 singles will be attending. Ages will mostly be 20s-40s. Food and drink will be available for purchase.

venue.name: Art of Living New York Center

results.description:
This free workshop introduces the The Art of Living Foundation's seminal programs.  Over 40 million people worldwide have benefited from the Foundation's programs which teach simple yet powerful breathing and meditative techniques for reducing stress, anxiety, and fear, while increasing the potential for clarity, joy, and inner peace.


In the workshop we explore the connection between breath and meditation and state of mind.  Participants will experience the breath as a fundamental tool to unlocking a happier, more relaxed state of being with higher levels of awareness, focus and clarity.  We will experience the yoga of breath and end with a guided meditation.

Participants will also learn more about the additional course offerings at Art of Living Foundation which will allow them to develop a personal home practice. 

When:Friday 6:30pm-7:45pm (Please arrive early for seating and registration)

Where: 286 5th Ave  5th Floor (between 30th and 31st St) NY 10001

FAQs:

Please ring the 5th floor from the main entrance and someone will buzz you in.

You can attend in your work clothes.

Your first meetup is free. Repeat sessions are $10 each.
results.why: I Meditate NY is a movement empowering New Yorkers to do more things they love by recharging through meditation, a practical way to refresh every day, invented thousands of years ago. Reinvented in 2011. Our mission is to recharge New York!
results.how_to_find_us: http://imeditateny.org
results.name: Breath To Happiness

Prepayment is required  HERE

------------------------------------------------ 
WHAT: POOL (BILLIARDS) for Singles 

WHERE: Society Billiards & bar 
WHO: Single men and women ages 20's, 30's, & 40's

How it works

Women will be paired up into teams of two or three and Men will be paired up into teams of two or three. Don't worry if you are coming alone or do not have someone to sign up with. People will arrive early so you will have time to mingle  and we will help create the teams. Each team will stay together throughout the event.


Next the fun begins. We will have one male team and one female team stationed at each pool table. This male and female team will play one game of pool OR play for a maximum of 15 minutes. Which ever team wins the game will win a prize. 

At the end of the game or 15 minutes, the ladies will stay at the same pool table. The male team will rotate to the next pool table and the process begins again. We will continue for either two hours or until you have met everyone.

Question: I was interested in someone but am still uncomfortable asking them for contact information.


Answer: You will have a scorecard to fill out after each round. You can write down the names of anyone you were interested in from the event. We will send them an email letting them know that you were interested and provide your email address.

Prepayment is required HERE


**************Food and Drinks are available for purchase********


30-$35 depending on how early you register.
results.name: POOL (Billiards)- AGES 20's, 30's, 40's (prepay required)

group.name: Greater NYC and Long Island Fun Events

results.description:
A great way to get Dharma connected in New York!

For people interested in Buddhism or meditation or just leading a kinder life who are up for meeting like minded people.

Dharma Drink is now Self Service!

The table is always reserved in the same spot - just show up and see what happens  - just like if you were hanging out meeting other Buddhists randomly in Kathamandu or India. And don't take the RSVP too seriously - people are coming now who don't RSVP. The word is getting out....

Everyone is invited! Dharma Drink is all about building community amongst the Buddhist and like minded crowd in New York City. Greg the founder of Dharma Drink: "I was inspired to start Dharma Drink by hanging out with all of the great students of all of the different lamas in Kathmandu - Kagyu, Nyingma, Sakya, Gelugpa - totally Rimey (also Zen, Thai, Theravadan, yoga travelers, and the curious - just about everyone!).  We all became great friends and learned from each other." We're there every Friday night - see you there.


Motivation:  To make the Rubin Museum Lounge on Friday night the Buddhist and like minded hang-out spot in New York.

Who:  ALL ARE INVITED.  Feel free to spread the word.  The more,             the merrier.

Time:  7-?pm
Date:  Every Friday - like clockwork
Place:  Rubin Museum Lounge, 17th Street and 7th Avenue
How to find us:  Look for a table with the small sign "Dharma Drink"                          + Lounge staff  will know where we are.

Please see the following Meetups too!

Buddhist Events New York     and

Zen / Chan Buddhist Activities

www.dharmadrink.com
results.why: Because Buddhists and like minded people are great to hang-out with.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be at a high-top table with little sign that says Dharma Drink, the high table overlooking the lower level and closest to the elevators - the lounge staff will know where we are in case you get totally lost.
results.name: Dharma Drink: the hang-out for Buddhists (& like minded)

group.name: Dharma Drink: the hangout for Buddhists (& like minded)

results.description: HRU Yuya T. Assaan-ANU prepares you for your own spiritual shift. This show delves into the dark aspects of life altering wisdom and the illumination of soul enlightenment via occult studies, holistic health information, self-hypnosis and mental deprogramming, and cultural education. For a free psychic reading send in your question via the Sadulu House website or call into “The Enlightenment and Transformation” broadcast Friday’s at 6:30pm and HRU will provide you with a reading on the spot! Go to Blogtalkradio.com/Enlightenmentandtransformation at 6:30pm.
results.how_to_find_us: Go to Blogtalkradio.com/Enlightenmentandtransformation
results.name: Join us on our Blogtalk Radio Broadcast "Enlightenment and Transformation"

results.description:
I found an open Friday!! Dibs.

It's been a while since we've had a proper Dinner and Drinks meetup, so let's head over to Mamaroneck and check out this wine and whisky bar near the shore! I've spent a lot of time in Mamaroneck but I've never been to Bar'Lees myself. I hear good things, though, so I'm excited to check it out.

For those concerned about parking, if you aren't lucky enough to find a spot on Mamaroneck Ave, head around to E Prospect Ave. There's a fairly large lot, and I think you don't have to feed the meters after 7. Don't quote me on that though.

See you soon!
results.name: Mamaroneck Dinner And Drinks!

group.name: Young Women of Westchester & Fairfield Counties

results.description:
Blake Tucker is a software engineer on the American Express Mobile team based out of Phoenix. Prior to Amex Mobile, he worked on an internal app development team working mobile apps for internal enterprise use. His technical background started in embedded systems at Arizona State University, before morphing into a hybrid of Java and .Net and stumbling on serious iOS development in 2011. Blake will be walking through what functional programming is, how it benefits us as developers, and then show a demo app implementing using built in functions, compared to the same function in RxSwift, closing with what this means for TDD and how to continue a TDD flow in RxSwift.

6:30pm - 7:00pm: Study group-time/Networking
7:00pm - 8:00pm: RxSwift with Blake
8:00pm - 9:00pm: Q&A + study group-time

RSVP here:
http://www.eventbrite.com/e/what-is-functional-programming-tickets-24330605496?aff=swiftmeetup
results.name: What is Functional Programming?

results.description:
We'd like to invite you to our NYC Friends of Clearwater monthly gathering! We hope you can join us at 239 Thompson Street on Friday, April 15th, starting at 6:30pm.

Our speaker this month will be Shameika "Mimi" Hanson, Volunteer Coordinator for Hudson River Sloop Clearwater. Shameika will tell us about what is happening with the restoration of the Sloop Clearwater. She will also discuss Clearwater's other plans to help make sure that both the sloop and the Hudson River Revival can keep Pete Seeger's legacy alive by continuing their mission of environmental education and activism.

In the “open mike” portion of the evening we'll have music, poetry, and maybe some surprises! So folks, please bring your instruments, your voices, and whatever else you would like to share with us. Don’t worry if your musical efforts are not super polished - because the main thing is always to sing along and have a good time in the Clearwater tradition! 

The evening also features a potluck dinner, and it's always interesting to see what kind of food selections people bring. Whether you love to prepare your favorite recipes, or you'd rather just bring something from a salad bar, this is your opportunity to share something delicious with us. A main course, veggies, juice or seltzer to drink are especially welcome! We would also like to encourage people to bring their own utensils and reusable dishes, but whatever you need will be there as well.

Our monthly gatherings take place at Judson Memorial Church, an organization which shares our vision of social and environmental justice, and activism through the arts. The location is 239 Thompson Street, just south of Washington Square. It's in the basement, so please ring the bell and we'll buzz you in. All are welcome. We're looking forward to seeing you!

Edie Kantrowitz - President, NYCFC

Subway Info: A,B,C,D,E,F,M to West 4th Street station (at 6th Ave); N,R, to 8th Street station (at Broadway); 1 to Christopher Street station (at 7th Avenue).

PS - Don't forget our upcoming fundraiser concert for Clearwater! On Friday, April 29th, NYC Friends of Clearwater and the New York Society for Ethical Culture (NYSEC) will partner in a very special evening. “All Hands on Deck: A Fundraiser for Clearwater” will feature an amazing line-up of performers sharing their talents in a benefit concert to help keep both the Sloop Clearwater, and Pete Seeger’s legacy afloat.

With Kim & Reggie Harris, The Chapin Sisters, Bethany & Rufus, The Peace Poets, Judy Gorman, The Ebony Hillbillies, and Bev Grant, this is one you won’t want to miss! We’re also planning to include a silent auction, and some special surprises!

NYSEC is located at 2 West 64th Street in Manhattan. Doors open 6:30, and performance starts at 7:00.
Tickets start at $20.00, and can be purchased here:http://buytickets.at/nycfriendsofclearwater/48803
results.name: NYC Friends of Clearwater April Gathering

results.description:
BOOK CLUB: In the Name of Heaven: 3000 Years of Religious Persecution

APRIL 15, 2016 (FRIDAY) / STONE CREEK - REAR ROOM - 140 E 27th St. (3/Lex),

6:30 PM HAPPY HOUR / 7:00 PM BOOK CLUB

HOST: DAVID ORENSTEIN, Ph.D

BOOK: In the Name of Heaven: 3000 Years of Religious Persecution

AUTHOR: MARY JANE ENGH / An independent scholar of Roman history.

Religion—the source of inspiration, hope, and basic values for most of humanity throughout history—has also been the motive for atrocious persecutions from antiquity to the present. In the Name of Heaven is a wide-ranging historical survey of religious persecution encompassing three millennia and a great diversity of cultures worldwide.
Defining religious persecution as "repressive actions initiated or condoned by authorities against their own people on religious grounds," author Mary Jane Engh begins with ancient Egypt, followed by the biblical history of Israel with its accounts of divinely ordered genocides and capital punishment for worshipers of other deities.
Chapters are devoted to ancient Greece (Socrates, Alcibiades, and Aristotle, among others, clashed with the religious establishment); the Roman Empire (persecutions of Jews, Christians, and Manichaeans, and the later persecution of pagans and heretics by a Christianized Rome); the Islamic Empire (persecutions of polytheists and dissident Muslims); and medieval and Reformation Europe (where Protestants and Catholics persecuted each other and both persecuted heretics).
The twenty-two chapters also cover Asia, Africa, the Americas, and the Pacific area. In an epilogue Engh reviews the new forms of religious persecution from the 20th century to the present—from major genocides and militant forms of polytheism to persecution of all religion by atheistic governments.
Complete with references to further reading, this sobering but factually indisputable survey of religion’s dark side enlightens while serving as a warning for the future.



----------------------------------

LOCATION: STONE CREEK - REAR ROOM - 140 E 27th St. (3/Lex), REAR ROOM

COST: Free, but purchase drink or food to compensate Stone Creek for their space

======================

Not your typical Chinese Food, let's try Liao ning Cuisine

Liaoning cuisine is part of the seriesChinese cuisineRegional cuisines Overseas cuisine Religious cuisines Ingredients and types of food Preparation and cooking See also China portalvte


Liaoning cuisine (Chinese: 辽菜 or 辽宁菜) is derived from the native cooking styles of the Liaoning Province in China, and it is the most famous Northeastern Chinese cuisine. Liaoning cuisine has gained increased popularity in China recently and its chefs have continuously won awards in the national culinary competitions in China, and the cuisine is heavily influenced by Beijing cuisine. The main characteristics of Liaoning cuisine is that it is colorful, tastes are strong, food is soft, and one dish has many flavors/tastes, however, the sweet taste and the salty taste are very distinct.

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, timed it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds will be honored only with a minimum of 24 hour cancelation.  No refunds for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

The school entrance is located on East 109th street between 2nd and 3rd avenues (near 2nd avenue) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right) and someone will open the door for you.

For questions,  use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
Celebrate all things women with an evening of storytelling, poetry and music inspired by the Bronx and the works of art on view at the Bronx Museum.  Make your voice heard in our open mic!

Hosted by Maria Aponte, and featuring performances by Nene Ali, Michele Carlo, Annie Lanzillotto, and Julissa Rodriguez.
  
Free admission and cash bar
Location: 2nd floor North Wing and throughout the galleries

-----------------------------------------------------------------

About Bronx Stories
Launched in December of 2011, Bronx Stories aims to challenge stereotypes about the Bronx and provide a platform for voices from the community while encouraging deeper engagement with the arts.  Each event features 3-4 professional or amateur storytellers telling a story related to a specific artwork on view at the Museum.  The most successful stories have been those drawn from the storyteller's experience in the Bronx.  The event culminates with an open-mic portion during which audience members perform their own short stories, poems, or songs.
results.name: Bronx Stories: Bronx Women

results.description:
Dear Friends,

New York Italians in collaboration with Fordham University, Department of Modern Languages and Literature and
Italian Honor Society C.I.A.O. is very happy to invite you to:

Presentation and discussion of the film: Presentation and discussion of the film:

Enrico IV di Marco Bellocchio


Fordham University, Lincoln Center Campus
113 W 60th street, NY, NY
Room SL24L  April 15th 2016 at 6:45 PM


English Subtitles


Admission is free but space is limited.

PREFERENCE WILL BE GIVEN TO NEW YORK ITALIANS MEMBERS (membership card required: http://www.newyorkitalians.org/become-member/)

RSVP mandatory at [masked]

 
Durante una festa in maschera, il barone Belcredi provoca la caduta di un suo rivale in amore, che impazzisce credendo di essere Enrico IV, l'imperatore di Germania scomunicato nel 1076 da Gregorio VII. L'uomo si rinchiude in un castello, decidendo - deluso e amareggiato per le finzioni e le ipocrisie del mondo - di continuare a recitare la parte del folle anche dopo aver riacquistato il senno. Vent'anni dopo, mentre il gruppo della festa è in visita al castello, il dramma viene alla luce...

*****

A 20th-century aristocrat (Marcello Mastroianni) falls off a horse and becomes convinced that he is Henry IV, the emperor who ruled Rome in the 11th century. Oddly, the friends and relatives of the accident victim don't attempt to dissuade him and instead play along with his delusions. As a royal court is built around "Henry," his psychiatrist (Leopoldo Trieste) attempts to figure out if the faux noble is truly insane or if he is merely milking his madness for all it is worth.
results.name: New York Italians Cinema at Fordham University Lincoln Center!!

results.description:
Permaculture Rooftop Gardens at The Commons

Come and learn how to work with nature on our city rooftops creating medicinal gardens and refuges of beauty, biodiversity and beyond organic food yields!


Weather permitting we will meet on the rooftop of The Commons, touring and discussing this well designed Permaculture rooftop perennial medicinal edible garden.

Brooklyn Permaculture Meetup
Every Third Friday at The Commons
7pm-9pm
$5 Suggested donation - no one turned away!

Permaculture is a whole systems design science that is positively changing the way people think and interact with Earth. Turn problems into solutions by joining us in the discussion, design and implementation of projects in and around Brooklyn and the surrounding region. We are looking to create an active group of motivated beings that want to contribute to all the positive change that is happening in our region and the world. This Meetup will be lead by Andrew Faust and occasional visiting friends. Andrew is director at Center for Bioregional Living which since 2007 has been training permaculture designers in NYC and starting June 1st 2012 at their rural campus in Ellenville, NY. A certificate in Permaculture Design is very helpful but not necessary. Click HERE to join Brooklyn Permaculture Meetup.
results.name: Permaculture Rooftop Gardens @ Brooklyn Permaculture Meetup

results.description:
All levels are welcomed.

Our sessions are 2.5 hours with a long break in the middle. Attendees will draw from still lives with a break every half hour. 

During our session I will break off with each attendee individually to talk about the work they are creating and their individual drawing challenges. 

This is the fastest way to improve your drawing skills. It is a combination of practice and theory in the same class. 

Since each attendee comes to the session at a different level and with different challenges it is my goal to work with each person individually. 

• Space is limited and the setting is ideal. 

• Refreshments are served at the long break in the middle of the session. 

• Please bring a pad up to 16x20, a 2H, HB and 4B pencil and an eraser. 

• The price is $25 paid at the time of the class. 

• All levels are welcomed.

• Please RSVP through this meetup so I know you are coming. 

I look forward to seeing you there!

Simon

Simon Levenson is the drawing instructor at The National Arts Club and teaches drawing at The Morgan Library & Museum and The Museum of The City of New York.  Please read reviews by other students of his teaching here.
