results.description:
This exhibition brings together paintings by five artists — Nina Chanel Abney, Mathew Cerletty, Jamian Juliano-Villani, Caitlin Keogh, and Orion Martin. Highlighting an engagement with representation among some emerging artists, the works in this group conjure a sense of space that is dimensionless and airless, like the illusionistic scenery flats used on stage and movie sets. Each of these artists fills their compositions with objects, bodies and places that are based on reality, yet are exaggerated, recontextualized, simplified or flattened. The individual works are imbued with both the uncertainty of our sociopolitical moment as well as the seductive quality of consumerism and physical attraction. The paintings in Flatlands invite the viewer to reflect on this ever-present polarity and ambivalence of contemporary life.

Pay What You Wish
Fridays, 7–10 pm

results.description:
I'll be camping the night before a section hike along the Appalachian Trail in Connecticut.  Join me if you like.

The group size limit for camping at this site is 6. I will be making this a waitlist only event. First dibs will go to those who are already confirmed on my AT Section hike, then for others doing HVH hikes in the Taconics that weekend.

There is a fee of $10 for this campsite payable in cash on arrival.

What to Bring:

It's still a bit cold at night in the mountains. You need a good sleeping bag rated to 20 degrees F or lower. In addition to a sleeping bag, you need a very good sleeping pad. It is important to have insulation between you and the ground. The filling in your sleeping bag that is underneath you will be compressed and provide no insulation. I highly recommend a sleeping pad with an R value of at least 5. (Hint: most closed cell foam pads have a 2.5 R value. If you double them up you will have a combined R value of 5.)

You will also need something to keep the weather off of you while you sleep. Since we're below the tree line, any small 3 season tent should do. You want something with good ventilation so that you don't get soaked in condensation over night.

I also ask that all participants bring a small bundle of wood. You can purchase local wood. There are strict regulations on transporting firewood within the State of New York. If you plan to carry wood from home, it must be kiln dried. If you want to see why this is so important, go check out the birch trees in the Adirondacks.

Ĉi tiu monato estas la 400-a datreveno de la morto de Ŝekspiro. Por memorfesti ĝin, ni sugestas ke vi alportu ajnan verkon de Ŝekspiro. Vi mem estu libera traduki ion. Kompreneble, ni legu nur malgrandaĵojn komune.

Permaculture Rooftop Gardens at The Commons

Come and learn how to work with nature on our city rooftops creating medicinal gardens and refuges of beauty, biodiversity and beyond organic food yields! Weather permitting we will meet on the rooftop of The Commons, touring and discussing this well designed Permaculture rooftop perennial medicinal edible garden. 

Brooklyn Permaculture Meetup
Every Third Friday at The Commons
7pm-9pm
$5 Suggested donation - no one turned away!

Permaculture is a whole systems design science that is positively changing the way people think and interact with Earth. Turn problems into solutions by joining us in the discussion, design and implementation of projects in and around Brooklyn and the surrounding region. We are looking to create an active group of motivated beings that want to contribute to all the positive change that is happening in our region and the world. This Meetup will be lead by Andrew Faust and occasional visiting friends. Andrew is director at Center for Bioregional Living which since 2007 has been training permaculture designers in NYC and starting June 1st 2012 at their rural campus in Ellenville, NY. A certificate in Permaculture Design is very helpful but not necessary. Click HERE to join Brooklyn Permaculture Meetup.

results.description:
Join Jason Kendall as he takes us to Mars, where Curiosity has been roaming the surface, seeking signs of past habitability of Mars. The recent confirmation of current, seasonal water flows on Mars only raises our own desire to set foot on this not-so-alien world. Through the rovers and orbiters, we see a place that is quite familiar, and that popular media as well as serious explorers hope to put feet on the ground of the red planet within the next 20 to 30 years. We’ll discuss the nature of the past conditions on Mars and how they were discovered and how humans may soon reach out and grasp the dirt of the Red Planet with their own hands.

City College of New York


North Academic Center, lecture hall room 0/201.

https://www.ccny.cuny.edu/education/about_us_nac_ccny

https://www.google.com/maps/place/160+Convent+Ave,+New+York,+NY+10031/@40.819824,-73.9515066,18z/data=!4m2!3m1!1s0x89c2f6652af1111b:0x7ed40bda91966edf?hl=en


About the speaker:
Jason Kendall is an Adjunct Prof. of Astronomy and Astronomy Liaison with William Paterson University in Wayne, New Jersey. Jason’s graduate research was in General Relativity and Cosmology, and he’s given numerous talks about the Big Bang, Black Holes for the AAA and around the region.

results.description:
Let's head to Tsuru Japanese Cuisine located in Hartsdale on Friay April 15th for dinner  - we'll meet at 7pm and be seated at 7:30. 

At Tsuru, you may need to be prepared to look your dinner in the eye. The pièce de résistance of their Instagram-worthy menu is the red gurnard—the head of this bright, peculiar-looking fish rests atop a column of bamboo sticks, its large pectoral fins loosely furled as if in mid-swim. It holds court over a bowl artfully packed with julienne veggies, herbs, flowers, and sashimi cut from the fish itself. With other entrees, such as sushi plates, condiments aren't relegated to ramekins, but instead painted into butterflies and flowers that frame the rolls.

However, Tsuru isn't all flash and no substance. Its extensive menu showcases the chefs' pan-Asian talents, including everything from hibachi and stir-fry to general tso's and green curry. A full bar lit in neon hues serves cocktails as colorful and creative as Tsuru's dishes. 

Tsuru Japanese Cuisine is a cornerstone in the Hartsdale community and has been recognized for its outstanding Sushi cuisine, excellent service and friendly staff.

Our Sushi restaurant is known for its modern interpretation of classic dishes and its insistence on only using high quality fresh ingredients.

http://www.tsuruhartsdale.com/

results.description:
This discussion (followed by reception) will be devoted to the Eerie Silence of our Universe. Enrico Fermi was Italian physicist, who created the world's first nuclear reactor and was awarded the 1938 Nobel Prize in Physics. In response to a lunch time discussion about extraterrestrials, he asked the question “Where is Everybody?” (i.e. where are extraterrestrials). This became known as the Fermi Paradox (1950). The basic points of the arguments are:

• If there is nothing special about Earth or humanity, then whatever is true here should be true elsewhere in the galaxy.

• There are billions of stars in the galaxy that are similar to the Sun and some of these stars will have Earth-like planets. Some of them might develop intelligent life.

• Following this reasoning, Frank Drake predicted the existence of tens of thousands of advanced extraterrestrial civilizations (ETC) and Carl Sagan likewise predicted perhaps a million ETC. At least some of these ETC’s must be millions or even billions of years more advanced than us. 

• Some of these civilizations might develop interstellar travel, thus they should have already reached Earth and we should have detected their existence by now.

So, “Where is Everybody?!” Something must be wrong with this chain of reasoning so, we will review about 30 solutions to the Fermi Paradox and even create our own solution.

Our gust Seth Shostak will lead part of the talk. Dr. Shostak is the Senior Astronomer and Director, Center for SETI research. Shostak earned his B.S. in physics from Princeton University and a Ph.D. in astrophysics from the California Institute of Technology. Since 2001, he has been Senior Astronomer at the SETI Institute, a not-for-profit organization whose mission is to “explore, understand and explain the origin, nature and prevalence of life in the universe”. Dr Shostak is an active participant in the Institute’s observation programs and has been hosting SETI's weekly radio show Big Picture Science since 2002

Dr. Jay Friedenberg will be here as well.

There will be free wine, cheese, and plenty of intellectual pleasure. Contact for any questions [masked]

Maestro Scarcella Perino will present two world premieres:
Piano Sonata No. 2, dedicated to Patrizia Di Carrobio
String Quartet No. 1
Other works being performed include Variations on Mozart’s Variations and Piano Concerto No.1, arranged for piano and string quartet.

Roberto Scarcella Perino has written three operas: Verdi, Merli e Cucú, A Caval Donato, and Blackout; three ballets: Colapesce, Constellations, and Basket-Dance. He graduated from the University of Bologna with a degree in Musicology and he taught music analysis at the Arturo Toscanini Foundation in Parma. Every summer, Scarcella Perino teaches a course on Italian Opera at NYU in Florence.

results.description:
Join the group for a relaxing, meaningful end to the workweek (not to mention Tax Day!). It will be a night of mindful touch, meditation, and real connections. Go into the weekend feeling warm, grounded, connected, and calm.

Spots are limited and will go quickly, so RSVP today.

This event is $30 for non-MeetUp members. You get an $8 discount for being awesome!!

Everything will be taken care of for you - all you need to do is bring a towel.

**This is NOT a sex party**

There are plenty of parties like that for our community. That said, the possibility of guys getting excited during massage is very likely. We ask that there's no oral and anal play for the sake of cleanliness and safety, and that if you do get off it doesn't become a show. Remember, this is about the power of real human touch and connection.

So...What should I expect?

• A guided meditation to start

• The room set up for massage exchanges: massage tables, oils, etc. Everyone will get a chance to massage and be massaged many times.

• Yoga mats and blankets to lay on if you need a breather.

• A relaxed, friendly environment. You can be clothed or nude, whatever you're comfortable with. This is a real "no judgment zone."

• The safety rules will be enforced - again, this is not a sex party.

• Water, refreshments, and nutritious snacks (fruit and vegetable plates, bars, and more).

• A BONUS handout guide to living mindfully and healthfully in this crazy city.

results.description:
This event (followed by reception) will be devoted to the eerie silence of our Universe. Enrico Fermi was an Italian physicist, who created the world's first nuclear reactor and was awarded the 1938 Nobel Prize in Physics. In response to a lunch time discussion about extraterrestrials, he asked the question “Where is Everybody?” (i.e. where are extraterrestrials).  This became known as the Fermi Paradox (1950). The basic points of the arguments are:

If there is nothing special about Earth or humanity, then whatever is true here should be true elsewhere in the galaxy.

There are billions of stars in the galaxy that are similar to the Sun and some of these stars will have Earth-like planets. Some of them might develop intelligent life.

Following this reasoning, Frank Drake predicted the existence of tens of thousands of advanced extraterrestrial civilizations (ETC) and Carl Sagan likewise predicted perhaps a million ETC. 

At least some of these ETC’s must be millions or even billions of years more advanced than us. Some of these civilizations might develop interstellar travel, thus they should have already reached Earth and we should have detected their existence by now.

So, “Where is Everybody?” 

Something must be wrong with this chain of reasoning so, we will review about 30 solutions to the Fermi Paradox and even create our own solution.

Our gust Seth Shostak will lead part of the talk. Dr. Shostak is the Senior Astronomer and Director, Center for SETI research. Shostak earned his B.S. in physics from Princeton University and a Ph.D. in astrophysics from the California Institute of Technology. Since 2001, he has been Senior Astronomer at the SETI Institute, a not-for-profit organization whose mission is to “explore, understand and explain the origin, nature and prevalence of life in the universe”. Dr Shostak is an active participant in the Institute’s observation programs and has been hosting SETI's weekly radio show Big Picture Science since 2002

Dr. Jay Friedenberg will join us as well

Before this event, from 4:30pm  to 7pm we conduct a seminar and 


discussion about Phenomenology of Edmund Husserl, who believed that phenomenology is the science of the essence of consciousness, the philosophical science of consciousness qua intentionality. We will review "the reflective study of the essence of consciousness as experienced from the first-person point of view”. Then we will return "to the things themselves" rigorous science of all conceivable transcendental phenomena, esp. meaning. Will touch a method of the critique of knowledge (the phenomenological method), and define phenomenology is the universal doctrine of essences, in which takes place the science of the essence of knowledge.

Our research has to be held in the pure seeing, but not for this reason has to be limited to the real immanent: it is research in the sphere of pure evidence and hence research of essences. We also say that its field is the apriori within the absolutely given in itself.

There will be free wine, cheese, and plenty of intellectual pleasure. Contact for any questions [masked]
results.name: Solutions for Fermi Paradox - Host: Prof. Bowen

results.description:
UPDATE: the Writing Room offered us a larger space a block away in another sister restaurant called Parlor steak and Fish due to the large RSVP confirmation. The Writing Room regrets the inconvenience but we do have a larger space for us, nearby. Hope you all make it!
------------------------------------------------

What is True Will? In this interactive lecture, Shelby Keizer will take us through the 12 archetypes of self and their relationship to the Hero’s Journey, in order to help us identify how we relate to these archetypes and, based on this, how to make changes in our lives that will impact our pursuits.

This lecture will explain concepts such as the Left Hand Path and self-knowledge through engaging activities and questions. The works of Aleister Crowley, Julius Evola, Carl Jung and others will be discussed in order to create a vocabulary and foundation for the concepts being introduced.

Always led by insatiable curiosity about the unknown, Shelby has been exploring the esoteric and occult worlds for the past five years. Her interests are diverse and include, among others: ritual magic, how to induce altered states of consciousness, enlightenment and divine will, spirits and otherworldly beings, ancient Egyptian mythology, and the Kabbalah

NOTE:

The Writing Room is a restaurant that has a rich history. It used to be Elaine's, where literary greats used to hang out with Woody Allen around the bar until the enigmatic owner passed away. The Library is the back area where we will be meeting. It is a perfect venue for our group. That said please order food so they will allow us to continue to use their space.
results.name: Exploring the Shadow Archetypes : The Left Hand Path

results.description:
Event Info

Welcome! Come down to the brewery for good times with good people! We'll be having an open session for all Hearthstone players. This is the fifth Fireside at this location. All prior events have been a great success. When you arrive, look for the tall guy with the Hearthstone shirt. As for the brewery, they have some excellent beer for $4 a pint. Don't be afraid to ask the bartenders for samples if you're having trouble making a choice. Seating may be limited, depending on the night, but no players have had issues finding tables so far. There's plenty of standing room, three bathrooms, and you can come & go as you please. The brewery doesn't sell food, but there's a Starbucks and Wayback Burgers in walking distance, as well as McDonald's, Burger King, Wendy's, Dunkin Donuts, Popeyes , 7-Eleven, Dairy Queen , and a diner all within a half mile. Brix City doesn't mind if you bring your own food in or get food delivered.

Who's invited
21+ only. (This is a brewery) All skill levels welcome. If you're new to the game, one of us will be happy to help you.
results.name: Battle at the Brewery

results.description:
Rio, Eu Te Amo (Rio, I love you) is an anthology: a collective feature film, composed of 11 dynamic short film segments created by 10 visionary directors from across the globe. The story line of each segment of the film focuses on an encounter of love in a different neighborhood of the city, demonstrating the distinctive qualities and character of that location. The film serves to bridge gaps between cultures, educating and entertaining the audience, while celebrating unique and universal expressions of love.


This is the delightful third entry in a series including Paris, je t'aime and New York, I Love You. 


Watch trailer: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=D4cVoeXQvp0


There will be a regular screening plus a Q&A with one of the Brazilian writers & Bebel Gilberto. I suggested you to buy your ticket in advance here, the price is $13.50.


Directors: Guillermo Arriaga, Stephan Elliott, Sang-soo Im, Nadine Labaki, Fernando Meirelles, Jose Padilha, Carlos Saldanha, Paolo Sorrentino, John Turturro, Anrducha Waddington. 2015, 110 mins. DCP.

FYI, the Museum of Moving Image showed the movie on Wednesday, April 13 at 7pm.
results.name: Brazilian movie night - Rio, eu te amo (Rio, I love you)

results.description:
Come join this wonderful on going FRIDAY EVENING co-ed (men and women) Yoga Class 7:15-8:15pm.  This is an adult yoga class for all ages and levels (if interested in children's yoga, please contact me).  Beginners are welcome and encouraged to join.  NO gym membership required.  Reiki is part of the entire class, however specifically given to each person during the quiet beginning of the class (meditation and centering) and at the end of the class during Savasana (the final pose). Each person receives Reiki during the entire class.  If you have a mat, you can bring it.  If you do not have a mat, I have some to share.  Please visit

www.CliftonYogaNJ.com

for more information or you can email through this meetup group or at [masked]. Text or call (email and text are fastest) directly (862) 621-9642.


Your first class is $10.  Future classes are sold in groups of 4 classes for $40 (still $10 per class).  NO gym membership required.  If you miss a class, you do NOT lose the class- it just stays in your account for future use :) but expires one year from purchase.  This is a wonderful class that builds upon your connection to your inner voice, connects you to your inner wisdom and divine consciousness.  You will build strength, flexibility and peace of mind... come join our group! :)
results.name: On Going FRIDAY EVENING Yoga with Reiki (both men and women are in this class)

results.description:
Admission: Members $10, Nonmembers $20 suggested donation, includes snacks and a beverage (wine, beer, soda)

Hooray for Friday — especially 3rd Fridays at The Café at Ethical, a welcoming place to unwind, relax, enjoy the music, refreshments, good company, and entertainment. 

This month we welcome MakerzMark — musician/singers Gregory Maker (bass), John Wilmeth (piano) , and Gary Fritz (percussion), and vocalist Steph Walker. This fabulous quartet embraces the history of jazz standards while sidestepping into different genres of music with ease. The traditional blends with the modern, the poignant with the playful. They can serve up a cocktail of different blends of music, all delivered with unique nuances of expression.

Entry to our 100-year-old building and meeting rooms is available for most wheelchair users with prior arrangements. Please call ahead  [masked] x 107) for setup of our portable system and plan to arrive one hour before start time.

results.description:
Every Friday we have a causal gathering of open minded souls, who
want to learn from Bhagavad Gita, the Vedic wisdom, and incorporate
in to their life. We will be learning various fascinating topics
like karma and reincarnation, Who am I, What is the real purpose
of life? Who god is? material life, Consciousness, etc.

Mantra meditation is the process of bhakti yoga consisting of
hearing and chanting the names of the lord on the beads, followed by
melodious music to invoke lord's mercy. This practice has a powerful
heart opening effect, which can be best understood through direct
experience. Come, relax in a warm and friendly atmosphere. Listen/observe
or just chant with us or sing your heart out! Questions, personal
realization, and discussion about the application of spiritual
practice are welcome.

Free Home made vegetarian/vegan dinner
(prasadam) served.

Admission to each meetup is free.
Donations for meetups expenses are welcome.

1. Please RSVP. Location given on the phone.

[masked]

Charu Gopika

results.description:
Educator, thinker, and media pioneer John Bredin’s lecture poses a humanistic re-imagining of the age old concept of fame. To reorient or “reboot” fame away from its vapid, bread and circus tendencies (which corporate media tends to promote), and nurture a new conception of ethical fame or deserved recognition for the 21st Century, Bredin’s provocative talk will focus on two overlapping and interconnected ideas:


1. That many of the wrong people are famous these days. At a time of impending global catastrophe, why are so many vapid “stars” elevated to household names while the work of planet-saving environmentalists, visionary thinkers, teachers, artists, writers, psychotherapists, scientists and activists is so little known outside of progressive intellectual coteries?

2. By making space for dialogue, storytelling, friendship, and humanistic learning in our communities, an “I & Thou” feeling of communion (Martin Buber) nurtures the soul with the sacred joy of interconnection. Empowered by an authentic feeling of recognition by others, as opposed to the alienation and invisibility so often imposed by capitalism, people are freer to develop their own creative identities (rather than star worship), and are more likely to engage in projects to make the world a better place.

Biography

John Bredin is the author of 12 books, including The Magic of Everyday Life, My Life as a Novel, and A New Theory of Fame. His writings have also appeared in The Brooklyn Rail, New York Press, and Evergreen Review. Whether in or outside of the classroom, John loves to open up liberating spaces for hopeful, aesthetic, and transformative dialogues. His weekly TV show Public Voice Salon, which he co-produces with his wife Claudia, is a rare democratic media space for citizen voices and for dialogues with visionary intellectuals 

All are welcome. Light refreshments. A program of the Humanist Foundation.  Info:[masked] [masked]  www.HumanistFoundation.org
results.how_to_find_us: Please use 76th Street entrance. The guard will direct you to our Meetup room.
results.name: How to Be an Actor in Your Own Life: Toward a Humane New Theory of Fame

results.description:
Okay this week its a serious TREAT! See the line up below. So some good news Dangerfield's Comedy Club the Longest running Comedy club in the world, started by Rodney Dangerfield himself 45 years ago has been generous to extend free tickets to our meetup group. This should be a fun meetup. This is not an Amateur or Gimmick Comedy show, Dangerfields features best of the best comedians who have performed in leading clubs, motion pictures and tv shows such as Tonight Show with Jay leno, Jimmy Fallon, Letterman, Seth meyers, Conan and Comedy Central. HBO's most successful comedy TV specials were taped at this club.

Im very excited to have the meetup here, We are getting tickets that are $40.00 each free for this group, its a 2 drink minimum as in any other club but if you get a drink at the bar before the show it counts toward the drink minimum which is very rare for a comedy club and theres a full food menu. If you want to just stop by have a drink and meet your fellow meetup members and not stay for the show you can do that too youll still get a ticket if you wanna use it for another time.

Hope to see you there. This week is a Killer Lineup! hosted by Q (Quinten Heggs), Lineup included Brian Scott McFadden (Tonight Show, Letterman, Comedy Central), Dante Nero! (Comedy Central), Ryan Reiss (Letterman), Patty Rosborough. The only place you might be able to get a line up as good as this is at the Cellar!

Ive personally never been to this club, but the Organizer will have a meetup sign, we all sit together, and meet each other so look for the meetup sign and the organizer will give you the Free Tickets.

Show Starts at 8:30, so come at 7:45 to meet your fellow meetup members! Enjoy!
results.name: Free tickets to Dangerfields Meetup- Brian Scott Mcfadden, Dante Nero!

results.description:
This is our Asia Business Network monthly meeting. We meet at a location near Grand Central in Midtown Manhattan for business networking. We are joined by English students from Asia, who are either working or studying as professionals in Banking, Business, Economics, and Finance. They are in America learning English and are interested in business relationships with Asians in America.

There are networking activities and a conversation topic is introduced to the group. There is a short lecture and there is discussion on the conversation topic. The conversation topic is always Asian Banking, Business, Economics, or Finance related!  Asian business current events are introduced to the group, and economic issues that are important to Asians in America are discussed. Social networking time is also given.

There is going to be an Asian language exchange and there is English language instruction offered at this event.

At the end of the meeting the group is invited to go to Karaoke, or an Asian club, bar, or pub. The location is usually in China Town or Korea Town.

The number of English students in the meetup is given to the right of the event organizers name as pluses to the meeting. The students include a large number of graduate students from Columbia and NYU.  Erik is the host of the event. Erik has had years of experience in hosting Asian events in New York. Erik is a established member of the Asian community in the area and he improves networking performance by encouraging social networking and giving coaching for relationship building.

Translation Services: There is a Chinese - English translator in the group, whose services are for members in need of them. There is a Vietnamese translator whose services are offered upon request. The group is planning on adding a Japanese - English and Korean - English translator also. Erik the organizer is also familiar with Indonesian and Mongolian. Indonesian and Mongolian translation services are also going to be offered upon request. Translation services are free.

When the monthly attendance for this event exceeds 30, it is going to be made a weekly event.

There is a $5.00 fee for attending this event.

Thank you,
Erik
The Asian Business Network Organizer
results.name: Cancelled! - Asia Business Network's Monthly Social!

results.description:
Are we going to let tax day take us down, NOT!  A great day to have some musical fun.


BRING:


Acoustic guitar (or mandolin, ukelele, banjo, or just your voice), music stand, tuner, capo, extra strings (just in case), and 12-15 copies of lyrics/chords sheets for 2 songs of your choice. 

7:00PM-ish - We try to have the room open for early arrivals.

7:30 - 9:15PM - Our usual group play. Choose songs with simpler chords that will be fairly easy for the group to play (and won't require a lot explanation). Otherwise, your songs - your choice.

9:15 - 9:30PM - Time for anyone who wishes to perform a song for the group. You don't have to be a pro or a great singer. If you are working on a song (original or cover) and want to try it out, here's your chance. Strictly voluntary but it's a great low-key, supportive environment for the experienced and novice to perform.

9:30 - 10:30PM - After we pack up our gear and straighten up the room, those interested can adjourn to Larchmont Tavern a few doors down for some socializing.
results.name: Let's Play and Sing and Forget About Them Taxes

results.description:
Open level class. Any level student can practice, taking the postures to a more challenging experience. Beginners are welcome, postures can always be modified to suit the individual. As always, listen to your body, take the postures to were it feels right for you and have fun! This class builds upon Basic  yoga postures, continuing our growth. Students always have the option to take this class where they desire... from a basic level and build foundation or to more challenging postures and flow techniques. It all depends on the individual and what their body needs ! Its an open field  for exploration and discovery.

 Breathing techniques focused upon during practice to connect the body and mind with the breath. Power Yoga builds muscle strength from the core outward, tones the body, creates endurance and stamina. Great for over all health. Breathing techniques calm the mind and ground the self.

There is a 15 minute optional deep relaxation and  guided meditation after class going deeper into chakra balancing.
results.name: Yoga - Open Class

results.description:
Whether you are a tournament player or a “newbie,” if you love making friends while playing the world's #1 Word Game, SCRABBLE, as we do then…

•   Come On Down!

      •   Bring A Guest! 

          •   Feel free to bring your Scrabble set and

               • Enjoy the night with us!

We normally meet EVERY 2ND AND 4TH FRIDAY

                         • EATING starts AT 7:30PM
              (whether it's dinner or just dessert/drinks)

            • GAMES START NO LATER THAN 8:15 PM.

In addition, (after an initial round of “Scrabble”) THE 4TH WEEK OF EVERY MONTH, we enjoy TEAM TRIVIA, pitting two teams of those who want to play against each other in a battle of wits over totally insignificant information.

(Those who are not trivia aficionados continue their Scrabble competition.)

Afterward, for those who want to hang and chill, we play a short group game, chosen at random. (TABOO has been the latest "hot choice.")

ABOVE ALL, WE HAVE ONE HOUSE RULE—

                          LET FUN BE #1!!!

It's Disco Fever all night long.  Doors open at 8:00pm.

Admission is only $10 per person.

The band is called Dancin' Machine and they are a 70's disco tribute band. Full of energy that keeps you on the dance floor all night long.

DJ St. Pete will be spinning vinyls all night.

The band goes on around 9:30pm and they play 3 sets. The club will close at 4am. So bring your dancing shoes because it's disco fever all night long.

Casual but proper attire. There is an appetizer menu available and the restaurant is also serving until 3am.

The place fills up so get there early!

results.description:
Gotham Atheists weekly Drinking With Atheists Friday Night Socials!

Join us for a great night of conversation in relaxed company in New York City. We go from 8pm to around 11pm or so.

Every Friday Night for 8 years we have gathered to enjoy the evening and the company of each other. Every week we meet at someone's apartment, a park, or a bar. DWA (Drinking With Atheists) is for Atheists, agnostics, Skeptics, Philosophers, Humanists, Freethinkers, Brights, secularists, inquiring minds, and all around nice people. No agenda but good light conversations. Great chance to meet new people and make new friends.

See you Friday Night.

Lee

results.description:
CSC’s MISSION STATEMENT:
THE COMMUNITY SUPPORT CIRCLE IS BOTH A TASK FORCE AND A VIEW OF HUMAN NATURE. WE CHALLENGE THE COMMON BELIEF IN RUGGED INDIVIDUALISM AND SELFISHNESS, AND THE ISOLATIONIST VIEW OF THE HUMAN HEART. OUR SOCIETY TEACHES THAT IT IS APPROPRIATE TO REJOICE AND COMPLETE THINGS ALONE; ALSO THAT WE ARE WEAK WHEN WE NEED TO ASK FOR HELP.
HOWEVER, WE ARE A GROUP THAT ASSERTS AND GIVES SOME LIFE TO THE FUNDAMENTAL INTERCONNECTION AND INTERDEPENDENCE OF PEOPLE. OUR VIEW OF HUMAN NATURE IS THAT PEOPLE ARE NATURALLY CARING TOWARDS EACH OTHER, WHEN THE RULES OF SOCIETY ARE NOT SET UP TO REWARD DEALING WITH PEOPLE AS COMMODITIES TO BE BARTERED IN THE MARKET PLACE.
IN ITS SIMPLEST FORM, THE COMMUNITY SUPPORT CIRCLE’S MISSION IS TO BE OF HELP TO ONE ANOTHER. WE SEEK TO REMEDY NEED, MAKE REAL AND PALPABLE OUR CONNECTION, AND FIND THE JOY IN GIVING. WE FIND THAT ALIENATION WITHERS FOR BOTH SIDES IN THE GIVING PROCESS, AND MEANING RIPENS, WHEN HELP OF ANY KIND IS GIVEN IN A SUPPORTIVE, CARING WAY.
Founder & Co-Leader: Rhea Lewin-Geberer

venue.name: David Koch Theater at Lincoln Center

results.description:
THIS EVENT IS SOLD OUT.

IF YOU DIDN'T BUY A TICKET, PLEASE DON'T COME

OUT PROFESSIONALS INVITES YOU TO PREMIERE A SPECTACULAR TRIPLE-BILL BY MIAMI CITY BALLET DURING THEIR LINCOLN CENTER DEBUT THIS SPRING.

On Friday, April 15, Members and friends of Out Professionals meet at Lincoln Center as Miami City Ballet, one of America’s leading companies, premieres a spectacular triple-bill. Experience Justin Peck’s exhilarating “Heatscape,” Liam Scarlett’s gut-wrenching “Viscera,” and George Balanchine’s glamorous “Bourrée Dantesque.”

Under Artistic Director Lourdes Lopez, Miami City Ballet ranks in artistic success and national recognition right behind the Big Two: New York City Ballet and American Ballet Theatre. According to Alastair Macaulay of The New York Times, “The dancers flood the theater with qualities of warmth and vitality that are like no other ballet company’s.” 

Miami’s Lincoln Center debut caps the company’s 30th Anniversary Season. Don’t miss this cultural highlight of spring in New York!

‘Heatscape,’ by New York City Ballet Resident Choreographer Justin Peck, 27. Environment by iconic street artist Shepard Fairey; edgy contemporary score by Sufjan Stevens; 17 dancers. “Ripples with energy … witty, whirling … a vital, exhilarating delight” (Miami Herald).

’Viscera,’ by Royal Ballet Choreographer Liam Scarlett, 29. Set to the hard-driving Piano Concerto No. 1 by acclaimed American composer Lowell Liebermann; 16 dancers. “Power and purpose … unforced high energy … a fierce, complex symmetry” (New York Times).

‘Bourrée Fantasque,’ by Russian choreographic legend George Balanchine. Delectable Gallic music, Emmanuel Chabrier; 42 dancers. Shown here for the first time in 20 years, this chic and witty work is “A celebration of French joie de vivre" (New York Times) and “The perfect finale to the bill” (Los Angeles Times).

WHERE
Lincoln Center’s Koch Theater, Columbus Avenue at 63rd Street. Subway: No. 1 to 66th Street, Lincoln Center; A/B/C/D to 59th Street, Columbus Circle.

WHAT'S UP
Opening Night of a triple-bill by Miami City Ballet. Doors open, 7:30 p.m. Performance, 8 p.m. sharp. Final curtain, 10:30 p.m.

ADMISSION
On receipt of your order, OP will contact you about where you want tickets mailed. Meanwhile, please print and retain the Eventbrite order confirmation. 

Photo Credit: ‘Heatscape,’ Gene Schiavone.

MEETUP ORGANIZERS WERE CALLED IN TO CONTROL THE HUGE NUMBER OF ELIGIBLE SINGLES SHOWING UP FROM ALL OVER CT AND NY!

THERE WAS UNCONTROLLABLE MINGLING AND CONVERSATIONS UNTIL 10 PM WHEN THE DJ SHOWED UP AT WHICH TIME THE MOOD BECAME EVEN MORE FESTIVE AND THE MAYHEM SPILLED ONTO THE DANCE FLOOR!

12 0THER  GROUPS WILL BE JOINING US!

HAVE A FUN AND EXCITING EVENING WHILE MEETING  PEOPLE FROM ALL OVER CT & NY IN A WARM, COMFORTABLE SETTING BY THE GREEN.

BRING SOMEONE YOU KNOW, A FRIEND, A NEIGHBOR, A CO-WORKER, OR GRAB AN EX RELATIONSHIP (ONE WITHOUT A RESTRAINING ORDER) AND GET DOWN TO ONE OF THE BEST SOCIAL MIXERS AROUND!

PARKING

THERE'S PLENTY OF PARKING RIGHT IN FRONT AND PLEASE USE THE SIDE BAR ENTRANCE BY THE OUTSIDE PATIO.

Just 35 min. from Brewster, 30 min. from Norwalk, 35 min. from Peekskill, and 40 min. form NYC.

THERE WILL BE A $5 COVER CHARGE AT THE DOOR FOR THIS EVENT REGARDLESS WHETHER YOU'RE DINING OR JUST AT THE BAR.

PLEASE PAY AS YOU ARRIVE AND EXACT CHANGE WILL BE APPRECIATED, THANK YOU.

NORTH STREET TAVERN

Welcome to the newly renovated North Street Tavern, right off of exit 25 on the Hutchinson River Parkway.

The North Street Tavern situated on the Maple Moor Golf Course has great food, a large bar, a outdoor patio and dining room, all overlooking the golf course.

The North Street Tavern serves up Westchester Counties finest brick oven pizza and exciting dishes in a unique ambiance. The authentic <a>menu</a> and friendly atmosphere creates a truly enjoyable dining experience for all.

DIRECTIONS

~From CONNECTICUT~

Get on 95 S. to 287 W. (Exit 21) then take the Hutchinson River Parkway S. (Exit 9S), get off at Exit 25 and take a right at the bottom of the ramp, the Golf Course will be on your right.

You can also get on the Merit Parkway which turns into the Hutchinson River Pkwy. and get off exit 25.

From Danbury, take 684 S. to Hutchinson River Pkwy. and get off at Exit 25, at the end of the ramp take a right and the Golf Course will be on the right.

group.name: AMAZING SINGLES aka "Amazing Single Men & Fabulous Women"

results.description:
The Rebel Alliance has recruited a team of rogues, misfits and ne'er do wells to infiltrate the criminal underworld of Nar Shadaa! Join the notorious Black Crows gang and assist the Rebels in undermining the influence of the Galactic Empire in the underworld of Nar Shadaa, the smuggler's moon.

This is a Star Wars: Age of Rebellion game that takes place on Nar Shadaa in Hutt Space. PCs are agents of the Rebel Alliance who pose as smugglers, bounty hunters and other scum while carrying out the agenda to free the galaxy of the Empire. Force Users are also welcome, as the ancient practices of the Jedi and other Force sects are the highest crimes that the Empire have decreed.

Character types from all three of the Fantasy Flight Star Wars games (Edge of the Empire, Age of Rebellion, Force and Destiny) are allowed, and the special FFG dice are provided. New players will be shown how to play this great game, so beginners are welcome.

results.description:
As always, lots of pickin and a'grinnin' good times and bluegrass tunes. No sheet music and all acoustic instruments.


A very highly suggested $10 donation is requested and there will be a tip jar there to put the money in. Any donations over the $10  have been said to create good luck and good karma for those who have donated and also help for the core folks who lug a PA system up and down multiple flights of stairs from their apartment and who come from far and wide to host the session.  :)

Also if there are some folks who want to brush up on some tunes that might be played, techniques, or jamming etiquette, etc-- some of the core folks of the jam also teach lessons on the various instruments so let me know and you could schedule a lesson or two  to prep or get extra practice.


Feel free to tell anyone and everyone to come. Lots of room for spectators, dancers, etc.
results.how_to_find_us: It is a one room place. You cannot miss us. :)

results.description:
ALL LEVELS ARE WELCOME

(If you are a beginner and wish to join the party, please come for a brief rating session before joining the party.  This is a social tennis group, rather than an instructional session.)

Also check out my website:

www.tennis-buffs.com

If you sign up via Meet Up site, you must call me to find out your start time.  I would like to stagger players.  You may or may not be able to start at 8pm, as it depends on how many spots there are left.  Thank you for your understanding.


Fridays, start 8pm
Cost $40, includes tennis, balls and food
6 Indoor hard courts

What better way to spend an evening than to be with people with common interests, playing tennis and meeting old and new friends.


It's a melting pot of wonderful cultures. You will play friendly and yet competitive matches. Off the courts, you will meet people and be engaged in conversations in a relaxed and congenial atmosphere.

If you are new to Tennis Buffs, please be sure to answer the survey so I know how to match you up with other players in a doubles game.  You can choose to play as many hours as you wish.  Just tell me when you RSVP, when you arrive, or before the next scheduled match.

Look forward to meeting old and new friends!

Penny Jung
Event Coordinator
www.tennis-buffs.com

results.description:
https://scontent-lga3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xap1/v/t1.0-9/12249801_1120131168065803_5466561352194304525_n.jpg?oh=ada413619f448a777c3f0363bca1cd6e&oe=57B50479

New to Blues dancing? Check out our FAQ. 


If you've never been to Friday Night Blues NYC before, it's a great idea to check out our policies on Blues etiquette and on harassment before coming.


****************************************************************************

SCHEDULE:

8:15pm-8:29pm - Class Check-in 
8:30pm-9:30pm - Fundamentals Lesson (Turns) w/ Jeanette and Melissa
8:30pm-9:30pm - Extended Topics (Really The Blues) w/ John
9:30pm-1:00am - DJ’d Dance w/ Stan and Reed

Stepping Out Studios is located at 37 West 26th St, 9th Floor. To get buzzed in, dial 9 and the green call button on the keypad to the right of the building entrance.

****************************************************************************

EXTENDED TOPICS:


Series This Month: Really The Blues

This Week: Travelin' Blues
Really, what is the blues? Join the national stars John and Shoshi Krieger-Joven for a month exploring the essence of the blues, and how to embody the blues aesthetic in your dancing.

Read more about our classes at: http://www.fridaynightblues.nyc/learning

****************************************************************************

DETAILS:

No need to bring a partner! Friday Night Blues NYC is a social dance; we dance with strangers, we dance with our friends... we want to dance with you! Our crowd can typically bring in anywhere from 50 to 150 dancers on any given evening.

The lesson costs $10, and the dance is $12 (sorry, cash only). Purchase both at the same time and pay only $20 for the night!

****************************************************************************

Volunteers get in for FREE!
Email [masked] to inquire about volunteer opportunities.

Stay informed: join our mailing list!

Friday Night Blues NYC is on Yelp! If you enjoy our event, please consider leaving us a review.

group.name: The New York City Russian Language Meetup Group

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC?


We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:40p. COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For questions contact [masked] |[masked]

Can't make this one? visit us at www.turnonny.us


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8OWkv9zms4E

You just got a bill from your Dr that isn't covered by insurance, Con-Ed somehow didn't get your payment last month, Bank of America is tacking on transaction fees when no transactions were made. Don't just sit there and take it.. There are 6 words that get results!

LET ME SPEAK TO YOUR MANAGER!!

Back by popular demand the "Let Me Speak To Your Manager" show is bringing you the best up and coming comics in NYC, all of whom have been featured on Comedy Central, MTV, Letterman, Fallon, Conan, etc..!

It all goes down at Stone Creek Bar and Grill in the back room.

Come down, enjoy some of the drinks from the fully stocked bar or some food off the awesome menu!

Seating is limited and by reservation only.  To Reserve a seat, RSVP through Eventbrite w. your best email and show your confirmation at the door. 

Eventbrite Link: http://bit.ly/1qRKMPE

Meetup starts at 9 in the front bar.  Look for the MEETUP signs!

Seating in the backroom starts at 930 and the show starts shortly after. 

The show is free and has a 1 item minimum.

Come out and celebrate the weekend with some laughs!

SPEED DATE ! SPEED DATE ! SPEED DATE ! Single Women meet Single Women !! Dress to Impress ! 

It's real simple:

You show up- dress to impress ! Drink, mingle and do your thangggg ! I then pair you up to meet AWESOME BEAUTIFUL WOMEN, again and again, (7 minutes each) to meet, mingle, network, friendship or maybe spark a date ! Ya never know who will catch your eye ! It's not your traditional speed-dating and so you don't wanna miss it ! 

-Friday April 15th 9PM

-"49 Grove" @ 49 Grove St. (between Christopher & 7th Ave.)

49 Grove is a modern classic style decor of oversized velvet couches, studded leather, huge silver-framed mirrors and black/white photography ! Excellent bar service along with great music. Great service, intimacy, comfort and style !! Whaaaaala !! 

Facebook invite: https://www.facebook.com/events/1567604540220198/


$10 per/person 

Sunny

results.description:
Climb aboard ZEPHYR, a one-of-a-kind luxury yacht, for an opportunity to view New York City from the comfort of multiple climate-controlled decks. Surrounded by spectacular sights outside and elegant amenities inside, you will glide past many of New York's most legendary landmarks, including the Statue of Liberty, the Empire State Building and the Brooklyn Bridge.

From start to finish, ZEPHYR provides a unique fun-filled experience. A cash bar is available on board to keep you refreshed along the way. Departs from Pier 16 in the historic South Street Seaport in Downtown Manhattan.

9:15 Boarding9:45 Set Sail12:00 We dock but the DJ keeps on rocking

Music by DangerKwest

Free Admission to Highline Ballroom After Party with ticket.

This is event is 21+ with proper ID

http://thedreamvine.com/anthony/house-on-hudson-w-dangerkwest

results.description: See "The Sensational Country Blues Wonders!" at Jimmy D's Blues Saloon, one of Hudson County's oldest Rock and Roll Music Venues. A hidden gem in North Bergen. Fully equipped with a pool table, darts and skeeball. We will be performing in the back room. This place is dive bar heaven!

https://scontent-lga3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xtp1/v/t1.0-9/11401142_1720823001478478_3682666258495805787_n.jpg?oh=6d3a52147bbb4787f69b1b492b283ec2&oe=56D0E6E4

Every Friday Night!
Salsa Dancing in Times Square is Back!
LA FAMA (151 W 46th St, 11th Floor) is a Latin Party that specializes in playing and dancing to Salsa Music. The event takes place where the bright lights are. That's right, Times Square. We have a nice floor, great ventilation, fun willing dancers, and your total expense for a Friday Night is 12.00

Mention Salsa New York at the door and it will be $10


You do not know how to Dance Salsa? No problem. We offer a Free Salsa class at 9:30pm every Friday. So come alone or bring your friends,. Either way, you are guaranteed to learn and have a blast.
You know what else is back? The music. LA FAMA is bringing the music back to the forefront. That's Right, DJ Mustachio will be in th building playing foot stomping flavorful Salsa songs to get those hips moving and grooving.
results.name: Salsa Dancing: La Fama Mention Salsa New York for the discount !

results.description:
BUY TICKETS HERE


Join us for our Quiet Clubbing Party, indoors at the Studio Square Beer Garden! Drinks, food, and 3 DJs spinning at the same time to keep you singing and partying all night. Don’t like what DJ 1 is playing, you’ll have two other choices to dance and have fun to.

DJ 1 (Green): Top 40 hits, Dance, Pop
DJ 2 (Red): The best of 80’s & 90’s, and 2K music!
DJ 3 (Blue): Hip-Hop, R&B

What the night includes:
Quiet Events Headphones
Glow in the Dark Gear
3 Live DJs battling for your attention

Special Notes:
Tickets are limited, so act fast!
This party is going on rain or shine.
Age Restriction: 21+

HOW IT WORKS
***Bring a credit or debit card for the check-in process*** When you arrive you’ll receive a pair of special wireless headphones. You can adjust the volume and choose between up to three DJ with a flip of a switch. Each headset has a color LED that shows what you are listening to, so you can dance along with those listening to the same DJ as you. It’s super social; just lower the volume or take the headphones off and talk to that girl or guy. There’s no loud music that you have to talk over. Plus, there’s no ringing in your ears when you leave. At the end of the night, be sure to return your headphones as there will be a $100 charge to your credit or debit card if headphones don’t come back.
results.name: $5 INDOOR Quiet Clubbing At Studio Square!

results.description:
***This is the same location- just out the back doors under the lights! Beautiful turf field provides for some beautiful soccer.  Full field - back up to 22 players!!

Join Friday nights intermediate/advanced players for some seriously fun, face-paced soccer under the lights at Hofstra University.   These games will be played on beautiful turf fields and are indoor/outdoor, depending on the season.  

Summer= Outside

Fall/Winter= Indoor

These games start promptly at 10:30 pm, please be on time or your spot may be given away to the walk-ons that do show up. 

The fee for this game is $15.00 which covers the cost of the field which you must pay even if you no show.  The field is expensive and the Club goes out of pocket for you if you do not show up! 

RSVP Rules apply!  Update cut off is 4:00 pm Friday.
results.how_to_find_us: Bubble Directions: Hofstra soccer bubble! Use Hofstra Blvd from Hempstead Tpke....from security booth, turn right after 2nd stop sign towards the athletic fields.  Drive all the way down until u c d dome on your right!!
results.name: Friday Night OUTDOOR Game (@ Hofstra)

results.description:
Friends,

Come and join us at this Friday, April 15 @ Skyroom rooftop. It's going to be a fun-filled evening.

Skyroom is conveniently located near Times Square, and many subway stations. 

This is a multi- Meetup group event, so you will get the opportunity to meet other members from my Meetup groups.

Do get there early so that I will be able to introduce you to the other invitees. Coming early also prevents you from the long lines.

Gents free before midnight. Ladies free before 1am.

Skyroom is definitely one of the top 5 rooftops in the city, and the Friday night party there is a lot of fun! Feel free to invite your friends to this event. 

Please note that the venue has a retractable roof so event will happen rain or shine.


Looking forward in meeting many of you!

Cheers,

Meetup Organizer

Rory

[masked]

RendezVous Rooftop Party

results.description:
This hike involves hiking the Long Path over 5 peaks in the southern Catskills!

Starting at the Peekamoose-Table traihlead on Route 42, we will take the Long Path (aka Peekamoose-Table trail) past some viewpoints to Peekamoose Mountain, then descend a bit and ascend to Table mountain. 

From Table, we descend on a fairly steep trail, cross the Neversink river and continue towards the Burroughs range. After some walking, we start the ascent towards Slide mountain up the Curtis-Ormsbee trail.

After about 2.4 miles we will reach Slide mountain, where there are some views of the surrounding peaks. The path goes down steeply to the notch between Slide and Cornell. It is not long before we reach the uphill to Cornell mountain, and then down the Cornell Crack to Wittenberg, where stellar views await!

After Wittenberg, we head down and make sure we bear right on the new Long Path to Phoenicia, which winds past scenic view points, mostly downhill, to Phoenicia!

Bring your cameras, headlamp, plenty of water & food. Rain/snow cancels!

The distances are as follows

• start - Peekamoose: 3.85mi

• Peekamoose - Table: 0.85mi

• Table - Yellow trail JCT: 2.75mi

• Yellow trail JCT - Curtis Ormsbee: 1.75mi

• Curtis Ormsbee JCT - Slide Mtn: 2.45mi

• Slide Mtn - Cornell Mtn: 2.3mi

• Cornell Mtn-Wittenberg Mtn: 0.8 mi

• Wittenberg Mtn - new LP JCT: 1mi

• New LP JCT - Phoenicia: 8mi

Total distance approx 24 miles, approx 6000' vertical gain

Everyone goes on the waitlist: I will take only experienced hikers who have hiked with me previously or have provided me with a hiking "resume" if you have not. This is a very demanding hike and there is limited opportunity for bailing out.

+++

NOTE: You are responsible for bringing appropriate gear, supplies, clothing, first aid, and lights. You should review topographic maps and trail features carefully; understanding topography of any hike is key to your knowing where you are, where you're going, and how to get back. See suggestions for GEAR on the "About" page for additional gear ideas. You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below. If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear. Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. Full waiver can be found on the ABOUT page.
results.name: Catskills Long Path: 5 peaks and *viewpoints* (24 miles!)

results.description:
<a></a>

<a>Do you want to be a part of America’s largest and longest-running sustainability & green event?</a>

Green Festival is coming to NYC for its 5th year of inspiring and empowering  New York’s consumers, communities and businesses to work green, play green and live green. Last year we featured hundreds of sustainable businesses in our marketplace and hosted over 20,000 visitors; and we couldn’t have done that without our Green Team volunteers.

The Green Team is at the core of the Festival, helping spread the word by distributing posters and flyers across the city, inviting socially responsible businesses in their community to exhibit and lending a hand on the ground during the event itself on April 15th-17th.

We’re also in need of volunteers to promote our new Bill Back Five initiative, in which Green Festival exhibitors and media partners are able to provide a special code for Festival attendees. Entering the code when they buy their ticket will not only give the buyer a discount, but will give $5 back to the organization that provided the code!

Green Team volunteers get access to a whole lot of amazing perks, including free entry to the Festival, invitation to the NYC Green Festival VIP launch party, the opportunity to advertise your organization through Green Festival’s social media platforms and more.

Want to learn more about volunteering for the Green Team? We’re hosting a volunteer meet-and-greet at 7.00pm on Monday February 29th at the New York Institute of Aromatherapy. Join us for light snacks and refreshments and sign up for the team!

2016 GREEN FESTIVAL EXPO VOLUNTEER REGISTRATION NOW OPEN!

Slots are filling up quickly! Log into you account and sign up for shifts TODAY:

http://greenfestivals.volunteerhub.com/

results.description:
The courts at Crotona have finally been unlocked and are ready for our arrival!!!

I can't wait to see you all out there! :)

---- FAQ ---- 


What will we be doing at the Meetup? 
We will be meeting at the tennis courts for some friendly rallying, doubles, and singles play*. This meetup is open to players at any skill level; from beginner to advanced.

*For those of you who are interested in singles play, please keep in mind that the ability to play singles predicates on the amount of members who have RSVPed as well as court availability at the meetup event's venue. We cannot guarantee singles play in every instance.

How long will the meetup be? 
The time listed for the meetup event is when you can expect to the event host to be there. If you would like to arrive earlier or later than the start time listed, please leave a comment in the meetup event you plan to attend. This will give everyone in attendance a good representation of who is showing up at what time.

What will it be like? 
Our group is very friendly and loosely organized to allow for a fun experience.

Upon arrival, our event host will announce which court they are on in the comments of the meetup event. If you have a smartphone, we strongly suggest that you download the Meetup app for iPhone or Android to make communication easier.

When you arrive at the courts, look for the event host listed or other members of the group playing on (or near) the courts listed. Use the photos of each host/member on the website as a frame of reference.


Introduce yourself. Let the host know your level of play and you will be assigned to a court immediately.

Do members need to bring anything? 
All members must bring their own racquet. Unfortunately, we do not supply racquets.

All members are encouraged to bring a fresh can of new balls. You can always use a marker to mark your initials on your ball if you would like to keep them for future play. Please keep in mind that tennis balls only last a couple of days after taking them out of the can before they lose their bounce.

If you plan to donate to the group, you can leave your donation with the meetup event host or the head organizer, Frank, if he’s in attendance. All donations go towards the fees required to organize the meetup.

Who should come? Are newcomers welcome? 
Our meetup event is open to all players whether they're an absolute beginner or an advanced player. Players will be matched up with others based on their skill level. Beginners will be given an opportunity to play with higher level players so they can gain more experience with higher consistency.

It is a high priority for our group to help beginners increase their skill and become better players. If you are reading this and are an absolute beginner, please don't be intimidated. We want you to join us and have fun.

What should a newcomer expect? 
If you're new to the group, you'll learn very quickly that our community is extremely friendly. We have a colorful cast of characters from all walks of life who are ready and willing to have a good time.

Whether you're interested in easy-going rallying or competitive play, we can accommodate you.

Questions? 
If you have any other questions, concerns, or comments; please send them to our head organizer, Frank Tirado via email.

results.description:
***UPDATED[masked] - w/ start locations and contact info***

Following the success of our recent first group ride, mark your calendars for the second official NYC Adventure Cycling Club 'overnighter'.  

This ride will take us from Brooklyn to Fahnestock State Park.  It will include two start locations, which will allow for multiple distance options depending on skill level (or laziness in David's case).  


Group A will meet/depart from 718 Cyclery in Brooklyn.  Group A will then meet Group B at Van Cortlandt Park - 242nd St subway station.  Chris and Colin will lead Group A.  David will lead meeting for Group B at Van Cortlandt Park - 242nd St subway station (just at bottom of stairs on park side).  After meeting as a unified group we all ride together.  

Contact David w/ questions -[masked] 

Group A will ride ~70 miles each way (from 718 Cyclery).  Group B will ride ~50 miles each way (from Van Cortlandt Park).  

Who: NYC Adventure Cycling Club members 

What: Overnight ride from Brooklyn to Fahnestock State Park 

When: Saturday, April 16th - Sunday, April 17th 

Where: Two group departures outlined below...

Group A (overachievers)  - 718 Cyclery at 7:30am

Group B (underachievers) - Van Cortlandt Park - 242st 1 subway at 9:45am 

Why: Porque no?  Will be a leisurely paced ride on majority sealed tarmac. ~70 miles each day (or ~50 miles for Group B). Rough agenda below...

Saturday: 

7:30am: Group 'A' meet at 718 for coffee and check tire pressures 

8:00am-10:00am: Group 'A' departure/ride

10:00am:  Meet Group 'B' at Van Cortlandt Park - 242st 1 subway stairs

10:00am-4:00pm: Riding w/ mid-day stop in Elmsford

4:00pm: Set up camp (actual camp location TBD)

Sunday: 

8:00am: Break down camp 

9:00am-5:00pm: Riding (can shave off considerable time and distance by hopping multiple train options) 

5:00pm: Finish ride at 718 

*Note* - Day two we plan to head the opposite direction and into Cold Spring for breakfast.  That provides train option # 1 for people who want to split and head directly to Grand Central.  The rest will then head down 9d, cross Bear Mtn Bridge (with epic views of Storm King Mtn), then pick up 9w. Second train option is after GW Bridge at 175th back to the city.  

Minimum you'll need...
+ Bike (organizers are on road touring options)
+ Flat repair kit (tubes, patches, tools, pump, etc)
+ Sleeping option (tent, hammock, bivy, etc)
+ Appropriate clothing (may get cold)
+ Water/snacks
+ Small amount of $ for food/drinks along the route

+ Still not charging for these rides, but $5 to the organizers to cover cost of campsite/s is MUCH appreciated.  

***Disclaimer - Upon RSVP of this Meetup, you agree to “bear all risks” and release the organizers and event hosts from claims, demands, and damages arising out of your use of the platform. Group organizers are not guides. Bicycling on public roads contains risk. Attendees understand and intend that this assumption of risk and release is binding upon their heirs, executors, and guests who are not active members of the New York Adventure Cycling Club Meetup group. Long story short, if you choose to join for rides, organizers are not responsible for participants health, safety, and/or well being.
results.name: NYC-ADV Ride 002 /// Fahnestock State Park

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
Join us at 8am for a run to Hoboken Pier A and back.
http://www.mapmyrun.com/routes/view/121375029

Yes, there is a waterfront route to Hoboken. Enjoy the fun of cruising around Hoboken Pier A; around the new park and children playground at Newport where you will feel if you are at the beach. Get inspired by the man made majestic views of Manhattan!

The mapped distance is approx. 5.88 miles. You may run less or more in that time. We turn back after running 30 min to be back at 9 am. Hyatt pier is .31 miles so a double loop gets some runners 6.5 miles on this run.

9 am we run to Liberty State Park, a favorite place to run for most of us. Run on!

results.description:
We'll meet in front of the Red Barn Bakery for a run on the Old Croton Aqueduct. Afterward, whoever is interested can head to the Red Barn Bakery for breakfast. This is a good run for new runners because it is out and back - no set distance to cover but you will need to wear a watch. Feel free to turnaround at any point or walk/run at your own pace. 

Details about the Saturday run

Route: We’ll meet in front of the Red Barn Bakery (4 S. Astor St.) in Irvington and jog VERY casually together to the Old Croton Aqueduct trail. (If you are unfamiliar with the area and would prefer to walk rather than run to the trail, click here to see the trail on a map.) From there we’ll head south toward Dobbs Ferry. There is no set distance. Everyone will walk or run at their own pace for 25 minutes, and then turn around and come back. Please wear a watch so that you know when to turn around.

Water/Bag Storage: There are very few water fountains along the route, so bring a water bottle if you need one while running. I’ll bring water and cups for after the run. There’s no bag storage, so leave belongings at home or in your car.

Location: In front of Red Barn Bakery (4 S. Astor St, Irvington, NY 10533). Free parking is available on weekends in the MetroNorth lot next door.

</a>  <a href="https://www.facebook.com/groups/1452433901730637/">Join our Facebook group to post pictures or message other members.

General advice & guidelines for our regular meetup runs:

• RSVP if you are going. If your plans change, simply change your RSVP.

• There is no bag storage, so please bring only what you plan to run with.

• All regular runs are rain or shine, unless the weather is actually dangerous.

• If you arrive late, can’t find the start location, miss us for any reason, run anyway!

Feel free to contact me either via my meetup account or at [masked] if you have any questions.

results.description:
When people hear about meditation, they almost always say that they have either never tried it or they were not able to do it. You may have expected that thoughts were supposed to go away, but when you closed your eyes, more thoughts than ever came up.

We invite you to come and experience how meditation can happen effortlessly with a little attention to our very own breath! The free session will include light yoga, breathing techniques and relaxing meditation and will be led by one of the volunteers of the Art of Living foundation.

 

Art of Living Secaucus Center
Email: <a>[masked]</a>

results.description:
Google Maps Link to Parking Area

Plateau, Sugarloaf, Twin, Indian Head
------------------------------------------------------------------
12 Miles / 5050' Elevation Gain
------------------------------------------------------------------

Time and Pace:

8:30am Meetup.
9am Estimated Hike Start.
Minimum Pace:  1.5 MPH Overall Average
9 Hours.
In the cars by 6pm!


With this much elevation change, this is not beginner pace, but if you get regular cardo, it shouldn't be a death-slog.

------------------------------------------------------------------
Notes:

In order to put the heavier elevation change earlier in the day, the plan is to go West-East.

I'm hoping for some warm weather this week, but let's still bring our microspikes.

The meetup location is the meeting / ending location (Prediger Road Trailhead).  At 8:30am, stronger hikers will be asked to transport everyone to the starting location, at Notch Lake.  Please have passenger seats cleared. 


Devil'sTombstone State Campground is closed, so parking will be free.


Indian Head Wilderness!


Group Size Limit is 20.

RSVP's Close Friday at Midnight.


http://files.meetup.com/1338658/Eastern%20DP.bmp

Click To Enlarge Image Above

<a href="http://files.meetup.com/1338658/Eastern%20DP.bmp"></a>


------------------------------------------------------------------
Planned Route:

Starting from the middle of the Devil's Path. You will be hiking East.  At the bottom of every col there will a at least one way down; don't do it!  You must first hike Plateau, Sugarloaf, and Twin.  Only after Twin can you take a shortcut down "Jimmy Dolan Notch" to the "Prediger Road" trailhead.  (Saves about 1 Mile / 550'.)  To instead complete the Devil's Path, continue over Indian Head.  After coming down the other side, the trail takes a rather sharp left-hand turn toward the Prediger Rd Trailhead.

------------------------------------------------------------------
Additional Notes:

As always, GPS with the points below, maps, and tracks is recommended, and map/compass/headlamp required.

National Geographic Trails Illustrated Map - Catskill Park $12


Bring more than enough cloths, food, water, and batteries.

Please do not show up without an RSVP or contacting a host.

------------------------------------------------------------------
Navigation:

Unless you are familiar with the area, if you have a GPS, please load these items:

Points and Tracks on GoogleMaps

Prediger Road Trailhead (Meeting / Ending):[masked], [masked]
(DMS Format:  42° 8'2.31"N, 74° 6'15.75"W)


------------------------------------------------------------------
Waivers and Stuff:


If you join this event you are responsible for yourself in all regards; including but not limited to the following.  You must be prepared to navigate yourself to your objectives and back to your vehicle.  Which means being familiar with the route prior to arrival, and bringing whatever navigation aids necessary.  You must know the mileage / elevation gain / terrain / planned pace, and be familiar with your ability to traverse them, and what gear is recommended for yourself given the conditions.  Unless the meetup is labeled as "Beginner", it is your responsibility to gauge your ability to keep up with the group and get to the vehicles within a time-frame as to not cause alarm; this may mean that you may not meet all of your objectives.  Your first objective is always to get back to the vehicles safely, and let the rest of the group get on with their trip, so keep track of the time, turn around if you need to, and try to let people know if you think you might disappear.  There will be no gear-check, but extra food, extra water, rain layers, headlamp, lighter, compass, and whistle, should be things that you are very rarely without.  Most people are unfamiliar with how quickly rain on a previously 90 degree day can become a survival situation, so it warrants saying that, if there is any chance of rain, you need raingear.

------------------------------------------------------------------

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver.

Full waiver can be found on the ABOUT page.

results.description:
As many of you know, philanthropy is one of the cornerstones of beer club, so for the 2nd year, we are putting together a team for NY Cares Day! If you’ve ever participated in this event in the past, you know it’s a very fun, fulfilling and tiring day of volunteering around NYC.

Our target is to get a team of at least 15 people together so we can have the majority of a work site. Registration is required through the NY Cares Day website. Right now, I’ve asked for a volunteer site in either Manhattan or Brooklyn but we’ll have to wait and see how many volunteers we get to help determine the location. We will have the location confirmed by April 5.

Volunteering is a fun way to get together and support our wonderful city, so I hope to see a lot of you out there!

Special Notes: 

You must register on the NY Cares website to participate! You won’t be eligible to volunteer just by signing up here 

April 11 is the last day to join the team! 

Bring a snack to tide you over until the end of the day!

Instructions for registering: 

-To register, go to the main NY Cares Day website https://www.newyorkcares.org/new-york-cares-day-spring/team?tid=a024000000VymPiAAJ 

-Click on the green “sign up” now button in the middle of the page on the right -Then click “register now” on the page to which it takes you 


-Agree to the waiver 

-Click “join a team” and then "view all teams" and select “NYC Gay Craft Beer Lovers” from the drop down list (Once you register, you may to go back to the "Join a Team" page if it doesn't automatically direct you there) and then select "View All Teams".  

If you are on the fence about joining, check out photos from the event we participated in last spring.  It was an amazing day! 

http://www.meetup.com/GayBeerClub/events/221257710/ 


Let me know if you have any questions.  

Cheers!Bill

results.description:
Check out the longest and tallest railroad trestle east of Mississippi, climb the tallest mountain in the Orange county, survey the landscape for miles from the top of the ridge, and explore the ancient megaliths!

The Hike: 

We'll do a 10 mile long loop, starting with the Trestle trail, then taking the Western Ridge trail to the Jessup trail.  About 5 miles into the hike we'll take a lunch break at the summit and spend some time exploring ancient megaliths. After the lunch break, we'll continue following the Jessup trail, until we reach the Otterkill trail which will lead us back to the parking lot. This is a moderately difficult trail, with a few lengthy steep sections and with some rock scrambling. The entire hike with all breaks, at a decent pace, should take about 6 hours. 

Gear:

Proper footwear is essential for this hike - a pair of comfortable, broken-in shoes, with good traction. Please no flip-flops, clogs, skate shoes and similar footwear on this hike. 

Bring enough water for the entire day. There is no water source anywhere along this hike, so come with your bottles/hydration packs filed up and ready to go.

You will need a small backpack to carry your food, water, and extra clothing. On some portions of this hike you will need to use your hands to climb up rocks, so you need your hands to be free.

The weather in the early spring can be unpredictable, and with a bit of a wind chill at the summit, a sunny day can turn into a cold one - so be ready and dress in layers. Bring an extra layer, a hat,  and rain/wind jacket that can fit into your backpack. A pair of gloves can be helpful on a cold, windy day.

As on any given hike - it is always a good idea to have your own map of the area you are hiking. You can purchase NY/NJ conference's West Hudson trail map pack - map 114, or at least print out this map:

</a>

(<a href="http://images.summitpost.org/original/185628.jpg">)

Sunblock and insect repellents are good to have handy.

We should be done with this hike long before it gets dark, but it's always a good idea to pack a headlamp/flashlight - for unforeseen circumstances.

Getting there: 

We will carpool, and share the cost of gas/tolls. Drivers - please use comments field to offer rides to other members of the group.

Driving Directions 

From the New York State Throughway/I-87 North, take exit 16 onto US 6, heading West. Drive about 5 miles, and then follow signs for Route 208 North. After about 3 more miles, make a slight right onto Clove Road/CR 27. After about 4.5 miles, turn right onto Otterkill Road. Look for the parking area on the left.

 GPS Coordinates: [masked], [masked]



DISCLAIMER

Participation in activities is strictly voluntary and group members assume all risks in connection with activities; per Meetup.com's Terms of Service Agreements, organizers and hike/trip leaders are released from any and all forms of liability related to events.Full text of our liability waiver can be found on the following page:

http://www.meetup.com/Adventure-Outlet/pages/Risks_and_Waiver_of_Liability/
